review: The service was excellent and the front staff got us a table rather quickly for a party of 8.  I read the other reviews and stayed away from the ziosk.  I had the steak fajitas which was a nice portion. I wish that they were sucking hot at the table, they weren't. But the still were good. The ribs looked great as well as the garlic and shrimp.
1/21/17. I just left TGIF. Me and friend was at the Bar, It took 15 minutes before the waiter acknowledge us. I had to ask for service. It was the worst experience. I Will NEVER GO Back.

Love their $10 endless Apps... we couldn't even finish our second round!!! Hehe... I should have ordered the appetizer I like from the menu regardless the deals. I paid cash and it took them too long to bring back the change. we couldn't wait, so ended up giving more tip than we plan to give. However, the waiter was very considerate and offer us the second round of order even before we finished the first round! Definitely come back!!!
We came for late night desserts.  The cake part is a little bit dry but still ok. Price is reasonable.

Thought we had great idea. Let's go to TGIF !! What a disaster !! Been here for 2 hours. Sitting at the bar. Unable to get a drink. Still waiting on our 2nd order of appetizers. Seen people come & go couldn't get a drink. Won't be back. They just provided a free drink. It came out quicker then the one I ordered 20 minutes age. Sad

Never again will we go to this restaurant. Our waitress had  NO people skills. She was rude from the get go. It took about 15 minutes to get her to take our order and she only came over after we asked to talk to the manager. We requested another server because I wasn't going to sit all night waiting for service. The manager said we were have another server. The new guy came over and helped us 3 times then the other one came back and acted like she had never been replaced.  The food was bad. My daughter ordered the PARMESAN crusted chicken and when it was served it had a very strong lemon pepper smell and taste. My daughter can't tolerate so much pepper and couldn't eat the chicken. The worthless waitress said she will talk to the manager. When our check was brought it still had $14.99 for the chicken. I called her back over and asked WHY we are paying for the chixken, it was still sitting on my daughter's plate. She cut it up and took one tiny bite. The manager came over and got defensive of the doos. Saying the PARMESAN crusted chicken is made with a LEMON PEPPER crust. That's how it is made. It's supposed to taste like that. Then why call it PARMESAN? Call it LEMON PEPPER? After much back and forth with this manager I finally said, "so we are expected to pay for this? Your resturant can't title food properly and an child almost eats a mouth full of pepper and that's ok? Fine....." that's when she swiftly took the check and said it will be removed. What a nightmare that place has become. I'm never going back.

We went there on a Thursday evening and the place was packed due to football and baseball games that were on.  We did not have to wait to long, 15 minutes or so for a table.  We ordered an Electric Lemondade and Long Island Tea which were both really good.  For dinner we ordered there 2 for $14.99.  My husband got the ribs and steak, I got the bacon-wrapped shrimp and steak.  My husband loved the ribs but said his steak tasted sour.  I tasted my steak and it also did not taste right.  Also, the bacon on my shrimp was maybe half way cooked.  Our waiter Johnathon was fantastic!  He took our steaks and asked if we wanted new ones, we said absolutely not and asked if we could get two sets of ribs to go since they were the only thing enjoyed at dinner and he said no problem.  When we got up to leave, my shoe was actually stuck to the floor.  It looked like the floor underneath the tables are never washed, they are black.  Also when we were leaving, the door to exit was sticky, gross!  I doubt we will be back there again.

Friendly and fast service from my waitress and got my food fast nice and hot. Got everything as expected from being on top with our drinks to asking if we needed anything else. Overall great service mean happy customers
This place is good for late night munchies hungry people after a good  movie or after long walks Shopping @ the Block!

I really miss the days when Friday's had its 3 course for 20 deal. Rarely could you finish the both the appetizer and the entrees, let alone the scrumptious desert. Unfortunately, now they've increased their prices and they only have a 2 course for 20 with limited options. I'm pretty sad that you are only stuck with a few appetizers and entrees to choose from (now you have to pay extra for the sirloin...). But it's understandable since such good deals in the past are not sustainable. Prices aside, Friday's is actually a really good restaurant. Their steak is amazing, their appetizers are appetizing, and their desert is worth trying. However, I'm just disappointed that it's so costly now.  Also, I noticed that my last review was taken down. I guess they make a clean sweep of their business page once every so often. But it's cool. Eat well and prosper,
Called in a to-go order on a Saturday night. Food was ready for pickup in 15minutes. The order was right and the food tasted great.

Holy cow!  Portions are small. The place is dirty. I gave two stars. One for the server, who was friendly, and one for not getting sick. The table, seat, wall where we sat was gross. I hope the kitchen is cleaner than the bathrooms. I will not return to this location.

Disappointed with the service! Waiter took forever getting our drinks and coming back around to take our order.  Decided to try the Sriracha shrimp roll. Not too bad.  FYI:  location is super busy, so be patient while waiting for a table and service.

Guys, going down hill. I have been enjoying your good for 15 years. I ordered your jack Daniels platter, it was weak, less pop corn chicken, less shrimp, less ribs. Guys C'mon let's make the customer happy. I live Fridays but looks like i need to go to mom and pop restaurants top get the quality i use to get a Fridays. Bring it back and I'm be back. I also ordered the sizzling chicken and . Shrimp the chicken was totally rubberized. The onions were terrible and the mash  potatoes were OK. Bottom line please re assess your menus. I really want to come back.

Despite some bad reviews, my boyfriend and I loved it here! He got the "chicken and shimp sizzler" (I think that's what it's called) and I got the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken pasta. I'd give it 5 stars, but I'm not a fan of cheese (I can tolerate it to a degree)  So we got there and we were a bit confused. No one bothered to take us to a table for a good 5 minutes and it was pretty empty since it was a Thursday. A waiter eventually sat us down at a booth. Our waiter was quick and very nice! We didn't have to wait so long for our food. Both dishes came out hot, his came out sizzling. Both of our plates looked really good, and thankfully, it tasted just as good! I loved their pasta cause their sauce was really creamy and didnt clump up after 15 minutes like Olive Garden's pastas. I had a few bites of his plate and the chicken and shrimp had great seasoning! Then we got the brownie dessert and that was super good!  Overall:  Food: Good Portion: It won't fill you up, but they give you exactly enough so that you don't throw away the portions you couldn't finish Price: Great! Our brownie was $3.99 when the menu said $6.99 Service: Other than not being led to our table right away, it was pretty good!

I don't understand why the ratings are so low.  I have had nothing but a great time everytime I been to this place.  Plus you know hot chicks left and right but I digress.  Back to the food itself.  I had burgers, steaks, etc. and they all tasted fantastic to me.  The service can be ehh at times but sometimes people can get fatigued.  I know I would so I try not to judge waiters and waitresses on that aspect.  Its tough serving food, but the employees here try the best they can.  The waiting can be long depending on certain days, sporting events, etc.  I have yet to try happy hour but I assume it would be packed house too.  This place is so close to home to me that I'd come back more often than not.

Horrible service. They quoted 45 min and we were still waiting after an hour. Every time we checked in they kept saying it was much longer than expected . If they would have quoted the right time In the beginning then I wouldn't have wasted my time !

I should've known before I came in that we were going to have a problem. I hate chains for this reason. They're not desperate to get people in the door and know even if they give crappy service someone will show up. It started off okay but very slow. We got our drinks after about 10 minutes and then it's like time froze around us. Almost a full 70 minutes later we got our appetizers, our drinks weren't refilled, and we didn't have silverware. 90 minutes after sitting down we finally get our food and the plates are scorching hot and the food was barely warm so it was clearly sitting in the serving window for an extended period of time. Our server never came back to fill drinks or check on us.  It was the worst experience and I don't ever want to go back. Manager comped our meals since we didn't touch them and gave us coupons for a free appetizer *when* we come back but that's not happening. Spend your money elsewhere at an establishment that is local and way better.

The food took forever to come out.  My mac and cheese was hot, my steak was cold, my prawn size lobster was over cooked and cold.  The server took forever to come back.  Spent more time waiting around than eating.  This was on a regular week night.   I do not know what i come back to this place since It always sucked.  Oh wait I know why.  Because other people suggest this place.

We walked in tonight (on a Friday) around 7:00 pm and it was pretty busy but it only took 15 to seat 2 of us and our toddler. Our waitress was really nice and she checked on us frequently. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars tonight is because our $12 endless apps were terrible. I feel that it is such a big promotion that they just have the appetizers waiting on the kitchen table ready to go out because everyone is ordering them.. The problem was our spinach dip was cold, our boneless wings were also cold and a little undercooked so we sent those back, and then our last appetizer we tried was the potato skins and they were so overly deep fried that there was barley even any potato in the skin (if that makes any sense)... Long story short, just order regular food because the appetizers were not appetizing at all.

They  have great happy hour specials. I ordered wings and a drink. They're drinks are good too. The reason for the lower rating is because the food is ok, nothing special.  The service was the worst I've experienced at a tgi's. The waitress seemed so uninterested, never smiled. And it took forever to get our food. We were 3 people and we ordered 4 food items. There was a larger group of 6 that got there after we had ordered and they got their food before we did. (40+ min after we had ordered) That's when the waitress finally decides to notice us and ask about our food. She comes out with our food and forgets about my friends order.  I just think that service in the outlets of orange area is just bad. I had a similar experience at bj's in the same area.

Or soon is lactose intolerant and it was his birthday. We checked to see if they could substitute the birthday sundae for a brownie instead and they checked with the manager and said it would be no problem. Then when the end of the meal can't, they pretended like that conversation never happened. It wouldn't have been a big deal if they had said that in the beginning, but instead they told is that the person who told us that it was okay was new.  That's just terrible customer service. Will never come back here again.

We came here before going to a ducks game, and I could tell there were a lot of regulars, always a good sign.  There was a 15 minute wait for a table, so we went to the bar and were lucky enough to find two seats at the bar. The bartenders were crazy busy, so service was a little slow, but I didn't feel like I was being ignored by any means. They were all very nice, and I could tell they were really liked by the people around us who knew them. They have a really good happy hour. I think they had 6oz wine for $4 and 9oz for $6 -- so obviously I got the big one. They also have 1/2 priced apps, and my SO got a plate of chicken wings that looked bomb. Oh, and a plate of fries for a $1.50. I decided for forgo the apps because they have a gluten-free turkey burger, with an actual bun! With the slaw as a side (that I put in the burger) I was in heaven.  I will definitely make sure we have time to get drinks here before going to ducks games from now on, because the deals are totally worth it.

We were greeted promptly when we entered & the waiter was semi-attentive, but when our meal arrived the chicken that I ordered was cold, the blue cheese to go on it was missing & the piece of chicken was overwhelmed by the massive bun.  I had to ask twice for the waiter to come, and he was totally unapologetic when I said I wanted HOT food prepared the way it's described on the menu... When we left the hostess was too busy playing games on her phone to notice us leaving - that says it all! This was the first and last time I will eat at a TGI Friday's!
Great place to watch Football and have beer and half price appetizers. Has been a Sunday tradition for awhile!

Most people are fairly familiar with TGI Friday's, so let's get to what makes this location stand out. First off, this location for some reason gets really busy. It doesn't matter the day of the week. Especially at night, be ready to hurry up and wait for a table, even for small parties. The waiting area isn't very big either (as it seems with most TGIs), so if it's especially busy, be ready to wait outside. Speaking of waiting, be prepared to wait for your food after ordering. It could be because of the high levels of business, but on average, I've had to wait about 15-20 minutes for food to hit the table (for a party of 2). The service here is average. I've had both great experiences and really poor ones, so it all sort of balances itself in the end. Food quality itself, again, sort of fares on the average side of things. Overall, when coming to this location for a bite, don't be too surprised if you have to wait a bit for your chow. Other than that, nothing should be too disappointing.

I hope I'm writing this review for the right TGIF because there are two on Yelp and looks like same location! Well any who me and my friend came here one night and thankfully there were some tables open in the bar area. Our server was cool and nice. I'm glad they don't have that 2 for $20 anymore because I thought they had sucky options. I'm not a fan of there pasta here but I got the 1/2 rack baby back ribs and they were delicious. Now they have this new special, I think they have I items for $2, $4, $7+. I may be wrong on that part. I know for sure they have plates for $7. The baby back ribs that I got were only 13.99 and they came with two sides. Well when I ordered the server said it only came with one side but when it came out, I had two sides on my plate haha so maybe he forgot it really did come with two sides. The sides I chose was the baked potato and Mac n cheese. Surprisingly the Mac n cheese was really good. Because I am not too fond of their pasta here, I thought the Mac n cheese was going to be horrible. But I chose the Mac n cheese because I thought I'd give it a shot and never had their Mac here(and I love Mac n cheese in general). Oh yeah there were $4 options for dessert but we had to pass up on dessert because I had ice cream earlier.
It's always Friday here. This staff is so focused on customers.  Spinach dip was amazing. Drinks were never empty, food came out promptly. Theresa our server was wonderful.. Thank you Friday's

One thing I've come to appreciate about Friday's is their tenacity to continually improving the quality of the customer experience at their restaurants. I mean this generally rather than on a face to face basis. It had been at least 6 months since my last visit to Friday's and I decided to show up for a late dinner last night. I was greeted by two friendly hostesses who sat us within 10 minutes as they had initially indicated. The hostess explained the new menu and ordering via ipad (or some other tablet-looking device they had) option that they now have and informed us that we could order drinks, food and pay our bill on it. I was a bit worried that this meant that we wouldn't be seeing much of our waitress but she actually showed up 5 minutes later and was very friendly and provided excellent service. Their menu is a bit of a maze but the descriptions are great as are the pictures. They have a lot more side options than they did before. They have mozzarella and tomato salad, sweet potato fries and baked potatoes to name a few. Here's what we ordered: Shrimp cocktail appetizer: The sauce is decent, the shrimp are small.  Grilled Norwegian salmon with Langostino lobster: Comes with about 6 oz of salmon and is topped with a creamy mushroom sauce and small chunks of lobster. I had the baked potato and the tomato mozzarella for my two sides. The creamy sauce was definitely the best part of the dish. It enhanced the fishy taste of the salmon and lobster without making it taste too salty. The baked potato was good but a bit dry and the salad was tasty but not what I'm used to expecting with a caprese salad. It had bits of onion which took away from the usual pungent balsamic taste.  Philly stacked burger: My friend ordered this burger and said it was tasty enough but just not very big.   Oreo madness: Shareable dessert that doesn't make you feel too guilty calorie-wise. It has soft oreo crumb layers with cookies n cream ice cream sandwiched between them. Comes with a chocolate drizzle and whipped cream. Delicious!  If I had to offer any criticism, it would be for the portion sizes. You're paying enough money here to get a good amount of food and best way I could describe the portion sizes would be "health conscious". These portions are perfect for when you're watching your weight but I think we all look to splurge a little when going out to a restaurant like Friday's.  Nevertheless, our server refilled our drinks often, she immediately noticed when we ordered food on the ipad and brought it out for us and we got to catch up on sports news that was playing on their many tvs. All in all a great experience.

Came here for a family dinner. The food was good n the service was great. The reason I like coming here is that they have great happy hour prices. Me n my baby had the bbq ribs, for not being a bbq joint, they sure did a great job w them. Kids had the pasta and Friday shrimp. Dad had the salmon and he liked it. Keep up the good work guys. It won't be the last time you see us here
service was good, food was great , but they need to take care more of the bathrooms and the inside looking.
A server here got my order wrong, but whatever.  Service here is decent. I loved their 2 people special.

Good food, ok service, and a long wait time. Pros: Service was ok. We've had better and worse. Our server was nice and the food came as expected. The food was good and I actually did not take much leftovers home. Cons: We do not mind waiting if a restaurant is busy and there are no tables available. We had to wait over 45 minutes for a table, but we could clearly see over a dozen open tables.

Third time in a row experiencing bad service here. Just left, had one rude server and when he went on break his replacement was just as bad. There were just two of us at the table. Took 15 minutes to bring us our water, made it seem like we were bothering him with our simple order, and they didn't check on us once during our meal. We had to flag down the server from behind the bar, where he was EATING, to ask for the check. We paid cash, and waited fifteen minutes for our change while the server was hanging out by the bar clearly not planning on giving us our change back. And this was confirmed when he finally came back and asked if we wanted more water & we had to remind him that he owed us our money. Needless to say, not coming back here. & we recommend that you don't as well.

DO NOT EAT HERE. Waited for a table....didn't take to long but once we sat down the waiter asked us about 4 different times if we were ready in the first seven minutes. Food took FOREVER and we had ordered an appetizer which we got after ours meals were almost halfway gone. the waiter mumbled im sorry and said he'd take it off which was nice but still not worth it all.

I went here the other day with my girlfriend and some friends and the food was terrible. We sat at the bar to watch the game and the drinks were okay, but my food was bland and cold, which was odd because I ordered the "sizzling" fajitas that came on a SKILLET. I had never been to a TGI Fridays before and I may give them one last shot but we'll see...

Happy hour is all night on Mondays so that's a good time to come. The downside? They take forever to seat you when there are plenty of seats open. No real surprise there since there is always a wait when I come to this location. Food was good. Service was good. Price was decent.

Went for dinner tonight, they advertise a 6 oz (unnamed) steak & lobster dinner. When I asked the server she said that is a sirloin steak. Then they offer a 10 oz ribeye & lobster dinner which is what I ordered, do they think a steak lover can't tell the difference when they bring you a sirloin instead of a ribeye! This steak was so tough I couldn't even eat it. When I brought it to the servers attention she couldn't care less. A big waste of $30 I won't be back!

My best friend and I go here all the time after we see a movie. This time I took my children and best friend to TGI Friday's. We were greeted and were sat very quickly. Our server Bre took the kids order so the food would come out quick so they wouldn't have to wait. Great I thought. We ordered our Apps and drinks.  Ten minutes later our drinks came and two of our apps arrived. Great i'm thinking, no wait. Our server came back and took our entree order. Then we wait, and wait, and wait. The kids are getting hungry we're all out of chips for the spinach dip. A whole twenty minutes go by and our food comes out but not the kids. Ten minutes later Bre shows up and asks if we need anything else. I let her know that we didn't receive the kids meals. She apologizes and rushes to get the meal. Three minutes later my kids sad excuse for a hamburger shows up. The kids do not touch it but they do eat the cold fries. The hamburger is cold to the touch, so it has been in the expo window for over thirty minutes would be my guess.  Bre comes back and I voiced my concerns with the cold hamburger. She just says, in a dejected tone, "Do you want another one or just comped?" I said to just comp it since they filled up on the chips. Once we get our bill I noticed that I am being charged $7.99 instead of the $4.99 for the salad. I asked Bre why I was being charged? She stated that I ordered off the lunch menu, but after looking at the menu that was incorrect. Bre then stated that she was new and that she pressed the wrong button. So instead of just saying I pressed the wrong button let me fix that, she lies, and then I question myself on what was the actual price. I asked if she could fix it it. I placed my card in the bill and my friend was going to place his card. That's when the bill was already taken and we couldn't divide the bill. By the time she showed up, I was already charged, before I could validate the changes made. That's when I asked for the manager. The manager showed up, looking already annoyed that  I woke him up, as he was disheveled and looked more like a Shift Lead than a manager.  Anyways I let him know my concerns about the bill, and how I wanted it split. No apology was given and he said "Well I already gave you the comp on the Kids meal and I gave you $1.00 off." Basically it translated to what else do you want. I am so sad as I always enjoy eating there, and my friend and I have a great time. It just seems like management does not properly train their employees, or wait staff. I will say Bre did a great job trying to fix things, but she needs to table touch more frequently as this could have been resolved sooner.  Management seems useless. By the reviews it looks like they do not care. Hopefully Global sees this.

The hostess are very rude and unprofessional I've made a reservation for my boyfriend's birthday it was at 6 everyone was there and we didn't get seated till 8 ... Usually when you reserve a table isn't it suppose to be ready by then? What annoyed me the most that they weren't even nice about it. It irritates me how they try to make it seem like we're impatient when in reality I called in 2 days before my booked date you knew this was going to be happening why am I getting such an negative vibe? So we end up getting settled at 8 and gotten out food order taken right away food didn't come out till 40 mins later... Which is horrible Don't want to continue this review because I will get upset and end up mentioning names that isn't necessary. Never coming back.

I've always been a fan of TGIFridays, whether it be the happy hour specials, appetizers or food, however, today the good wasn't great.  First, when they have happy hour it's always good, cheap drinks and half off appetizers. My favorite appetizer would have to be the pretzel sticks that come with a beer cheese dipping sauce.  Drinks, you can't screw that up, their specialty drinks are all fairly good and they definitely have something for everyone's pallet.  Now on to the food, either I have a good buzz most of the time I've been and can't tell the difference between good and bad food or the quality has gone down.  I think I'll stick to beers and maybe an appetizer next time I go. For the prices (which seem to go up every time I've been) and the quality it's def not worth it.

Came here after work on a Friday around 5. No wait so got seated right away. I haven't been to this location is over 3 years and it seems like nothing much has changed. What we got: Ultimate Mango Mai Tai ($8): couldn't really taste the mango and my friend didn't really enjoy it at all. Skip this next time! Strawberry Lemonade ($3.25): just your average strawberry lemonade. I've had better. Jack Daniels Ribeye and Scampi ($24): comes with your choice of 2 sides and cornbread. Friend decided to get seasoned fries and broccoli. The ribeye was pretty tasty. Dip it in the Jack Daniels sauce if you want more flavor to it though. He ordered it rare and it came out closer to medium rare, but that was no big problem to him. Shrimps were grilled and kept sticking to the skewer.  Grilled Salmon w/ Langostino Lobster ($19.50): comes with your choice of 2 sides as well and I ended up getting the tomato mozzarella salad and sweet potato fries. Grilled salmon was moist, but it was a bit too salty for my liking and I love salty food! The langostino lobster was okay and they give you a pretty good amount of it too. I would skip the tomato mozzarella salad next time, it had wayy too much liquid inside the dish. Sweet potato fries were good though! Service: It could have been better. We got seated in the corner, so it seemed like we kind of got ignored. Waitress came by like once or twice to see if we needed anything, but other than that eh...
I love tgif and there happy hours. I been to this location many times and they always have had good service.  I would definitely recommend it for a night out with friends.

I expected typical service considering this is a mainstream chain restaurant. I was very wrong.  I the entire staff was on their period when I visited. They must spend so much time together that their periods synced.  Hostess looked bored. Our waiter was incompetent. When our food arrived, we ate with our eyes for ten minutes until I was able to find a staff member to scrounge up some silverware.  I asked our server if there was a birthday special for my 14 year old cousin. It was some dessert accompanied by the birthday song sung by the staff. Then the check arrived and my cousin never tasted her birthday surprise. Maybe the staff ate in kitchen because they were PMSing and craving dessert.

Came here for lunch last Sunday. It was crowded. Sat in the bar area. My waitress was good in general but she needs to take time and listen to her customer(s)' orders. In my opinion, she was a little rushing. I ordered steak and ribs combo. I told her I want my steak medium well. Then as she was about to leave before I was done, I had to stop her to tell her I want the sauce on the side for my ribs. I don't know what she heard but she asked me again how I want it cooked. I repeated again, medium well for the steak. She was ready to leave again when I stopped her again to tell her I want the sauce on the side for the ribs. Finally it got thru to her. Well, it appeared that way. When the food came, guess how the ribs came out? Yup, sauce on the ribs!! :( I told her that's NOT how ordered my ribs. She took back the rib portion and later came back with the right one. Food.......Steak was good, fries (ordered sweet potatoes and regular) were good too. Ribs on the hand, it tasted a little raw. It had that porky smell. Needed more rub on it. Couldn't get access to their wifi. :( It keeps saying "Unable to join the network".

Worst service ever, the servers there don't know what they are doing and they always look like they don't want to be there, food was mediocre when the manager came over all we got was like 20 apologies of "I'm sorry for the service but was everything else good?"... Uummm I guess, servers need to be retrained, and managers need to learn how to handle upset customers better, their goal should be to do whatever possible to make the customers happy and at this restaurant it just kind of felt like the manager said oh im sorry...and had a," Idk what else to tell you kind of face ", blah won't be coming back here again

Not a place I'd recommend coming to. The food is barely mediocre and the service not that great. Serving the check when not finished with out meals is just wrong especially when it's not near closing time and when the restaurant isn't even packed.

My wife and I come here about 4 times a month for dinner. We love the service and absolutely love the Jack Daniel's ribs, matter of fact that's what we get everytime we go! Whether they're busy or slow they always treat us right and give us the attention we deserve... This TGIF is good any night of the week!

Who the hell is running this monkey joint?? First off we walked in and we see a bunch of open tables and they said it's a 45min wait due to the fact that they have no servers " umm ok learn how to due labor budget cost" and now we are sitting here waiting for our app's for the past 35 minuets.  We finally get our apps and the potato skins looked like they ran to the nearest 7-11 and grabbed whatever was left in their warmer and served it to us, and I asked for the siracha wings and they gave me regular wings " at this point I was starving and didn't care at this point"  I swear I think they had the kitchen staff was running the floor cause the only time the server came by quick to our table was to pick up the $7.00 tip on the table.

Loved the service in had gotten here my friends and myself just came in for a quick snack so we got the endless appetizers of boneless wings and mozzarella sticks our food came out quick and she was constantly checking on our table Will come back again.

If I could give 0 stars I would. I sit down in the bar area, and the bartender ask me what I would like.  I tell him my order, and he ask me if I want to cash out now or give him my card. I was a little taken back, because a restaurant bar and grill has never demanded that I show proof of being able to pay my bill before even being served first.  I gave this guy my card, and noticed that my card was the only one in his tray with a bar full of customers.  I'm African-American, so now I start to feel my spide-sensuous tingling. Never wanting to be that "it's because I'm black" person, I set back and watch as 4 more new sets of customers came in, and he not ask for there proof of payment.  I was so hurt and upset that I was shaking. I flagged someone down who happen to be a manger, and informed him of what was going on. I told him to look at the racks where people's card are to be, and mine was the only one there with now a full bar of people. I was told sorry, and it was there policy to take a card in the bar area. Which was fine with me, if everyone's card was taken.  He went back and spoke with the guy, and he says that some people were regulars, so he knows them (will pay), and the others he had not had a chance to ask. He asked me as soon as I ordered.  Then this really nice women by the name of Teresa came out, and explained that it is their policy to ask. I let her know that I would be ok with the policy if it was executed evenly.  He asked me for my card before he would make my drink.  Others he made and served there drinks, but only asked for their card after I said something to management.  It was such an obvious show of discrimination, that I could not hold back my  rage which manifested in tears.  Because of this Orange location. I will never go to another TGIF anywhere on this planet, NEVER EVER AGAIN.
Extra slow service for an empty place. Ordered our food and never got it. Only our drinks were listed on the self pay machine, so we just paid it and left.

Very Dissatisfied with my service today. Our server was overworked. He had so many tables that he could not handle it. We hardly seen him. Management needs to step it up in this area and plan accordingly or take on some of the work. Won't be back for a while.

me and a friend met up for lunch today and decided to go here because it was nearby both of us. Tgif has a really cheap lunch menu. Still I couldn't get myself to order anything on the lunch menu and ended up getting the honey pecan salmon with wild rice and broccoli. I remember it to be better. It lacked the honey pecan sauce or whatever they used.  Broccoli was also still a little raw. I think the dish is around $15. Not bad but the way it was made wasn't very good. I felt like it was thrown together quickly, which is probably how it was made.  I love tgi, but not so much this time.
It use to be good , we've been here for almost 2 hours and our waiter hasn't checked on us once ! Our cups have been empty for almost 30 min :((( sucky service for sure

I dunno how I feel about this particular tgif ...came here for happy hour sat at the bar...literally only had two drinks ...2 sliders and some fries...so was fine for a while ...right when I got home threw everything up, not sure if it was the food or whaaa??? I didn't even finish the second drink and yes I have drank at other establishments 2 or more drinks and never gotten sick...it was the worst!!! Maybe cook the meat more on sliders??? I can't even pinpoint what made me sick unfortunately :(
Just a good place to get together and have beer during happy hour sundays and catch up. Not the best food...

Worst Service and Cleanliness of a Restaurant EVER!!!! Staff was rude, 3 hostess sat around and discussed there after work activities instead of setting up tables or assisting customers. Menus dirty, walls have holes in them and trash on the floor that staff members repeatedly walked past -looked at and never picked up. Food expensive for what you get.

Celebrated my dad's 50th birthday with about 13 other people at around 2-4 PM. Food was just aright and the service was average. They have the rudest manager working there. She had the worst attitude and was rude to us in front of all our guests. Very embarrassing and highly unprofessional. Won't be coming back to that restaurant for sure. Ridiculous.

I'm from the inland empire.  We enjoy Tgi all the time out there.  Me and my boyfriend decided to visit there considering we enjoy the happy hour there.   It was Friday night , so it's busy.  We wait about 15 min to sit. Wasn't bad at all.  Our server came right away.  We're an easy couple to serve so we were ready to order right away as well.   As we're ordering our waitress mentions that they don't have happy hour after 10pm on Fridays there.  We were shocked.  I'm guessing because the demographics and attractions in the area allow the company to make more money this way.  Understandable BUT fuck ,  we don't have it like that these days. Lol.  We'd rather go cheaper any chance we get. So instead of paying 25$ for our items we payed 51$. Not including tip.  So in total about 58$.   Our server did her thang.  Awesome service even with the busy crowd.   I just hope the company' works on having more consistency in regards to promotions like happy hour.  We look forward to those daily options but not ones that hurt our pockets.  We're gunna be in the area for a while the next month or so but trust that tgi Fridays won't Be our first pick to enjoy a meal at all.

I come here around 10:30 PM on some weekdays with a group of people. Pros: *Because of the time I come in, there is always available parking  *Expensive if not during happy hour *Small portions (in my opinion) Cons: *Ironically, there is no happy hour on Fridays. Would recommend going during happy hours to take advantage of the half off prices. *Service depends on your individual waiter as well as your seating.  (If you are seated in the corner or the back of the restaurant, your waiter may forget about you)

Besides the waiter being really friendly, our experience eating lunch here was abysmal.  I had the fried shrimp for $10 and the wife had the chicken salad for about the same.  The shrimp was just okay, but left me with the sense of not being enough food for the price.  The chicken on the chicken salad came in three slabs, and the wife had to cut them into chunks for the salad.  It was dried out and flavorless.  The iced tea was okay, but at $3.25 for an iced tea, it should have been the best tea I've ever had. Not the old TGIF that I remember and we will not be going back.  Too many really good restaurants out there.  Next time sushi.

HAPPY HOUR!!!! so i have never been to TGI Fridays but have heard so much about this place as a huge chain and i finally had a chance to try it out myself. my friend recommended to have our group dinner here late night for some happy hour! the inside is pretty casual and clean. we were seated and our server came and showed us their electronic device on the table which connected to the menu for us to see what is on there. i thought this was really cool and up to date so that is nice. the service was ok... nothing great. sometimes it was hard to get the attention of the server. food wise was great! happy hour deals for food were great! i got the sliders and a drink. the sliders were really tasty and i mean most sliders are the same but yes, this was a normal slider that tasted great. fries are also pretty tasty. i recommend their basics and no one at my table had any complaints! go happy hour!!!!!!!

I used to come here all the time (almost every week) when they had their 2 for $20 deal but eventually I adventured out to other new places and totally forgot about TGIF. I came here the other day because one of my friend brought it up and I honestly don't think I will be returning.. I came on a Friday and they had no deals??? LIKE WHAT? OK.. Weren't they known for the "Special" deals on Friday?  Another thing that was upsetting was our server. He seriously was so slow and too serious about his job, that it just sucked the fun out of us. For someone that says he worked here for over 13 years sure didn't seem like he knew what he was doing. HORRIBLE SERVICE! After ordering it took over 20 mins for our food to come out.. I ordered the half rack of ribs and shrimp and there was nothing good about it. The only thing I enjoyed was their Jack Daniel sauce which I drenched all over my ribs. The shrimp was too dry and flavorless..  I suggest going to BJ's next door for happy hour! Soooo much better then TGIF..

My husband and I received the worst service ever from a waitress named Bella. We were seated in the bar area. We order appetizers only not to receive no plates to eat our food on and may I say we asked Bella. She didn't take our drink order my husband had to ask her for water for the two of us she returned with only one glass. At the end i ate dinner off of my husband's plate due to my entree order been incorrect. I'm very unhappy with TGI Fridays service!!!!

I came here an hour ago. The Asian hostess was not welcoming at all when I walked in and she had a rude tone in her voice that was a bit irritating. That already left a bad taste in my mouth about this place.  Anyway, we got seated and looked at the menu. After we ordered, I grabbed my fork and see food still stuck on it. I wanted to walk out at that point, because I lost my appetite. Our waiter was very nice, which is the only reason I even gave this review two stars and didn't walk out.  Eventually, the food came out. It was okay. The fries were not warm and were a bit soggy, but edible. I should've read the reviews before coming in. I probably would've just gone elsewhere otherwise.

Horrible horrible horrible!! I asked for a medium rare steak and they brought me my steak with it cooked medium if that and when I told the waiter about how the steak was over cooked he proceeds to tell me that for them that's medium rare!!!!! WTF!!! This place is absolutely the worst! How can someone say that? Haha what a joke!

This review is long over due considering I've been coming here at least 3 times a month for the last year. They are few great servers here but unfortunately they are outnumbered by the horrible ones. In specific Cynthia. Worst server ever I can confirm that 100% after having her for the third time. She should stay at home with that gross attitude. I always have to ask multiple times for things, rolls her eyes constantly, and refused to clear the table as new plates were coming out. Get that waitress Cynthia the hell out of there, she doesn't need to be working there with that attitude. Great food but the horrible service, will keep this at 1 star until the service gets better. I will update accordingly as I visit here more.

Early for a Yelp event, we stopped in here for a cocktail and to kill some time. I decided to get an appetizer, and went with the Loaded Nachos.  Nah.  They were not loaded, and they just were not good.  Appetizers were 50% off and they still were not worth it, unfortunately. The String Bean Fries, were good.  I only tried one, but I liked it!  I think I would have preferred them dipped in Ranch, I think they were in some sort of mustardy sauce.   The bar was slow, and there were maybe 5 other people there most of the time we were.  The service, was even slower.  The bartender tried to give us someone elses food, and about 10 minutes later I asked him if he could please check on our food.  He came back with it, which just means it would have sat there until I said something eventually.  How come no one brings the far food orders out to the bar... Quite a few people ordered Steak and Lobster, which I guess was on special for $14.99... I just cant understand that. Anyway, the glass of house Chardonnay - Kendall Jackson was a good glass of wine.  Two appetizers that were half off, and two glasses of wine, for $25 didnt seem like much of a happy hour deal to me.  I didnt eat most of the nachos, the service was just fair... definitely would suggest going into one of the other restaurants inside the outdoor shopping area instead for... anything.

I took my family here during a recent trip to Disney, and was disappointed.  The hostess was not welcoming at all.  The waiter was just okay.  The food was mediocre.  The icing on the cake was when I got ready to cut into my chicken, and noticed the knife still had food stuck to it.  We opened another roll of silverware, and the next knife had food stuck to it as well.  Needless to say I was grossed out, and ended up not eating half of my food.  With the recent Hepatitis A outbreak in Southern Cal, you would think restaurants would be more diligent about cleanliness.  I guess not...  Maybe a visit from the health department would help.
Really enjoyed Friday's! This location is really on top of their game and the food was great.  Thanks to our waiter Leo!

This review is about our waitress Leanne! Leanne was very nice and polite. She explained everything to us about the all you can eat apps and also explained about the fee chips and salas if your a awards member which no one has ever done. She brought our food out in a timely manner and was great with re filling our waters! New fav waitress!! Koodles Leanne
The food was cold and the flavor was really odd and disgusting. The ribs had no meat whatsoever. Honestly it was a waste.

Came here for there all u can eat apps special. Great promo and good food at a great price! It was super busy and loud but I expected that. My server was great.  Food was cheap and good. Parking was tough but it was expected since it's a weekend and of the promo.

I wish I never walked into this place. The restaurant is dirty(tables), our waitress is rude. The service is really slow. We sat in our end waited for them to take our order for like 20mins. Never coming back here again.

I like this location a lot better than the one at Westminster Mall, but that actually doesn't mean much. This location was the first TGIF's I've ever tried; i was introduced to it by a family friend. We usually only go here for happy hour or after an Angels or Ducks game late at night. I've been here many times and the wait time fluctuates from no wait time up to 30 minutes. The service is really friendly but very slow and inattentive. The servers always provide us information about the menu and the happy hour but they take forever to refill drinks and  bring out the food.  When we come here during happy hour, most of the appetizers are half-off so we usually get the potato skins, cheeseburger sliders for $1.50 each, Jack Daniel traditional wings, chicken nachos, mozzarella sticks, and my favorite Jack Daniel boneless strips. The food took about 30 minutes to come out but we were still missing some of our orders. We had to notify our server  and they said they are going to check on it. The server came out to apologize that the order was never placed. We had to wait another 15 minutes. I felt like the only food items that were actually good today were the mozzarella sticks (cheesy and hot), traditional wings (juicy and tender), and the potato skins (crispy outer shell but soft inside potato). The cheeseburger sliders and Jack Daniel strips were overcooked so the meat was dry. The chicken nachos didn't seem freshly prepared.with ingredients tossed messily. Usually, all of the food is pretty good. Today was an off-night. Overall, the food is decent and their service is sub-par. They might close at 2AM but their kitchen closes earlier so make sure to order before they abruptly tell you that you can't order anymore. They have great happy hour menus and drinks at a good price. This location have different events for each day of the week. I believe that Wednesdays are karaoke night so I usually go up and sing when the drinks increase my confidence. I recommend people to try out their happy hour.

We came around 10:15 PM and it was moderately packed. Beautiful place, dark walls but well lit, with beautiful decorations. We were seated immediately, and I ordered a sweet raspberry tea. My friend got water.  The waitress came back a few minutes later with the drinks and we ordered the medium-rare ribeye steak with half rack ribs, fries, and Jasmine rice pilaf to share, all the meat served with the Jack Daniels glaze.  The wait was really long, about 30 minutes, but at least our waitress served the steak with fries and rice before the ribs. She said something like, "I didn't want you guys to wait any longer, so have this and I'll bring out the ribs later." I thought that was a very nice. Anyway the ribeye with the glaze was Amazing! One of the best steaks ever and my favorite sauce of all time now! It tastes sort of like a super sweet soy sauce. I love soy sauce.  I couldn't get enough of that sauce. I put it on the steak, fries, and rice. Delicious.  The fries and rice alone were nothing spectacular. Very plain but they complemented the steak and ribs later.  The ribs came about 10 minutes later and were good too. Not amazing either, but great with the glaze! Overall, amazing meal, but we wanted dessert.  So we ordered the Brownie Obsession and it came in 5 minutes. $7 for vanilla ice cream on top of a hot chocolate brownie drizzled in hot fudge and caramel. Pricey but delicious! Perfect ending to a great meal. It all just melted in the mouth.  Overall, long wait but very worth it. Nice waitress and conformable atmosphere.

I don't come here to often anymore since I stopped drinking, but I should. Service here is good, even on game days when the place is packed. I order the endless appetizers and with my appetite the server is busy. All the food here is good. Rich the bartender is the best. For good service sit in his section. The only problem is the parking. Weekends everyone uses the lot to visit daddy in jail across the street.

Ordered a rib eye and got a hard piece of sirloin meat. Sent it  back and they fixed it. Beer on tap is flat. Service by waitress was good but I would not return due to poor quality food. No attempts by the manager to make up for the mix up.

This was pretty much the worst experience I have had in years.  I love giving great reviews for outstanding service.  Even with bad service, you typically have a manager show up and apologize for the poor experience.  Not here.  At least not tonight.  The evening started out with a longer than expected wait for a table for two.  I was told 15 minutes.  When I checked back in 20 minutes, I was told not too much longer...maybe 5 more minutes.  There were only two other groups of 4 when we arrived.   We were finally seated.  Patiently, again, I waited for our server Dillon.  I figured out he was fairly new.  He took the order.  About 20 minutes later, our meals were brought to us.  I had a flat iron steak off the gluten free menu that was to be prepared medium.   It was so over cooked, I could hardly cut it.  The sides were cold.  Again, I waited patiently for the waiter to check on us.   I had to find him and tell him the meal was horrible.  He actually asked me if I wanted him to ask the kitchen to re do the meal.  He would tell the manager I was unhappy.  I waited another 20 minutes.  I asked him if he could check on the progress.  He stopped at other tables to take additional orders.   Someone brought the meal out to me.  He only came back after I was done to see how it was.  Never offered refills of our drinks.  I had to ask for the check and wait again.   I believe the manager needs to be retrained in customer service skills.  I should have checked Yelp before  going here to see the other poor comments, but, I have eaten here before and never had this type of problem.

I gave this  place two start before the manager was nice enough to move us. I wanted to come in for food late night. I got the most horrible waiter. I ask if they had sweet wine and he yelled at me "NO". First of all his "attitude is amazing". Later, when I read the menu and state red "sweet" wine .. are you kidding me ? Okay rude rude place ! If I was u I would have second thoughts coming in here and being waited by the greatest waiter of all time! He is lucky I gave it 2 stars and I'm just being nice but if it wasn't for the manager being a sweetheart about this situation it would have had 0 stars.

Food: 4 stars  Service: 3 stars Memories: 5 stars I will agree with the previous reviews that the service is a hit or miss. I've definitely been disappointed before because I've had unfriendly servers and ones that has bad attitudes. But, I usually have always came for the happy hour filled with drinks and appetizers. My best friend and I always came to TGIF while in college and had really great memories there. The bar staff is usually attentive and really nice. I think it's a great place to just come to have a beer and enjoy good company.

This place has gone down hill over the years!  Tonight we came in and i ordered the really good cheeseburger cooked at medium.  It came with stale and cold fries and then they brought out hot stale fries!  My husband ordered their 10oz sirloin, cooked medium rare but came out medium.  They fixed the situation by bringing him a RARE steak instead.  Meh.  I would probably not come back to this location.

Bad Service, If you have a lady call Stephanie as a server RUN! She actually try add 35% to 40% tip in our bill. She was not even help us or serve property, rude and take more than 2 hours to bring our food.  I don't recommend to go at this TGFriday... I like better that one at Brea Ca.

Came here after an event, we were starving! I tried ordering a quesadilla without the chicken. A while later the waitress came over to let me know that they couldn't do it without chicken because it comes w chicken, frozen, pre-made. Um, ewww, how hard is it to make a quesadilla? When it came it was gross! It was super hard to flag our waitress down so I didn't say anything or change the order. The mozzarella sticks were barely warm, not hot....just NO.

You can't beat a steak and lobster tail for only 14.99$. The lobster was seasoned perfectly. We also started with buffalo wings and crispy green beans. They have a good happy hour as well. I'll be back for the steak and lobster deal though! The Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta is one of my favorites there too.

Criminal activity! At least I think so. Read on... The meal was not good, but fine, it's Fridays - I don't expect better from them and wouldn't bother to do a review based on that alone. When it came time to check out we used the Ziosk terminal at the table. Here is where things went wrong... We had a $32.40 bill, I took photos of two of the Ziosk-calculated tip amounts we observed: $7.00 even at 9.4%, and $14.83 at 20%. Now, go read that again! And again just to be sure. Yes, the Ziosk terminal is GREATLY FALSIFYING tip calculations. 9.4% is really $3.05 and 20% is $6.48. Apparently Fridays expects you to be 1) drunk, or 2) stupid, or 3) both, when it comes time to pay, Unfortunately many people are not so hyper-aware, or simply assume that a restaurant would not try to STEAL FROM THEM. But Fridays does.  How many years has this been going on? How many thousands of customers have they defrauded? p.s. This event occurred on 9-23-15.

Service was absolutely awful!  Called ahead and said we were going to have a party of 15 and wanted to put our name on the list the gentleman that answered the phone said that if we didn't have at least eight people there at 7:30 that we wouldn't be seated.  He was a real ass! We were all there at 7:30 went in and said we had a reservation and were told they had no record of our reservation. We were not seated until 9 p.m. the waitress came to our table about 15 minutes after we were seated asked us for a drink order said that we were her only table and she brought us the drinks took our food order and then we never saw her again for the rest of the night until she gave us our checks. Friend ordered shrimp with her dinner and the shrimp never came we asked the waitress three times and it never came so went to the manager and complained about that and the service and the manager's response was yeah I know we took the shrimp off your bill and that was it. The manager was a female with maybe reddish hair and she was as rude as could be. Needless to say I will not be going back to this restaurant ever and everyone there needs to go through some training especially the manager

Wrong place to go to celebrate my birthday with the family....First off over an hour wait when the restaurant had a lot of empty tables. I had the bourbon chicken and it was so chewy and disgusting! The only thing that was decent was the chicken quesadilla. The waiter was attentive and nice, but not coming back the food is gross.

It's been awhile since I've had TGIF, and tonight may have changed my mind about this place. We just had one of those "one hell of a week" kind of week, and we didn't want to do anything crazy on a Friday night so we decided to get dinner, chill, and watch the Yankees--this place just hit the spot! The Cajun pasta has got to be my new fave, and the buffalo wingman's burger is truly something! And of course, you can't go wrong with the happy hour specials! But we must say that what made this visit the most special is our server...we must give recognition where it's due so shout out to Cody! Appropriately attentive, positive energy, genuine, and efficient! We need more servers like you! You may think your job is just to get orders and bring food to your customers, but as a server you're part of the dinner experience, and often impact how we feel by the end of our dinner...that being said, we just wanted to take the time to commend you for your excellent service! Thank you for taking good care of us, we look forward to coming back!

It was an alright experience at TGIF, came here on Sunday with family. We arrived and immediately it was crowded took about 30 min to get a table but the hostess nor person who walked us to our table seemed excited, but whatever.  We got to our table and the waiter was fine, he did his job but wasn't welcoming. He didn't smile once but took our order made sure we got refills. Our food took a really long time to arrive. We ordered appetizers but those took 20 minutes to arrive. It got to the point where I had to ask our waiter what was taking so long and his response was it'd only be a few min longer. Our appetizers came out and we're really good. However, once they arrived our server said our entrees were ready as well which sucked cuz we then had to gorge the appetizers not really enjoying them to make room for the entrees.  Overall the food was great and I'd recommend everything we ordered. It was happy hour all day so we took advantage of that. Also, we had a 20% off coupon that I had received from TGIF via email as I'm a Stripes member. So good food and great music, Sports on all the TV's which was super awesome. Just service was bleh, could've been a lot better. 3 out of 5.
A nice and a cozy fine dining place. An awesome and quick efficient service of one of the staff, Claus, who attended to us. Absolutely will be going back to this place again. Good food and service!

Once again: why Yelp doesn't have 1/2 stars??  I wanted to give this place 3.5 stars, but since it's a chain and I assume that they have better logistic and resources, than a mom and pop restaurant, so I'm less forgiving and I'll give them 3 stars.  We (my mum and I) went there because we were supposed to meet with a friend of mine, who never showed up  (but apologize profusely). To start we ordered sangria, it was weak VERY weak, even more compared to the mean sangria that my family makes, this is was like the 99 cents store version of that. Order at your own risk. My mom ordered steak with potato and veggies side orders. She ordered the meat medium rare and they brought it 3/4 :( but regardless this detail my mom was pretty satisfied with the meal. I ordered a salmon, it was good, the veggies were a bit mushy but still ok (BTW it was good not great, but again is an average price chain, cost/benefit?) When finished we started asking for the bill, but it took  whileeeeeeeeeeee for them to acknowledge us and bring it to us.  Maybe they were under stuffed? I don't know... but the Manager should take into consideration Thursday night is a tricky night, this particular one was pretty active. Would I go back? Sure, it won't be my first option but if hungry in the area, HH or something I have no problem going to TGIF

I came here on a Saturday afternoon at 12:40 PM here bc my older sister told me that they have good pasta here and she said that it's good so I decided to come here the one at the block. It was me and my older sister we walked in and we had a wait for the hostess to get off the phone so she can seat us, we got seated. Their menu book looks and feel like a cardboard and cheap. Then we got a waiter ider what was his name he was white and we both asked for water and he says that he has to "check"  if they have any?  Like seriously what waiter says that like it sounds like a restaurant can't even afford water? Then we ordered a pasta, my sister got the pasta idk wat it was called with no shrimp and she  told the waiter that she's allergic to seafood and that she didn't want it on her plate or cooked with it. I ordered a the same thing but with shrimp. It took 35 minutes to receive our orders and the waiter didn't even apologize for for the wait that they took so long and my sister asked the waiter if the orders were cooked separately and that if it didn't have shrimp and he says he didn't heard what we said to him when we told him to his face? My sister she liked her food for me I didn't even like it at all. The pasta was shitty for me the shrimp was way too dry, didn't have a lot of flavor, it had less pasta instead they put more sauce which it was too oily for my taste. We had to use their device thing to call our waiter to ask for napkins and it took him almost 35 minutes to get any service is so unacceptable. Idk if the management hired people that don't even know how to cook, the waiters/waitresses to attend people very well, but I think they hired anybody that doesn't even have restaurant experience. For 17.99 each for almost 18 bucks is not worth the price, I honestly think it's a ripoff. It used to be 12 bucks now it's 17 bucks. It should have more food and flavor. But I think they're quality of their food has gone down that they don't put their effort on the orders since they raised their prices up to beat other restaurants (meaning every restaurant around their competitions). I used their coupon for 25 percent off it helped to avoid wasting money. If you want to get better food quality with better service go to El Torito instead of coming here not worth the wait or money. If you want something fast for your convenience go to Carl's Jr. I didn't even wanted to tip the waiter bc he took so long but I don't think I won't be back. The service was disappointing and the food wasn't that great. And I don't recommend this restaurant.

Every time I come out to Anaheim me and my friends go to this TGIF. The customer service is great, the food is great. I ordered my usual bbq bacon cheeseburger with fires. This time I tried the  Tennessee whiskey  Cake for dessert and it was amazing.

Saturday at tgif....place is packed with 30+ minute wait..tons of empty tables inside and out, But you can't be seated because management did not bring in enough staff ... What on a Saturday night at the block!!!

I've only been to this restaurant LESS than a handful of times...and this last visit I had, reminded me WHY.  My kids love this place (god knows why??), so after my daughter had her commencement ceremony, she chose this place to have her celebratory lunch.  Service was absolutely HORRID. SUPPOSEDLY, it was busy? But from what we saw it was far from that. It just seemed the server was in over his head with the few tables he had. Not once were we asked if we needed refills and actually had to address a manager who was helping out server with the table next to us. Not only was she cold and rude, but she never came back with my refill I had asked for. She actually walked past out table a few times and looked directly at me and said NOTHING. I didn't catch her name but she was a white lady with light brown shoulder length hair, she was wearing black pants and pink top the day we went. When our server finally came to check on us I told him about the manager not bringing my refill, he apologized and gave it to me in a to-go cup but had the audacity to charge me for the cup when we looked at the bill.  The prices are absolutely shit for the quality of the food and service. I'm never coming back here, or at least to this specific location.

Wine and dine at TGIF!! Every visit here has been great... 20 minute waiting time, nice servers, good food etc. but last night was blahh, my plate was over cooked got a side of vegetables but only got broccoli :/ rib rack was too crispy.. :( hubby asked for Tabasco sauce 5 mins passed he had to get up and get it... but whatever, we here living life to the fullest... one glass of wine at a time :p

My husband and I came here for a late lunch Wednesday. Waitress was kinda unfriendly and kept acting like she didn't want to be there. We shared potatoes skins and they tasted kind of old and the cheese was cold and seemed "fake" like a bad sliced cheese. I ordered bruschetta chicken pasta with tomato marinara. Tasted like it came out of a can and the chicken was dry and bland. My husband had Jack Daniels chicken with mashed potatoes and lemon butter broccoli. He liked his. I would not come back and would not recommend.

Thee only reason I walked into this place is because they closed BJs at midnight I didn't make it on time I sat down saw their menu and I didn't see nothing that I like the selection they got is weak!!! Absolutely no variety other than the water they brought to the table I didn't we anything that I could eat I walked out!!!!
Happy Hour  Domestic draughts $4.25 but doesn't include domestic crafts even though the beer menu lists them as draughts. Bud or Coors only for happy hour... FAIL

Natasha (bartender) is the best! My boyfriend and I come here all the time after work, sometimes with a group and sometimes just us two. We usually would sit at a table but if Natasha is at the bar, you will find us there. She has a great personality and is so energetic! She is funny and always makes our experience fun! She seems to enjoy her job, her positive energy is contagious. Working in a restaurant, I know that a lot of servers/bartenders aren't always enthusiastic especially late at night but she always has a smile on her face. We appreciate you Natasha! Definitely our favorite employee at T.G.I. Friday's!

Worst place ever, used to come here every other week but lately this place has gone done hill. Every time I come here with friends it's always something, for example today was so effin ridiculous. I went there today to celebrate my brothers promotion and a chill night out. When I got there there were plenty of open seating especially outside which was all open but when I arrive to the greeter he tells that there is going to be a 45 to 55 minute wait. I politely asked them that it was ok that I didn't want to sit inside I was ok with sitting outside to which he responded they are taken but they had no people and no reservation, I know I had already asked multiple employees. He then responds and say take it or leave it I got customer to attend. Not going to lie I was hella livid and ready to pop someone if it wasn't for my brother
HH 3-7pm + 10pm- close Mon-Thur | bar HH 3-7pm Friday | bar HH all day Sunday | bar + dining
I had some late-night eats here and everything was good but not great. The burger looked better than it tasted. The same goes for the ribs. The service was friendly.
Was just their for Happy Hour which is great. The food was delicious and warm. We had different waiters, dont know why. I can only remember the crazy white lady. Ordered a margarita,  it was bomb.

Typical TGIF. Decent food. Good happy hour and drinks. I've been here plenty of times but tonight was bad.  Friends and I came from saddle ranch to finish our night with more drinks and food. Great company and conversation for the most part but as I took my last bathroom break, I literally returned seconds after they called last call. I told the bartender I just came back and would like one more beer before they shut down. Even tho I was sitting right in front of the tap he told me no. In a very rude manner. The other bartender was ready and willing to help me but as he reached for my glass the guy in front of me cut him off and straight up said no. I'm never one to complain but this was a bit much. So I said "oh okay, like that." He then mumbled something and they both snickered. It's one thing to decline something but to insult me in front of my face is another.  Like I said, been here many times with no issue. Servers and food are okay. Bartenders need to be retrained on customer service. I work in the restaurant business, I understand it's late and we want to go home, but that type of attitude is never okay to someone who is there spending money.

NATASHA and DANIEL are the greatest bartenders, they have been ridiculously accomadating and so kind hearted and really made us feel at home, can't believe how involved they are to this restaurant and how involved they are in the conversations we had. Love them so much  Can't wait to be back soon

Wow... service was great but seemed like they were lacking a lot of servers. First, my family ordered four dishes: sirloin steak, fish and chips, bruschetta pasta, and the strawberry salad. The salad was the best dish.. the sirloin was the worst steak we ever tried. It was so rubbery. It was very hard to chew. All the meats in all dishes were very dry and not savory. Our family will not be coming back here.

I was very disappointed first off our waitress who took our drink orders told us that she was leaving and she was still helping another table more than 30 mins after she said she was leaving then they took very long to bring us our food and on top of that we ordered drinks and my older sister had a drink already but when they came back they said she couldn't have one which was really dumb overall it was a bad experience
I'm giving this place a one star because after we were eating we saw a live cockroach around our son. I called the manager no refund nothing I won't eat here ever again. Gross!!!

It took 50 minutes to get our food and all we ordered were appetizers. Restaurant was half empty on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't until we mentioned something to a waiter that they went to check on our food.

Used to come here when I worked at Virgin Megastore at the Block o_O - Eons ago. Don't really come here now. Came here spontaneously for the "endless apps" campaign/promo. At first, service was lagging. But it gradually got better. We chose the $12 promo, which gives you a choice of 5 appetizers to rotate. We did 4 out of 5. Pan seared pot stickers(yum), mozzarella sticks(good as usual), loaded potato skins(okay) and boneless buffalo wings(yes!). All were fairly good. The parmesan garlic boneless wings were verifiably scrumptious! I need this more often in my life:) Should we have tried the flatbread? Idk. All I know is Friday's is still Friday's. I don't mind dropping in once a year. Same pub food for decades. Some good, some average, some delicious.

We come to this Fridays about once a month or so. We always have a moderate time. But this time is by far the best time we have ever had in a Fridays. And that is all due to Leanne and her exceptional service! She was fairly busy (as is typical for a server at Fridays) but checked on us multiple times. Most of the time, were lucky to be checked on or asked if we want refills at all. Leanne also made sure we got our points and told us about chips and salsa for rewards members, something no one else has told us!  Leanne is great at what she does and I hope that someone gives her the recognition she deserves!

Our waiter was good, but food was a total disaster. My husbands salad had burnt onion strings.. totally dark brown and hard. Our pot stickers were very burnt on both sides like BLACK, the potato skins were gross and the cheese wasn't even melted. The wings tasted old and ridiculously hard. My pecan crusted chicken wasn't even crispy at all.. it looked and tasted microwaved, same thing for the chicken in my husbands salad. The mashed potatoes were cold and tasted like they came out of a box. HORRIBLE! TGI Fridays has definitely gone down hill. Still can't believe they felt comfortable sending out food like that!

It was my first time at Fridays and not a good experience Jami was our server and wasn't willing to make any special requests to the kitchen for me he said the kitchen makes the vegetables in the morning and they can't substitute plane veggies. Not good the food was ok at best. Won't be back.

We had dinner here.  My husband and I had something different. My husband had a burger and became very ill. He was so sick by the time we left Fridays  and came straight home. I called Fridays and told the manager what happened.  She said she would look into it and call me back the next day to check up on him. I never got a call.  I called them 2 days later and a manager told me to call the district office.  No one had any concern about my husband and no one asked how he was. I called corporate and played phone tag and as of today it's been a month and no follow up.  I DON'T RECOMMEND FRIDAYS AT ALL.  I would have given them another chance had they would have at least shown a little compassion.

Came in for lunch with my co workers, we got seated quickly so that was nice. The appetizers were half off which was cool, right? It'd be cooler if we got our food with decent time. We waited at least 30-40 minutes for the appetizers to come out and when we got them they were cold. We got back from lunch and we're all at least 30 minutes late going back. Never going here again. Food wasn't even worth it.

..dropped by for lunch before shopping .  We got seated right away.  We ordered apps; chicken quesadilla and cheeseburger sliders.  We were checked on multiple times if we were okay.  Located near the "The Block" shopping center.

Got to go order of potstickers & sesame jack chicken strips  and both were fresh, temp nice & hot and both really good! The California Chicken Club was very good too.  Normally don't like french fries but they were crisp and seasoned good, I actually liked them.

I am giving them one star because my experience was completely unacceptable. Me and my fiance wanted to go watch some football and we sat at the bar because those are our preferred seats. I ordered a beer off the happy hour menu, as did my fiance. Sadly the bartenders didn't know the prices of any of the drinks but that is not my reason for the one star. The reason is because for the whole time we sat there, about 2 hrs, not once did we see these bartenders (3) wash their hands once. They were wiping their hands on their jersey or their pants and continuing on making another drink, squeezing limes and getting beers. They also never once washed the mixer cups, we saw them make multiple Margaritas, a Hawaiian Drink and a midori sour all using the same unwashed glassware. I am sorry but that is completely filthy and a serious health concern, what if someone was allergic to pineapple juice or another ingredient in those other drinks? Anyways, we will definitely not be going back based of the lack of cleanliness from the bartenders.
I'd give it a 5 if they had a sign to remind me about endless apps when I walked through the door

Sarinah was a GREAT server and the food was good, but I was so grossed out by the restroom (as was my husband in his), that I won't be returning to this location. The health department should shut them down!

I looked up the hours noticed the reviews, chose to ignore them and be biased. Came to this location tonight and well the reviews sadly had to be completely right. This place sucks so badly it's sad horrible establishment I don't even care to explain the multiple reasons why UGHHH.  Feels good to let it out...

We got to the restaurant at 10:20 and chose a seat at the bar. For a Saturday it was not very busy and there were several empty seats. Our waiter came by twice, once for drinks and once for our order, a salad and three sliders. After about twenty minutes we noticed others getting their food and they had arrived after us. At about 10:55 we decided to finish our waters and leave, having never gotten our salad or sliders and watching people around us get food who had arrived later than us. I know this is not fine dining but nearly forty minutes? I'm sure the waiter did not bother to put the order in so we left hungry.

I went to dinner to this place, the food and service was good but right after i got home, I got real ill. we called and report it to the manager on duty and she said she will notify the kitchen people and will call me the next day to check up on me. two days went by and I received no call from them and when we called the restaurant, The manager on duty not only didnt know about the incident but keep referring me to call their general manager.. I called the health department and made a complaint and also called TGIF corp office... A lady from their corp. office called and left a massage on my voice mail that she was the director of operation and to call her back. I called the number and left a detailed message and never heard back from them. My main concern was a bacteria outbreak food poisoning like the one with chipotle, didn't want anyone else to get sick and also just a call back from whomever to check up on me to make sure i didn't die. These people don't care about people, they only care about up-selling you and collecting cash. Wellness call back wouldn't cost them anything and I would probably would of give them a second chance. DO NOT EAT AT TGIF IN ORANGE MALL.

Experience was ok. Wasn't really wowed!!!!  Didn't really like the table location because everyone was touching my back as they passed by. No room for movement. Televisions all over the place. That's a plus.  Food was exceptional. Parking sucked. Wait time was 45 minutes even if tables were available.

I have eaten here before with disappointing results at lunchtime but this time I came for dinner and the wonderful server, Cody, made all of the difference. Knowledgeable regarding the menu and suggestions, quick with good service. Truly wanted to make this dining experience a good one. I had the 2 items for $14.99. I chose the sirloin and bacon wrapped shrimp and the sides were lemon broccoli and crispy Brussels sprouts. The steak and shrimp were perfectly cooked, as was the broccoli. The Brussels sprouts tasted salty, probably from the sauce. Topped it off with a glass of Pinot noir. I will come back here for dinner.

We came today for the all day happy hour. And we were disappointed at first that the website mislead us that the happy hour was supposed to be all day. Then we found out that not all TGIF has happy hour all day.  Ruben, the manager was nice enough to give us the happy hour price on our appetizers. And gave us complimentary dessert.

Sure, happy hour all day on Sunday's, but at what cost? My buddies love eating on a budget and I'm all up for that, but when you plan last minute, but expect great service...
