We visited this location and were planning to watch some of the football games (pre-season). The server relocated us way back in the corner of the restaurant, where it was warm and muggy. The server was nice and attentive, but didn't realize we wanted a section with a TV apparently. There were a few mix ups with our drinks, but that wasn't the major problems. The real issue was when the food orders were incorrect. Also, asking for extra sauces was a pain because we received them towards the end of finishing our meals. Honestly, I'm not sure if it was too busy for the server or just lack of caring. I've been to this restaurant many times other than Sunday's, so I'll keep updating this each time the experience becomes better or worse.

The absolute worst service around. We gave this place a couple chances because we had a gift card and after our experience last night we will never return to this location. Their servers don't care, their bartenders don't care and also their managers don't care.  I'm not one of those to put down in detail every thing that went wrong so let me just warn you, DO NOT GO THERE!! If you don't desire to tip and just want really crappy food then that's the place for you. I have predicted this place will be out of business shortly.  This place is a joke and they should be embarrassed. We are from the service industry so that says a lot.  ZERO STARS
Took for ever to get decent service the waiters were rude and did not bring food in a timely manner worst part of it all was it was not even that busy so they should have no excuse

It was a Tuesday afternoon, my girlfriend and I were having trouble deciding what to eat. Since we were around the area and she has never tried TGI Friday's, we decided why not? We ordered the rib eye steak and lobster, the artichoke flatbread, and the chicken quesadilla. The food was good and affordable but what made our visit even better was our server! I'm not sure how to spell his name because it's so unique but he said his name was Mossimo (I tried my best). His upbeat personality and funny puns made our visit so much more enjoyable! We all shared laughs and he never failed to check up on us. If we come back, it'll definitely be for him!

I have to say Dillon is one of the best servers I have ever met. I'm not from the area but I will be coming back here just to be help by him. I work for a customers service company based on reviews. This is no doubt the best TGIF that I have ever been to. Dillon has such a great personality and business values. He's recommendations were awesome we spent over 200 dollars and it was so worth it I will do it again. Thank you very much!!!

Wow just wow.  Came in on a Thursday night 3/30/17 & received the most crappiest service.  Walked in around 12:30 am. Was told that the kitchen closes at 1:30 so we decided to put our name down. Takes about 30 minutes to be seated. After being seated, Jocelyn comes to our  table and takes our order. We receive our food about 40 minutes later (1:40 am). My steak came out cold, our side of battered shrimp was still frozen, water wasn't refilled, and the waitress stood right in front of our table waiting for us to pay.  Around 1:55 we were told that we had to leave the restaurant in 3 minutes. What the hell ?! How are you going to tell us that we have to leave after waiting more than an hour to even eat?! Why close your kitchen at 1:30 if it takes 40 minutes for our food to come out?!  we paid for 130+ for dry mac & cheese, cold over cooked steak, frozen shrimp, and bad service.. Horrible service. Going to message the corp franchise now or something, this was unacceptable.

Great customer service, and amazing food. Somewhat pricey though. We got there and we were served right away. We didn't have to wait much. And the food was just amazing , and the staff was very pleasant .

I would give this place 4 stars for the food, but 2 stars for the service. If you come here late at night (after 11pm) expect SLOW service! There's a wait to get seated even though most of the tables are empty and the food comes out slow as well. Probably due to a lack of workers late at night.  I love coming here on Wednesdays after Dave & Busters (1/2 off games on Weds). They changed their rib special. Their Wednesday rib special is now called "ribs & ribbons" and you have to buy a drink in order to order a full rack of ribs for $12. The ribs come with two sides such as: mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, fries, sweet potato fries, broccoli, jasmine rice etc. I got the fries & mac and cheese. For the mac and cheese they used the penne shaped pasta, instead of the macaroni shaped pasta. It was also not as cheesy I would have liked it to be. You can also ask them to split your rack of ribs into two plates if you are sharing with someone (they also split the sides for you :D).  During late night, they have half off appetizers, $1.50 per slider, $1.50 for a basket of fries, and beers such as Heineken for $3.

My husband and I always loved going here but last Friday we were sadly disappointed. I ordered a house salad which has shrunk, the 6 oz. steak with baked potato and mixed veggies. The steak I had half of it was gristle had to spit out, and tasteless. Their prices have gone over board. Just not worth going anymore. They've taken off my husband's favorite salmon dish and the one he got he said was also tasteless. And the price for the steak and salmon was super high, just too much for what you get.

The food here is good and always comes out nice and hot and it isn't too pricey. What I don't recommend is coming here during the weekend because the wait pretty long. During the weekday the service is a little bit more quicker, but I guess it depends who your server is.

The server was accommodating but the service was pretty slow. It took about 30 minutes to get the drinks we ordered. It took a little over 40 minutes to get the food out (appetizers).  BBQ Flatbread wasn't super hot when it came out so it was not very good. Took it home and heated it up and tasted way better. HINT HINT serve your food the right temperature for best results TGIF..  Sliders were good though, hard to mess up a cheeseburger. As long as you don't forget the cheese.  Otherwise, atmosphere is like any other TGIF, bar in the center and lots of TV's.

I don't know. Everything on the menu is pretty "average". Their appetizers are okay, but sometimes their cheese sticks don't even have enough cheese inside of them. One time I spent 40 minutes with my friend just waiting for the check. After complaining on line, they did invite us back to dine again for free. Unfortunately the food wasn't really worth coming back.
Good food at a solid price. Thanks to our server Romero for providing attentive service as well. Will be sure to do the endless appetizers next time.

We came here while on holiday in LA, our kids had heard of TGIF and wanted to try it.  There was a fabulous ambience and the decor welcoming.   The cocktails were well made and our food was really good: the salmon was sublime, the surf 'n' turf lobster was gorgeous and burgers very tasty.  Our waiter was attentive and efficient and we had no complaints. We had no room for desserts but they looked delicious.  Thanks TGIF for a great meal.

I took my husband out for dinner tonight and I have to say I was completely shocked at the quality of foods service being that it was super busy, it was so delicious and our server Kendra was awesome!  We definitely will be coming back for more lobster!
Friday's is the business!! Great service and amazing happy hour!!! Usually pretty busy!!! Great vibes!!!

Horrible experience. Our server Maren, was very rude and had the worst attitude. We were not aware of the non-sharing policy with the appetizers and she treated us with such disrespect to inform us about that. We ended up being charged $45 dollars for a mere 20 wings and some drinks. They can forget about my and my family's business. Never going back there. Stay away if you want to have a decent time! Also, really loud, busy, and slow service.

We came here for dinner tonight on a Thursday, food tastes horrible, we have been to Fridays in Cerritos many times and its good but not here. My chicken was the only thing that tasted good and was hot, the mashed potatoes were cold and way to creamy my broccoli was cold my salad dressing doesnt taste like ranch at all. My wife had the Roast beef dip and she said it was ok but nothing special and she didnt like the mashed potatoes either. She had two kinds of soup because she sent the chedder broccoli back for being way to cheesy and then the tomato bisk tastes just awful like its straight spaghetti sauce from the jar. I asked for more ranch dressing and it took so long to get it that they brought my dinner before i even started on the salad. Very bad dinner tonight.

Had the pleasure of coming here with my girlfriend!! Came on a Friday night and we downloaded the Rewards app so we got a free appetizer!  Rewards app so worth downloading ! Highly recommend this place. Their spinach dip was really good!!!' We had the pasta and steak and salmon. The food here is bomb and the place has good vibes and on top of that..Our waitress was Caitlin and she was very helpful and super patient with us. She had the perfect order and answered all our questions . Her energy was just perfect and she made the experience just so much better! Thank you so much ! I look forward to coming here again!!!

Came here a little before 11pm.  Our server (Leanne) took our order (your Friday appetizer and an Oreo dessert). It took the server over 30 mins to bring out our appetizer.(btw my potato skins were burnt that they weren't even potatos more like hard burn pieces). Her excuse was "I didn't put in your order for the dessert yet bc I didn't want it to melt while it was sitting there"  My intention of that would be that she took a lunch break without even putting out order in... ?  Then we waited an hour to get the check after we asked for it.  If it was busy , I understand but this lady was only in charge of 4 tables..  The server continuously stopped by the other three tables and avoided our table with putting our back to us all the time.  Another thing is that while watching her we would see her wipe her sweat from her forehead and touch the plates right in front of us. I live close and this place is open late so this is my go to spot but I was very disappointed in the service I received..  If I could I would give the service zero stars.. Very disappointed and won't be coming back

Our server was one of the best we have been served by , his recommendations were spot on and we appreciated the attention to our table.  The kids ordered from the kids menu and I have attached it in case anyone needs it later. Thank you very much for the wonderful experience Jaime is the best server! Thank you so much!
The service is really slow. It took a long time to bring my food out after I ordered. But my food was really fresh and good. I jus wish service was a little faster

As a huge fan of TGI Fridays I have been to many of them. This one by far is the best! I don't know why the star rating is so low. When my boyfriend and I go it's usually pretty busy, but we always find the table at the bar and the service has been fantastic! Usually when you sit at the bar you give up a good service for a faster seat, but that's not the case at this location. Keep up the great work!
Great Service!  I love the bartenders they are all so friendly and willing to start a conversation with you. You don't come here just for the food, you also come for the service!
Love that they have happy hour twice a day. The food is excellent love the jack Daniel Friday sliders . I always sit at the bar ,bartenders are nice fast service. Good job you guys.
Terrible service, very slow to bring out food, the burger I ordered was nasty and meat wasn't fresh. Never coming back to this location. Yuck

Worst service ever! Not going back to this location ever again! They need better waitresses bottom line Natasha was so bothered with us asking for things and she never brought back what we asked for but she also didn't get a tip!! Avoid this place if at all possible!!!

I ordered the steak and lobster, my friend ordered the chicken salad. After waiting for half hour, they brought us shitty food. The chicken is cold, not crispy. The steak is supposed to be medium rare and it looks like it is overcooked. The broccoli is old and dry. I don't think they can cook at all. Never gonna come again.
The food here is so awful.  My fries were so salty.  The slider was burnt.  The atmosphere is old and dated.  I certainly understand the low ratings now for this location.
This place is fucking terrible! Shit service, disgusting food, the tables are really greasy. I am so pissed I wasted $100 on this shit. Fuck TGI they can go kill themselves.
I was greeted by a great, friendly host. Food was excellent til I found a piece of paper in my salad. Not cool

Went here for Lunch with family friends to celebrate my Dad's birthday. We wanted to eat at Market Broiler but they were closed for an event. Last minute choice was this place. We have the Simon's coupon and they have 20% off for TGIF for food. We were a big party, and ordering lots of food and drinks. At the end we got the bill, showed our coupon and the girl came back with the discounted receipt. I asked the lady as to how the discounts is applied, and she said 20% of our total, and it wasn't adding to that. So I told her about it and she left and when she came back, she came back with a NASTY MANAGER that came to our table and said "Who has a problem with the bill?" In front of everyone, and asked it so loud, our whole party turned around to her and I said it was me. I wanted to say something to her as to what the hell is her problem but I didn't want to ruin the atmosphere. She ruined and embarrassed me. We were there around 1 PM until almost 4 PM on 02/15/2016.
Tried out their happy hour and omg, amazing!! $5 boneless wings, $6 drinks, $2 fries. Our server Nathan was extremely nice! Will definitely be returning!

I love going here when there's deals like their 2 for $10 deal.. one appetizer and one entree for $10 ! My all-time favorite entree is the top sirloin with jack daniel's sauce and a side of loaded mashed potatoes and a side of sweet potato fries.  Their green bean fries are my favorite also!  It reminds me of fried zucchini.  It comes with a wasabi flavored ranch or something..REALLY GOOD :) The spinach flatbread is also delicious, tastes like pizza :)
Great service and bartending, however I asked for the $4 happy every hour Long Islands and got charge $9.25/piece before I knew it, and was told this is privately owned so they don't do that...

Having dessert past 10 pm?  This is one of the best people watching places. This location is always busy and crowded. in the bar and in the restaurant.  I find the food is inconsistent, but overall it's still within it's chain's standard of quality.  The servers are as nice as they can be for a few seconds because they are super busy.  I would recommend going on off beat hours since the bar area fills up pretty quickly, especially bad at night & on weekends. Overall it's in a pretty central location of orange county.  There are also other food/ beverage options in this area since it's in the block.
This franchise does not honor national advertised specials.

My girlfriend and I come here once a month to enjoy a 2 for 20 meal and a beer. The server we had was pretty lame. She was super mono tone, and I could tell that she did not want to be there. The food was excellent. We got the Pasta with chicken and shrimp. 2 Meals for only 26 bucks you cant go wrong with that! They charge an extra 3 bucks for certain menu items on the 2 for 20, but when you are ballin on a budget, you gotta work with what you have! I know that at the bar, the drinks are pretty strong, and not watered down.

Came here for St Patrick's day to have dinner and drink some green beer. Surprisingly wait was only about 15 minutes. Not bad considering the whole world was out drinking. They sat us by the bar so everything was really loud and just an absolute racous. I ordered a Rib eye steak and lobster dinner with parmesean potatoes and garlic mashed potatoes. To drink I had green bud lights which kept coming all night. The food was decent but nothing to write home about. The steak was actually cooked to perfection and very flavorful.  The lobster was grilled so it came extremely dry. I had to peel it off the shelf so it looked like I was peeling a giant cock a roach.  Not the most appealing .  The parmesean potatoes were fried and they were not good. It seemed like they had gone to the fryer one too many times. The mashed potatoes were good. In all considering I was eating steak and lobster at Tgif for $23 it wasn't to bad of a deal. It turned out to be a fun night and everyone was feeling tipsy towards the nights end. The atmosphere was enjoyable too.  Would probably come again but just to drink and socialize,  not for the food.

So with a party of 25 and 7 different checks our wait or geroge was awesome and did an excellent job thank you geroge best wait or we have ever had in the last 5 years we have come here for birthday parties

We decided to go to TGIF on a Friday to have some drinks and dinner. The wait was 45 minutes for 2. We decided to grab some drinks at the bar while our table became available. Unfortunately, the bar smelled really bad. Probably from drunk people spilling their drinks. The food wasn't so great either. They currently have a good deal going on right now, 2 for $20 which is nice so you can save a buck or 2.
The hostess has already gotten off on the wrong foot with my girlfriend and I. I didn't know it takes 5+ minutes to get a table in an uncrowded restaurant.

I never thought I would ever be writing a review about a chain like TGI's...but I am! This TGI is located on the outskirts of the Block @ Orange. We stopped in here Sunday night for my bf's friends bday. It was paaaaaaacked D:  I never would have thunk that this place gets cracked up like this on a Sunday, but it was. They were on a wait, but thankfully our party had already claimed a large table. I shared the Chicken Florentine pasta...it was blehhh. Pasta was way overcooked and the sauce was just weird :\ I wouldn't recommend it nor will I ever order it again. Now....the drinks are another story. One word....STRONG, or maybe I'm just a pansy nowadays. I don't remember them pouring so heavy at other locations. I ordered the Patron Wildberry Mojito and Mango Berry Margarita. Both sounded so tasty, but all I ended up tasting was alcohol! If you're looking for a place to savor/enjoy your drink, go somewhere else. If you're looking to get crunk...get here now.

Terrible service!  We waited over an hour only to be given several different excuses about why our party couldn't be seated. Finally after insisting on be seated in an area we were told had no server, we complained to the manager and he was defensive and didn't care. Because of the time invested in waiting, and the lateness of the hour, we stayed and had ok service. The waiter tried to redeem our experience but overall, the food was only ok, management sucked, and the not so friendly hostesses were terrible. WILL NOT COME BACK TO THIS FRIDAYS!
Our waitress keeps calling us "hun" and asked right away if we were gonna do one check or separate checks. I think I'm gonna stick to my South Coast TGIFridays from now on. Very disappointed. :(
Food was ok, but it's a dead zone (wrote this review at home). Very little or no signal at all, no wifi.

Would give 0 stars if I could. Absolutely terrible service. This is now the second time I have had this experience with a hostess like this at tgi Fridays. Absolute joke of service. Someone needs to train them ASAP on customer service. Terrible experience and to top it off they got my order wrong (after waiting 30 minutes in the restaurant for my to go order after giving them 30 minutes for me to get there despite the 10 minutes they said... without any acknowledgment of anything. Won't wver go back after this second time
I would have given you guys 5 stars if I didnt have to pay for the game I thought was free. Great food, awesome drinks and of course amazing company

I've come here a lot but tonight was disappointing. We came here for happy hour, asked the server what was on the happy hour and she gave us the menu. All 5 of us ordered off the happy hour menu and she came somewhat reasonably to check in and get our next orders but didn't clear the table of our empty glasses or plates which is annoying of itself. We stacked everything and put it at the end of the table to even make it easy....she came and asked if we wanted another drink or if we were ready to tao out (it was our second drink) and we said we were no where near ready to tap. She came back and we all ordered our next round and she asked if we wanted our checks split or all together (didn't even asked if we wanted anything else). So we asked to split it since she could and when we got our bills we found out that our last round of drinks weren't on happy hour and we paid full price. Now I get that it's not a HUGE deal but I've never gone anywhere ordering on happy hour and not been told when it was almost over or that it was over. I would've ordered something different had I known we weren't on happy hour anymore. And to top it all off, one of us in the group paid by cash and the change due back to us was less then .25 and she didn't even give it to us. Again not a HUGE deal but really....just not a good experience.

Went here last night because well why not? The server was great, and probably one of the best servers we've had. We sat at the bar, around 1145. Nice guy. I'm not knocking him off for service, but when we checked out, we put two cards in. Somehow, something messed up, because my signed copy was a certain amount and my bank statement is a different amount. I touch based with my friend, and she said they charged her twice, my bill and her own. According to the receipts  & bank statement, we got charged twice.   I'm not quite sure what happened. I am thinking a server error while ringing us up and maybe he voided it but didn't tell us what went wrong, and now we have to call the bank and TGIF to sort things out. This is now the 2nd time something like this has happened to me at this location, so I don't know if their computer system is messing things up or if both time it's a server error.

I must say that the manager Fidel is a great manager and he takes care of his restaurant. I saw him once call the cops on these people who threatened to come back and kill him.. He stayed calm, got them out, and reassured the staff that it would be alright. (the guy never came back btw. he was schwasted.)

I was here yesterday to celebrate my boyfriends birthday made a reservation for 20 and had everything ready before the time of arrival of my guest. Loved the vibe and the way our waiter treated us. The food was amazing the drinks were great also. And the best part all the waiters came and sang Happy Birthday to my boyfriend. Really recommend coming here..
I love the sesame seed jack chicken strips. Good place to eat just that simple. Make sure you sign up for the tgif rewards for free stuff.

Wow crowded on a Tuesday dinner night after work. Yup stripe pass worked and service actually awesome! Outskirts of The Block. Sorry I think TGI Friday's are all not worth reviewing but I still have to tell folks whats up right? =/  Definitely American food, and not good American food... more of an atmosphere joint to go with coworkers and such.P.S. Use your free Rewards Card to skip the line....pss don't expect too much from your server Thats it

The experience here for my bday was the worst I have ever had at any restaurant. Our reservations were for 25 and unfortunately our party turned into 30+ the manager Fidel was very rude and refused to accommodate my party. We tried to reason with him if we can get other tables outside and so forth and he refused that our reservations were only for 25 and that's all he can do. He also stated that if we didn't like that we can go somewhere to our surprised we were shocked of his way of representing the business, he refused to give his name unfortunately I got through another manger that was very nice and surprised of how Fidel was treating his customers. He lost a good crowd and sure didn't care to please his clients. If you ever decide to celebrate your bday with a good crowd of good customers make sure you pick another place that place sucked thanks to Fidel, that used to be one of my favorite happy hours spots.

Service was alright, not the best nor the worst. She gave me a free refill on my Wild Berry Lemonade, so yay! Our appetizers were: Pick Three-For-All, traditional wings, loaded potato skins, and fried mozzarella. Then another order of buffalo wings.  And here's my favorite part: Rib-Eye (medium rare) + Half-Rack of Ribs, sides were baked potato and veggies. Yum! This made my night. At first I was hesitating on ordering their ribs because my last experience at another T.G.I. Friday wasn't so great. It was so dry and just wasn't good. But I decided to give this location a try and I'm totally coming back for their steaks and ribs. My steak was so good. Tender and juicy, just how I like it. Oh, and try their Wild Berry Lemonade. It's sooooo good. Well, if you're a lemonade lover then you'll love it! Not too sour or sweet. It's just right.
Came in on a thursday and food was good had to wait for my mac and cheese halfway through my meal but it was ok friendly service and nice people. Sucks they didnt have Oktoberfest but thats fine.

I love coming in for happy hour after a long day of work. The bartenders are super friendly and make make great drinks. And their prices can't be beat. I always have to get a bowl of French onion soup when I'm there. It's to die for!

Yikes, it seems like every time I come here they always have a high rate of inconsistency. Some nights you get great food but Most nights you get food that sits under the heating lamp drying out and getting crusty and gross. How hard is it to grill a steak? Honestly, a well trained professional shouldn't struggle. Ordered medium rare, got it medium the first time and then the second time got it rare. The mashed potatoes dry and old, and the mac and cheese was cold. The broccoli and cheese soup is usually great, but not when it's been sitting under the heating lamp for some time. The service here ranges from absolutely terrible to mediocre, at best. Rarely do you get checked on by your server and sadly they don't care or pretend to care if you have any problems with your food. The management is atrocious too. They fall way below on the professional scale, if you can even consider them that. They prioritize their food waste and cost over the needs of their customers.

Been waiting for 30 min walk up to the lady and she says they called me but i was sitting next to where they called. All they can say it miscommunication wow. We will see how long before the manager comes to see us. Ask about the $3 dollars special for a drink. They say it only pertain to the east coast. It funny it doesnt say that on the website.
Food was good server was good. Some hosts need to feel more genuine not fake or rude.
The Jack Daniels flat iron is great. I order it every time except once. Did not like the other steak I tried, the Jack Daniels ribeye

Just sharing my experience from today.  This is the comment I left on their web comment area: Came to the restaurant today for a dessert option.  We were disappointed in our visit for two reasons. We were charged for the birthday dessert the server brought out.  Normally, this would not be a big deal; but, we came here for dessert and did not order that item.  The fact that we were charged for the birthday dessert in this case was a bit distasteful.  We were not aware of this until the bill came. The other item was not a big deal.  We were trying to watch the USC game.  Among the many screens that were displaying, we requested the game to be displayed on one of the screens.  The hostess seemed dumbfounded on how to handle this when she was seating us.  Afterwards, we asked our server, who was more than happy to check for us; but, we never did get the game on on any of the screens in front of us. My friends and I were disappointed in this experience and one of them was talking about sharing their experience on social media.  I hope that this is an isolated situation and not something that your patrons typically experience.

Service: we got a good-hearted waitress, she spaced out a few times but always redeemed herself when she caught up with what she had blanked out about.  Super nice though. Good:  Split a cheeseburger and couldn't go wrong with it.  It's not outstanding, but sure enough, it is a plain cheeseburger.   Meh:  Would never do their chicken salad again.  It was supposed to be a ceasar salad but it came with italian dressing, and did not scream ceasar to me at all. I like that they do offer drinks here, can always add a refreshing beverage to compliment my meal.  I just wouldn't go out of my way to come here, I think we just came because we had a gift card.  It's happening for sure, but maybe I'm just not big on these chain type of places anymore, just not my scene.  Foodie snobs, stay away.

Food was really good. Came here on a Tuesday night and it was super crowded, so service wasn't as good. Overall I like the food and drinks they serve here. Love how they have tvs where I can catch up on Angels baseball game. I will definitely come back

Love this place! First time I went was 2 weeks ago my server wasn't that great but the food was awesome so I hat to come back! I went last Monday and I gotta say my server I think her name was Teresa was great!!! Definitely coming back! Ask for Teresa!

I really don't have high expectations when it comes to restaurants, of course it is just a business and the best place to eat is at home because you know what you're getting. But my friends and I decided to go out and we ended up at TGI Fridays. She ordered a hamburger and I ordered a salad. She only ate part of a hamburger because she said that it tasted funny and the ingredients inside of it didn't look too appetizing. My salad was okay, what can you really do to a salad? The thing that really made this review 01 was the fact that the drinks were horrible. She went on the safe side and just got herself a draft beer. I decided to get adventurous and get a cocktail. The cocktail was really weak. When I asked him if they would be willing to fix it, they brought me a shot and told me to enjoy and they apologized. When I got the bill they charged me for the week drink and the shot. I was not told that I was going to get charged for  shot and if I would have known I would not have even order the shot in the first place. If the drink would have been made correctly in the first first place, I would not have ordered the shot. That was their way of hiking up a $10 drink to $20. My drink ended up being $20. I could have gone to an actual bar for that price. Not coming back again. I asked to speak to the manager but I was told by my server that they couldn't do anything about it.

I don't get the low reviews from people.  I'm not newb and I've been to expensive restaurants.  (Just check my reviews).  I think TGIF is great (at least this one).  I have to admit I've been to others (near Knott's) which deserve 1 star.  They are horrible in every way imaginable.... not clean, food is horrible, dry, and tasteless and old and service is BAD.   Here, however, I feel all of the above are good and always has been.  I've not had a bad experience here so I don't get it when people give it low reviews.  I was just here for lunch meeting a client and business investor and I had the cheeseburger w/ wedge salad.  Both were delicious and made just how I like them.  Fresh.  My friend ordered a rib eye...(yes for lunch) and he seemed to enjoy it. Anyway, good deal and good food.

My daughter and I went here before the Angels v. Mariners game.  I ordered the nacho's which was $5+ at happy hour.  She had the petite steak. She said her steak was okay, but the nachos were indecent.  The chicken pieces were rubbery, which led me to believe they weren't really chicken.  There were only traces of cheese on the nachos and it just wasn't good.

They used to give you their garlic bread with every meal but now they charge you 99 cents for 2 and like $3 for 5? Fail. And the food was just average nothing really to brag about anymore. I think they've lost their touch and appeal.

We've recently come back because I had 2 buy one get one coupons and I wanted to use them. We had a party of 6 so our wait was a little long. No big deal with that. Elena was AMAZING! Totally on top of everything going on. The only down fall was we got our food and had to stop someone for knives, forks and what nots. Much better then our last visit. Also, I miss all the stuff they used to have on the walls. They've sort of changed direction in decor. Not too shabby though. I think it is funny that they are trying to go with the bar/night club vibe on the upper level. Super funny. All the way down to having a security guard stand there. HAHA!

I so wish we could give negative stars! I called on a Saturday afternoon to make a dinner reservation for Sunday. The guy who answered asked me to call back on Sunday morning to make the reservation. I understand that some places only take same-day reservations, so I asked if that was the case. He said no. He just felt that "the paper the reservations are written on will be lost before tomorrow".  This place is SO inept that they can't maintain a reservation for 29 hours.  Yeah, my party of 9 will be eating somewhere else.  Here's a tip for the manager... Invest in a RESERVATION BOOK!

I came here w/ my gf a couple of weeks ago.  I had a 20% off entire check coupon. We walked in and were asked how many in our party. We told the host that we wished to sit outside, but he told us that the patio was closed because he did not have a server working that area. We then requested a booth and were told "I don't know if I have one available" even though my gf was looking at one right in front of her. I think the host noticed cause he sat us at that one. I had a bud light on tap, and she had the mojito. The beer was on point. I ordered the French Dip Roast Beef Sandwich, and my gf had the three for all appetizer platter. My food was on point: Hands down the best French dip I've ever had. Over the years I've become very hesitant in ordering this item when offered at a restaurant because I usually end up disappointed. I decided to give it a try today and I'm very glad I did. I didn't try my gf's food but I think I'm safe to say it was good... Otherwise she wouldn't have eaten it all, would've told me she didn't like it, and wouldn't packed the leftovers to take home for her brother to eat (we hate wasting food). We also had dessert. All in all good was good, server was friendly, host could've been a little more slick but was still polite.

I like this place is a great place to come here with friends and family. I been coming to this location for a very long time is always a good time to come and their desserts are super good i usually always get the brownie with ice cream my favorite, they also have a great variety of alcoholic drinks. GOOD PLACE

Went last night to hit up happy hour! Probably the worst service I have ever seen and the worst place to be on any night of the week. Lets talk about 1) Wait time 2) Service 3) Bathroom 4) Quality 1) We came in at 11, the lady came and took our drinks order at 11:10, drinks did not arrive until 11:30... THERE IS NO EXCUSE FOR THIS! It was not even that busy, which upset me the most. We then waited until 11:40 for her to come back to take our order. We ordered, and did not receive the food until 12:10. WHAT A JOKE... 2) Service was absolutely horrible. At 12:00 I wanted to order a drink so I went to go look for our waiter (Yes, I stood up and went to find her). She was chatting it up with a fellow person at the bar (I don't even think she was working there). I had to stand in front of her and the person for literally 2 minutes to get her attention, and it was just awkward...  By the way, the only thing I ordered was a basket of fries, there is no way that takes 30 minutes to make. Fries sit in a fryer for 3 minutes and its ready, why did it take 30 minutes to only bring out fries??? 3) Wow... If the FDA came here, this place would be shut down. I walked into the bathroom, the smell... AHHH!!!! The first thing you see is paper towels ALL over the floor, even where they don't belong (by the toilet). The trash was overfilled and paper towels were everywhere. I was surprised that TGIF has not even been shut down yet. 4) The quality was not as bad, but the fries looked/tasted like they had been sitting out of the fryer for like 20 minutes (which they probably had been because it only takes 3 minutes to take fries).  Overall, I really think the manager needs to revisit their staff and seriously take care of the store. There should be no excuse for what I saw and experienced. Avoid this place at all costs, because trust me, you do not want to be here EVER in your life.

Not a place if you are handicapped. Parking is long walk from handicapped spaces around to front door. ladies bathroom was bad.  Handicapped stall inop.  No way a person in wheelchair could cope as door into restroom would take a strong man to open.  Few booths and tables for wheelchair person.

Wow services was so bad never had to food come out before the drinks. Had to go up and ask another table waiter to tell them I did not receive my drinks for 20 min!!! Never go here just go to bjs instead its right next to it.

Poor form guys. Tried setting up a reservation two days before my birthday and was told I have to call the day of the event to make a reservation. Called the day of to make the reservation and everything goes smoothly (so I think). We get there at the time of the reservation to find out the reservation paper was THROWN AWAY (not something you wanna say to a guest) and had to wait 45 minutes for a table. Defeats the purpose of making a reservation. Then food takes forever and when it does arrive a few dishes were cold. Management seemed to care less when we complained as well. I work in guest services and know what I experienced isn't acceptable. I came to this establishment because I had gone to several group events and never had an issue. After last night, I won't be spending my money at this location again.

TGI Friday's is a good place for a decent meal. Nothing special here, simply a casual dine-in restaurant. Food is fine, seems like in the last few years the quality of the food has decreased while pricing has increased but it's nothing to keep you away. They have a full bar and variety of menu items to choose from. It's always a coin toss on whether you'll get great customer service or mediocre service regardless, you'll never get outright bad service. If you decide to try this place, I do recommend their Jack Daniels Sauce, Spinach Dip, and Brownie Obsession. I think those are some of the better and more popular items on the menu.

Kind of slow at first but really friendly service and tasty food. There's also a little pad you can run your card through and pay with at your table. It's nice to not have to wait for a check on a busy night.

The place is very nice but EVERYTHING else is wrong. First we walk in there's no hostess or booth so it's very confusing and it would be impossible for the servers to know who came in first. The food was way below par tasted soggy and stale. Very unorganized and very disappointing for the price of what we ordered. The service started well and ended awfully. And lastly they were OUT of buffalo wings? How is that even possible? So sad considering the location is good and the actual restaurant is nice. I will never be coming again.

3 stars is being generous... But if it wasn't for the food, i would give this place 2 stars. I ordered the Flat Iron with mashed potatos and onion rings with a side of brocolli cheese soup. And when I first came here I ordered the JD Burger (i think thats what its called) But both dishes are good and it'll fill you up.  Can't believe I haven't ordered the Flat Iron before. NOW to the service: Service here SUCKS! The waitors and waitresses aren't friendly at all.  And they make you feel sort of stupid. We didn't see much of our waitress.  Did I get a refill for my drink? nope! And service was also really slow. Don't go through the Block to get here. Come from the street. theres a lot of work being done in the parking lot that it can get clustered. And also resist the urge to run over the group of dumbass little kids that walk in the middle of the parking lot. Food is good.. Service sucks. So your choice if you want to eat here or not.

Boyfriend and I decided to make a quick dinner date night yesterday.  He was craving American food. Blehs!  Sure, I might be in America, but I love my Asian food more than anything. It's pretty difficult to mess up a BLT, but TGIF's accomplished that hands down.  Bread was over toasted, mayo lacked flavor, and the ratio of bacon to tomato was just...off.  The only thing really good about my order was the fries.  The wasabi cucumber dip they provided wasn't quite rancid, but still, inedible to my palate.  2 stars for the excellent service however.  Our waitress was very friendly and accommodating.

I am not at all opposed to paying a large dinner bill for my family when I have great food &/ or great service. However a bill of $52.(without tip) for one adult and one child is ridiculous. We ordered 3 appetizers to share, one beverage and a water. Nothing spectacular, typical appetizers. Service was fine, as there was hardly anyone there. The cost of this visit will keep me away in the future, never again!

Arrived at 6pm, requested a table for 2, told a wait of 15 minutes.  30 minutes later I ask how much longer and was told 15 minutes.  45 minutes finally seated and the restaurant is 33% empty.   What?   Is this a Las Vegas club where you keep people in line to make it seem like a cracking spot?  No.  Just let me sit down so at least I can enjoy the game.  Food was as expected.  Service was above average.  But the hostess and practice of keeping people waiting is a joke.

Steak tasted like vomit, like it was spoiled or something.. Boyfriend tried it and had to spit it out in his napkin!! Sides were okay. Drinks tasted watered down and just off, the sam Adams on tap didn't taste right at all. Service was just okay. Never coming here again.

Dined there this evening with my husband and the kids. The hostess was not very friendly and ignored my son and myself when we asked a question. My husband and I ordered the Tuscany Chicken Salad. The chicken was dry and tasteless. I had asked for a different dressing and more than half way through my meal, my husband had to remind the waitress before I got it. My daughter's steak was 1/2 charbroiled while the other 1/2 was undercooked. My husband made himself some dinner when we got home. Definitely not worth what we paid.

I only come here after 10 pm. TGIF has a pretty decent happy hour. It is what it is. Your not going to find outstanding food here but when it's close to midnight and your hungry and thirsty and don't want to break your wallet. Well then tgif is your place. If your wondering where to take your date/gf out on a causal night with drinks without dressing up or going to dive bar. This is the place.  Bartenders all have different personalities. Some are nice, others talkative, some have a heavy hand, and some can do some flares.  My tip, come after 10pm for happy hour or have the dinner for 20 and upgrade to a better variety. I like the cajun chicken pasta!

The food here is not good, especially their sorry ass nachos. If you eat at the bar area during happy hours, you can get discount on some of the items. This place seems more like a just hang out than somewhere you would want to go eat.
are you kidding me? if you do not understand the cult following of tgifridays, then obviously you have no right in reading the rest of this review. only for the initiated. jack daniels burger ftw

The food is so yuck, the service is even worse! She took like half an hour to give us the check and another half an hour to get it done. I'm so disappointed at the service. They should improve it. I would never come back here again. And they charged us $2 for playing the Games and there was no service in the restaurant. I wish i can give this 0 star.

I was not that thrilled. The bartender--older gentleman w/the unusual hair color seems like he's been a bartender far too long. Everything he said seemed insincere--like he couldn't care less. We split nachos & they seemed bland w/a weird light colored runny nacho cheese. ..just weird. So basically, food sucked and the service sucked too.The music being played was pretty decent though....

I've been coming to this location for a long while now. To celebrate birthdays, girls night out or just simply for dinner. the times ive been here with friends have been good, except for the last time i came which was on a friday nite with two friends. we got there and the wait wasnt so bad, it was early too around 730 pm so that might be the reason why the wait wasnt so long. wait time on a friday night after 8ish is sometimes up to an hour. we got called and got seated on a table but we asked if we could be seated in a booth, which was no problem. yay for booths! haha our server came in and asked for our drink order, we already knew what we wanted so the three of us order the drinks that come in mason jars. we were so excited to get our drinks! but were soo dissapointed when he brought us the drinks! one of our friend did get her drink in a mason jar but me and my other friend got our drink in a regular tall glass... i asked the waiter about the jar and he said the drink we order didnt come in a mason jar and in hes words he told our other friend that got her drink in a mason jar "you got lucky". he left and for a moment i accepted what he told us. but then i was like no, our drink is under the mason jar drink menu and no where does it say the drink we order come in a regular tall glass. so when he came back i told him i wanted my mason jar because it does not say my drink comes in regular glass he then admits to messing up our order and tells us he'll bring our jars after we are done and i say no, i want my jar now. he goes back and brings the jars, empty. he then says it will cost more to order the same drink. at this point idgaf i just wanted my mason jar. but my other friend gets offended by what he says and asks for a manager. long story short, and after my friend telling him what happened he tells us he will cover our appetizers and drinks the manager takes our drinks with mason jars and fills them with our drink and brings them back and apologizes and also assigns a new waitress. after that everything went good! we all order the canjun chicken and shrimp (pasta with a sauce that taste kinda like alfredo sauce, shrimp and chicken) recommended by the waitress. it was really good. our drink was in a mason jar which you can take home, we got the june bug, it wasnt strong, but i did enjoy the taste, fruity taste. make sure they give you the drink in a mason jar!!!! as for appetizers i order the spinach and artichoke dip with chips, my all time favorite appetizer, my other two friends order boneless chicken wings and potato wedges. i was so upset they dont longer serve the tgif appetizer plater which came with chicken wings, mozzarella sticks and,  potato wedges. i was going to order dessert but i got full with my drink, appetizer, and dinner plate. but ive been craving the red velvet cake!! my favorite dessert from tgi fridays. sign up in there website and receive a free appetizer or dessert.
Good food...good coffee...yummie food.. Gets crowded tho..good service ...food takes a while to arrive tho

I come here a lot for lunches, and just recently dinner on a date, since I work so close.  This place is packed night and day, but service seems good.  The staff is always running around like chickens with their heads cut off, but they get the job done. The food is consistent and what you would expect from a national chain.  I keep coming back :-)

Went here with the bf for late night nomz after a late shift just before they were closing. They close at 2am, got there around 1:25ish.  Pricey and mediocre food. Got the trio app with boneless wings, potato skins, and green bean fries w/wasabi ranch dip. the wasabi ranch dip was my fav but I could have made that myself at home. Got a burger as main entree. Didn't even finish it cause it was so meh. BF got the buffalo chicken sandwich.  Total bill was ~35 for the two of us.  Server gave us apps and entree at same time cause they were sitting at the window. Felt like they were rushing us to leave cause it was almost 2 when food came out. Probably sticking with Mae's Cafe next time around for late night nomz.

Came here for dinner tonight. It was really really busy. We waited thirty minutes to be seated. Our server was nice. We ordered some drinks and dinner. I had a good time, only thing would say that we had to ask for utensils and server was busy. He was nice, just busy. Would come here again on a slower day to see how it is.

Came back again Thursday night and it's once again packed. I got the Buy One Get One Free coupon! Woohooo! Everything was A-OK not good not bad, but for some reasons, the food tasted better today. I got my usual Prime Rib Pasta, and it's delicious! We waited for about 5-10 mins. The host forgot us and called other party that arrived after us, but we sorted thing out and got seated right away. He didn't apologize though, but he didn't look like he was in a good mood. Oh well, I'm content with my experience at T.G.I.Friday's.

TGIF, if only it were like that everyday.  Now, this location is the only one I go to because it's the only one close to me. I must admit, their lunch specials and happy hours are spectacular, but to pay full price during dinner is pretty outrageous. That is why I HIGHLY recommend the "give me m ore stripes" club. Easy to sign up and you always get coupons and free meals.  The food: I always go for the jack daniel's burger or flat iron steak. The burger i can never go wrong with, YUM. However, although I love the steak, their consistency of cooking it is not up to par. If I'm paying $20 for a small steak, that better be one hell of a juicy med rare steak!  The desserts: i love them all, strawberry shortcake you stole my heart. Service: It is truly a hit or miss. Some waiters/waitresses will be on their A game and some is just filled with laziness or lack of remembering. I love the ones that refill my water without me having to ask. One of my biggest peeves here would be the staff members standing around gossiping around the restaurant. Don't get me wrong, it is okay to chat here and there, but if you were having full on group convos with customers all around, that's unacceptable. But hey it is TGIF, not Mastros.

If i could give this place -5 stars I would..... Came here with some friends to eat drink and chill. After waiting 20 minutes we finally sat down at a table outside in the cold, the heaters were not working that day for some reason. The waiter that was serving us was some dumb a** kid straight out of juvy or something. I had to repeat my order like 4 times before he got it, and still I received the wrong drink. To make things worse it took our meal over 40 minutes to arrive! To top it all off my plate had GLASS in it!  After all the BS, I requested to talk to the manager. The dude came over to our table after 20 minutes of waiting. He looked like he didnt care and refused to cover the food (I just took 1 bite). I explained to him the rediculously crappy service and deadly food - he took my name & number (with attitude) and said corporate would contact me (of course they didnt). He finally covered the meal ( after 15 minutes of his crap) and we left angry hungry. I will NEVER visit any TGI Fridays restaurant ever again, and I suggest you do too!

WORST!!!!!! Experience ever we got there there was a wait and we did understand that it was busy day of coarse weekend which we waited like 15 min then they call us in we got seated and then they gave us the menu we order or food and waited forever bad bad service they have this new machine at ur tanks were u get to see ur bill and pay straight there so we. Did we paid in the table machine we were heading out the the waitress and Manager ran out the door when we hear them say HEY!!!! U didn't pay ur bill OMG I was so embarrassing and ofcoarse really really upset cause we had ask the same waitress if we could pay from our table and she even said yes so people if u go there please ask for the check cause waitress are just so stupid excuse my language but I'm definitely not going back there terrible service 0 starts for them

Solid place for late happy hour. Appetizer is half price and some drinks are on special.  I always get so messed up when I come here with my BFF :/ We always end up getting shot shot shot.... Great memories though.
Not to bad of a place for lunch. Loved the fried green bean and my pasta was yummy.

Food Review: I'll tell you straight up. I only like the Jack Daniel's Steak. I love the damn goodness sauce they give!! Anything with the Jack Daniel dipping sauce, get it! You won't be disappointed. (Unless you don't fancy sweet dipping sauce). I always liked their Caesar salad as well and the bread sticks are delicious. The atmosphere is cheery, everyone there is there for a good time.. socializing or watching a game. Supposedly they do daily deals.. happy hour or some certain cocktail. Negative 1 Star for  the slow service. I seemed to always be flagging down the waiter/tress..  I come back here when I get a Jack Daniel sauce craving.

I brought my boyfriend here for his birthday last week & was really excited to have dinner here. We order potato skins as an appetizer & when my boyfriend took a bite of his potato skin he found it rather painful. There was a ROCK in his potato skin & when the server came back after telling his manager his reason was, "My manager said that potatoes grow from the ground where there's like dirt & rocks. So we probably didn't wash them correctly."  For bringing someone here for their birthday dinner & being that it was my first time ring there, I do not plan on coming back here ever again.

Lunch with the Bestie! Yum! Free dessert! I always enjoy the Crispy Green Bean Fries as a appetizer.  I'm a Fridays member so when you flash your card you get automatic free chips and salsa. Sign up! Its Free. And points add up, its how I got my free dessert.

20 minutes and we get a table, okay the restaurant is not even half full. 10 more minutes waiting for a server we decided to leave and go next door to Bj's. Within 5 minutes of the my visit to Bj's we have a table drinks and appetizers ordered.

Their happy hour always has good deals. Their food has always been good. I'm a big fan of the chicken and shrimp pasta.  I think their prices could be couple dollars cheaper.  One con: Seeing how they have a bar, and ppl always come to watch games. They could invest in some large TV's. Ppl sitting in the booths and tables probably would want to watch the games too.

The 2 for $20 deal isn't bad. But I could microwave my own frozen food, thank you. Giving this 3 stars not 2, because the service was surprisingly good when I went. I understand that this has not been the case for all patrons.
Food was pretty disgusting. Nice and dry and extra salty. Guess the food wouldn't be so bad after a few drinks.

I went there during Lunch on Sunday. Horribly LOUD! I've never been to any restaurant that loud. Me and my husband had to shout to talk with. I understand people are watching football and stuff but it was beyond normal..   Food was bad too. My husband got a burger which was very cold(maybe Carls Jr right next could be better for getting a burger) my shrimp was ok but the plate was very very dirty. I really hope they washed well..;; After short Lunch time, we had to run out from that loud hell. Maybe for some people who like to be in a place that's louder than karaoke room ,this is a perfect place!DUH
It's Fridays. You come here for convenience, not culinary nirvana.

OMG! so we had lunch here and this waitress (blonde one near the window facing the parking lot)  didnt even give us  time to breathe..its like she wants to turn tables or something.  we barely get our menus and this chick already expects us to order..i mean come on we're barely putting our purses down..ughh!  tried the 3 entree's for 2.. we asked for the boneless buffalo wings regular..but received the spicy ones. and couldn't find our waitress ;(  than bruschetta chicken pasta and my fried order the petite steak dish requested it to be medium-rare and of course it wasn't. Service was very lacking.  and for dessert we had the oreo sandwich ice cream.

Came to this place twice and they sucked ass both times...  We went on Saturday nights both times and this was our experience: First time we went, the waiter was fine until she forgot the one mixed drink that was ordered for the whole table.  The Jack Daniels Sample Platter looked awesome in the menu photo, but came out looking terrible.  The ribs were dry and looked like it came from some poor emaciated animal and everything fried had a faint burnt taste to it.  This major chain restaurant put out food of truck stop diner quality.  We left a tip out of pity and habit. The second time, the waiter couldn't even bring us a menu.  He took our drink orders and the rest our time in the restaurant was spent gazing in disgust and frustration at his rear end as he hovered over the two female diners seated across from us who had finished eating their dinners.  He was trying to spit game while donning his waiter garb and smelling like fried food!  Rather than complain, we just got up and left so we could spend our money elsewhere.  We vowed never to go back to this trashy location.  An awful experience!!! Avoid this place like the plague!  The male waiter we had was a complete douche and the food is mediocre at best!

Got a call from an old roommate for a late night drink but couldn't find a decent place that opened late until we found TGIF.  Came inside to a very chill waiter and very good atmosphere . Happy hour specials were amazeballs! Ultimate Long Island & ultimate margarita tasted very watered down but I guess you can't expect much from $5 happy hour menu :P . Ordered sampler platter (fried mozzarella, BBQ chicken wings, celery sticks, and potato bites) & nachos .  We were there for about 20 minutes until the waiter had informed us that last call was at 12:30 And they would be closing at 1. I had called earlier to ask about the times and was told last call would be at 1:30. So our outing was unexpectedly cut short an hour. We ordered nachos to end the night and oh did that save our night.  Downside: waiter basically stared us down and rushed us out the door & miscommunication of restaurant hours. Plus side: happy hour prices & nachos :) 1 star for nachos that saved the night . 1 star for prices .  1 star for inviting atmosphere .

Came here today and me and my fiancé ordered a basket of fries as an appetizer. Our waiter didn't come back until 15 minutes later and meanwhile we were waiting we had to ask a bus boy to bring us some water because our waiter didn't take our drink order. The fries are typical basket fries, nothing too special. Finally 30 minutes into us sitting we ordered the Cajun shrimp and chicken past and my fiancé ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp. Beware it is extremely hot ! It burned my tongue! Even after 10 minutes of waiting for it to cool down it was extremely hot. The shrimp is gross, it has a tomato sauce that is not appetizing. The Cajun chicken and shrimp was decent.
Love coming here for happy hour the services isn't that best but the food is still good. Just like every other chain restaurant.
Fast service . Great food and happy hour is amazing!! I only wish they offered it throughout the restaurant and not just the bar .

Same crowd. Same food. Same service. Their green bean fries and Jack Daniels sampler are yummy-high in calories though. Ask for ranch with the green bean fries (unless you like the wasabi sauce it comes with) and extra Jack Daniels sauce for your sampler.

I would definitely not recommend going to this place if you're hungry. I went in with a couple of people last night after a long day at work, I was starving just wanted something to eat. The food took absolutely for ever and the management with absolutely no help whatsoever. I had an issue with my food the manager came to the table she didn't actually understand what the problem was so therefore not able to fix it, later on when I complained about the amount of time it was taking for my food as well then she finally realized what it was I was talking about  when I was explaining place  earlier on but by then I didn't care about the issue I just wanted my food right away. I really think they need to address how long it take to get your food at this location as well as the managers way of handling things. The server did her part and was fine I just wish the management was a little bit better.

I went here with a friend for happy hour. We first sat on the border of the bar where could still order food and drinks for happy hour. We ordered pretzels and the artichoke spinach dip. The server corrected me and said, "Spinach dip?" So I said, "Yes." While waiting for our food, we found seats at the bar so we moved. When we got our food, we asked out server what happened to the "spinach dip." He said that we never ordered it! I was pissed! The server denied that he was our server when he took our order and tried to point the blame on another server that was at the bar that gave our drinks. What's even messed up was before we ordered from him, we asked if it was ok to sit at to the border of the bar. Once we signed and left our checks at the bar, he was quick to run and look at out receipts. I hesitate to go back here and think twice before entering this restaurant.

i got the potato skins. They were the worst I've ever had! They look like the cheese had already been pre-melted and then melted over again and the potato part was too thick and not crispy.  I have bought the TGI Friday's frozen ones in the grocery store  and never bought again because they SUCKED.  These taste just like those! I also ordered some White Russians mixed with coke and they were iced down and weaker than I've had elsewhere. So, with the crappy potato skins & weak drinks, now lets throw in maybe the worst waitress I've ever encountered: Natasha (short curly light brown hair with glasses) If she sees this review, maybe she will wonder why the tip was less than even doubling the tax.  Well, Natasha, here are the multiple reasons why that happened: 1) very limited to non-existent eye contact 2) when we ordered the drinks, we also asked for water, but she never bothered to bring any water. We had to ask for it again 3) when the potato skins arrived, there were no eating utensils, so I asked her for those and she just grabbed them off another table.  She didn't even realize until I asked that there were no utensils 4) after she walked away, I then realized I didn't have a plate, so had to put the thing on a napkin on top of the table and try to use it as a make shift plate, as the grease soaked through, making it start to tear so the thing started touching the table underneath.  When she eventually returned to help fellow patrons seated next to us, I then asked for plates and she brought some and some napkins as well! yeah, so the only napkin we had while waiting for her to return, was the one that I was currently using as a plate that was previously wrapped around the utensils she'd grabbed off of another table. 5) When she brought the bill, she could clearly see there were 6 potato skins remaining and she just walked away after leaving the bill, without even asking us if we needed a to-go box!  So, of course, wait even longer then, to wait till she comes back, to ask for a to-go box. It seemed blatantly obvious that she must not have any experience as a waitress, so I realized that maybe if I needed a job in the future, should the current one not work out, I could always apply at TGI Fridays, since apparently, they don't require any previous experience in that profession - or if they do - maybe they just don't check the applicant's references?? Oh, was going to give one star, but I bumped it up to two because they've got great hours, staying open till 2am on a Saturday.

This tgif is one of the coolest that I've been to. I had a great time on my first visit here. Our server was elena and she was wonderful. Food was great, service was great, and a full tummy makes me happy. (=

It's been a while since I've been to TGI Friday's. I don't remember the service being so flighty and the food being so sparse. I would hold compare this chain to Chili's, Applebee's, and Red Robin. With TGI Friday's, you're definitely paying more for less.

TGIFriday!!  Love their weekend deals and happy hours. Who doesn't need a drink or two after work?! Well I do. They have a lot of varieties drinks for your taste.  They also have good deals on  meals for two.  I normally just go straight to the bar for a table instead of waiting for a booth. It get pretty crowd and  crazy on the weekend but hey it's TGIF!
Tons of open tables and they aren't sitting people. Signs of a not well run restaurant.

We came in for the two for $20 deal. The bill was 21.60 total. Not bad for the price but the food was horrible. We had the fried mozzarella cheese and the chicken pasta. The cheese was like from the frozen box and the pasta was terrible. The chicken was dry and tasteless. I would not come back to this place. I am a bad cook but I sure can make better food than this.

Arrived for late night happy hour... Sat down and the waitress didn't even know her own menu for happy hour, we just ended up and getting sliders for a quick bite then leaving to the saddle ranch right across.

Went for happy hour.  Got a table outside near the bar.  Waiter took forever to get us a round of drinks.  I was tempted to just move to the bar where the woman bartender could've just made my drink right there!  The appetizers, all though half off, not all that great.  The biggest disappointment was when we received the check after a few rounds of drinks.  Apparently the margaritas we ordered were $10 each!!!!  We even asked the waiter questions about happy hour, obviously that's what we were there for!  Why didn't he mention anything when we were ordering margaritas which we had no idea were gonna be $10!  We were pretty pissed, didn't even wanna try and hassle the price, we just paid and will not be coming back to this particular TGIF Best part of the experience was seeing a flock of wild parrots hanging out in the tree next to the patio, that was a first.
Just stopping by for some drinks got no service we were sitting on the side wall of the bar area we had to go to the bar to order drinks and food.

The waitress was cool, not as attentive though. She never came by to see if we needed anything. The food was whatever, my food wasn't even hot! So I'm wondering how long was the food sitting there without any runners or servers? My waitress said happy hour starts at 9:00 pm til midnight! Walking into the restaurant, there's this big round table with guests sitting on the walkway! It's so odd how they set up a table to block everybody like that?

On Saturday was my first time and my experience was not bad. The waiting time was about 10 min which was good for last minute reservations. Once we sat down the waiter brought water for us meanwhile we looked for something to drink. They also have great deals there. We got all you can appetizers for 10 dollars and the waitress made sure we had another appetizer ready for us before we finished the one we had. Their overall service was great. We asked for them to play a specific chanel and they gladly and rapidly made sure they accommodated our request. Over all my first time experience was good because they provided excellent service and made sure we had everything we needed at all times

Really bad service from an older lady who unfortunately was working at the bar. We sat down to have a drink and some endless apps. Our original server was great, i mentioned i didnt like bbq and he said he would have them make a flatbread without the bbq when i was ready. Im guessing he went to lunch so this other lady is helping us. I asked for that flatbread without bbq and ahe rudely said No. I told her the other guy said it was no problem and she said he was wrong. The worst part about it was her bad attitude. I wish i has gottwn her name but it was the oldest lady working the bar. Both other servers were really good. The food was ok and they had 5 dollar lagunitas.

The food is great, but it could use some improvements in some ways... My family almost always plans a birthday dinner here and it never disappoints. Every so often I order the Cajun chicken and pasta and it always seems to impress. Though the pasta was good, there was another time when I ordered a sirloin from the menu and I ordered it medium rare, but I got a medium well instead. There was no pink, and the sirloin was dry. I was disappointed because I expected a nice juicy sirloin, but instead I got the opposite.

I feel like TGIF is generally a 3 star average place. One time I had a fantastic experience when the server was awesome and I ordered a burger that tasted amazing! Most of the time I'm here for their happy hour. Most of the food is over seasoned like bar food but it's okay because I am here to drink! I would like to say that most of the menu is really not worth the price (except for that burger), especially the appetizers. It's a good thing they are half off otherwise I'd be very disappointed when they come out. Platter's aren't on happy hour which my friend didn't know when he ordered it, and it was $15 worth of junk. The potato skins were horrible, the buffalo wings had no flavor, etc.  Almost always, the employees really seem to be lazy and have that attitude that they want to go home. It's late but still a few hours to go when I come.

"Um, excuse me. There is an ant in my dirty martini."  =l -me "Oh, that's okay, I didn't charge you extra for that." -bartender I don't know about you, but I don't find (pun intended) an insect in my drink, very funny. "I guess you owe me a free drink." -me "Nope, can't do that." -bartender Apparently they can't apologize either.  Ridiculous. Disgusting. Who does this guy think he is? I won't be back to this location and perhaps any. So many other options these days, for drinks with friends. My recent experiences have all fallen below expectations.
Or server Massimo was fantastic the food was delicious we ordered two different Hamburgers both were very tasty I specially liked the coleslaw and the Tennessee whiskey pie

Called ahead to make sure they still have their kitchen open. Right away advertised the endless appetizers. Made sure their kitchen was still open and sure enough till 1:30am. Got there before one and we did get someone to get our drinks pretty quickly. After that though it took a while for them to come back to take our order. We wanted to do endless appetizers. (Planning to order several drinks) and he said it was too late to do so. Drinks were very watered down( LA water and Ultimate Peach Tea were ordered) saving grace, first drink order was taken quickly. Ended u get appetizer platter but not too appetizing. Disappointing night overall.

Is it just me, or does almost every server at this Fridays look like they hate their life? I think I just always have bad luck with this location. I don't think I've ever genuinely had a nice or caring server here unless it was a manager themselves assisting in serving the food and checking up on us. I usually only come here for the appetizers since its the only part of the menu I like to eat. You would think only having to serve appetizers would be a simple task, and maybe I just always catch the servers here on a bad day, but they take FOREVER to bring out a plate of mozzarella cheese sticks or 4 chicken wings. It's kind of disappointing. In my recent visit to this location, we were told no take out bags for the "Endless Appetizers" promotion. Fine. We didn't need any. We all got our own plates and naturally wanted to share food with each other since it was all finger food. Our waitress was hovering over us the entire time which I thought was just her being attentive to whether we needed more water, anything else, etc. Instead, she comes up to us and tells us that because a member of our party ate half of an appetizer another member of our party had ordered, she would have to pay for an entire other meal. WTF?! Read over the tiny black print at the bottom of the menu and yes, no take out boxes, yes, only one plate at a time, but absolutely no mention of not being able to share. Not to mention it took our waitress over 15 minutes to bring out one small plate and she intentionally waited till I finished my plate till she brought out my friend's food. The fact that she was willing to make another member of our party wait so long for her food just to enforce some rule she made up is BS. Not the first time I've had to wait what felt like ten years for an appetizer and was treated poorly at this location. I doubt I'll be returning. Great managers at this location but there's something else going on because that attitude isn't reflected amongst their staff.
Placed to go order over the phone, order taker is not familiar with menu item. Order got messed up and overcharged. Quoted for 15-20 minutes, from time ordered to picked up took 40 minutes

Came for lunch today and ordered a salad. Substituted the chicken for shrimp. Salad was supposed to be $11.75 for the chicken. Server didn't mention shrimp would be extra. Should I have asked???  Isn't it the servers duty to let the customer know? The salad ended up being $16.50!!! Almost $5 more for FIVE pieces of shrimp???? I'd understand if I got the chicken and they charged EXTRA to ADD the shrimp but this is ridiculous!!!! Never coming back to this location, no wonder they have such a low rating on yelp. I hope management sees this post.
Very unclean there found ants at our 1st table and the manager relocated us to a booth where there was old food caked in the creases of the table with bugs also

Please staff more. Why does a single server have more than 1 large party by themselves? Took over 35 minutes to receive our food for a 7 guest party. When ready to pay that took over 20 minutes because I don't blame the guy he wants to try to make everybody satisfied, but this is embarrassing to say the least for this establishment.

We had gone to the OC Fair for their summer concert series and were ready for a late dinner after the show. This location was near our hotel and we decided to eat there since there wasn't much else open. The service to the table was incredibly slow and they didn't appear to be that busy as it was after 10 on a Sunday night.  The dishes seemed less than clean and there was a strange sauce or gravy that was not part of the ordered dinner that was splash a crossed one of the plates. When asked for additional honey mustard sauce for the chicken finger platter- it again room forever to get some from our waitress. The restaurant was extremely noisy and the waitstaff was quite inattentive.  The food was typical of other TGI Friday's I have been too. I wasn't impressed with this location- it was mediocre at best so they get a mediocre score.

I was hugely disappointed about the changes to one of my favorite drinks they have. The glass for the Mudslide is smaller than what it used to be, they didn't even fill it up all the way, the chocolate chips were missing, and a little pricier now. I also barely tasted any alcohol mostly chocolate syrup.The food was alright the pretzels were really dark on the outside. I'll try the TGIF a little closer to my house that one doesn't seem to rip people off.

Being my first visit to tgif fridays the food was very good the staff was also very friendly. I was very pleased until i had gotten home and realized i was charged more than the total amount i had on my receipt. I was looking through my spendings on my card history and found that i had been over charged. I left a tip of $6 on top of my total on the kiosk but about $11 more was added on to my bill i threw away my receipt but really hope this doesnt happen again.

With service this slow, I believe it'll be replaced soon. Starting from when we arrived it felt like a very unorganized dining experience to say the least. I understand the busy rush ( 6 pm on a Saturday) and having to wait, however, I noticed several open tables in the dining area--- but the hostess insisted we not seat ourselves... After 20 minutes we were finally seated; unfortunately the waitress didn't seem to help make the service any better. Waiting almost 15 minutes for drinks, she then took our order, and once served, seemed to not worry about attending to any additional request (ex no water, no sauce, no nada!)  To top it off, we wanted to pay using the new electronic pay machine, but it didn't seem to be working right. Once our waitress came around after serving another party nearby, we explained the problem and she then said, "Yeah because the batteries are out. Let me get a fresh pair." Like really? Why wouldn't you or anyone else think to replace them..? Never had this issue at any other Tgi, but this really changed my opinion about its service.  FYI: I did tip, though only felt it necessary because I've worked in the service industry. Before you walk in, think again.

Considering they were packed and still managed to get us (5 adults and a high chair for the baby) seated within 20 minutes I'd say it started off great.  Now onto the next item, once again considering they were packed, our waitress was quick in getting our drinks written up and served to us. Then it was the same for ordering our dinners. So all in all everything was great, hints the 5 stars.  I was really shocked with the Lrg order we had and them being so busy but still everything came out just the way we ordered it and it was all great.  We will be returning to eat here again. Excellent service, and food.

I came today with family for appetizers ... Leanne took care of our table ... I can tell that her service was awesome. She gave us very good recommendations. We had our drinks all the way to the top all the time. She checked on us a lot. We were very happy with her. Next time ask for her table ... is worth it the wait time..

1 star because that's the lowest it will allow. Sat at our table for 15 minutes, not one person greeted us or took a drink order. The place was empty but they somehow had a 20-25 minute wait.
