There were multiple workers walking around. Such a waste of time. Ended up walking out, didn't want to even attempt to wait for water or drinks, let alone food. Walked over to Saddle Ranch had a much better experience. Got sat right away, greeted by every worker there and had excellent service.  Won't bother to even try TGI Fridays again, too many better options around.

Stopped in for dinner and a drink late because they close at 2am. Would have been better off at a bar with chips and salsa. At the door as we are being seated (12:43am) security walks up to host and yells "they already did last call"??? I thought they closed at two??? An hour and twenty minute last call??? Eventually our waitress comes over and ask if we'd like a drink but then immediately says no more alcohol. .. again I'm baffled. It's barely 12:45. The only reason we were there for the crappie food was alcohol. ... and I've been to other tgifs,  they don't do last call that early specially when the restaurant is slow. I think they realized it was Friday night.  They let us have one round, but no blended drinks. Like I said, they wanted to go home early. And there was a Barcode sticker on my fajita peppers. Didn't care to complain, the incredible lack of hospitality and courtesy was enough to just shock me into silence. What a waste of money.

I usually go here if i have no other place to go or lines are too long at other restaurants its a cool place to grab something to eat and have a couple of drinks with some friends other than that i would not come here because the food is just okay.

I know I shouldn't expect much from a cookie cutter place. I came here to watch the Bulls game and they were gracious enough to change the channel for me. The food wasn't the greatest...I got the barbeque chicken flatbread (the bread was pretty tough) and the Jack Daniels burger. Nothing special about it. I gave 2 stars because it took forever for the bartender to finish her animated conversation with the other bartender and take my order.
Don't know why I come here. A dozen open tables and 6 groups waiting at least 20 min.  Always the case at this location.  At least the wait staff is friendly.
ID checking at the bar is worse than Homeland security screening...  I'm from 1969... Really...do I need to show my ID....jajajajajajaj

Boyf and I love their 2 for 20 deal! We always get the petite sirloin, medium done. It may be petite but the steak plus the appetizer are very filling! They don't have the best choices for appetizers but for 10 bucks a person, we really can't complain.  As for dessert, we always have to get it togo because we can't finish it. The vanilla bean cheesecake is yummy!  Servers are friendly, the only thing is that the place gets really loud around night time. If it's warm enough outside, I'd opt to sit there instead.

Sigh, OKAY.  I've been to this Fridays PLENTY of times before. And none of the experiences have been particularly good. Once there was a spider in my burger, once I got overcharged with a drink, once my stomach exploded after dinner, and on top of that the service is ALWAYS awful.  Why do I keep coming back? Your guess is as good as mine. I guess Friday's is just one of those places that everyone kinda accepts for being crappy, yet we still throw our money at them..cheers. -_- On this particular last experience, I met up with a friend for Cinco de Mayo. There was no wait, because obviously everybody was living it up at El Torito a few yards away.  So here we go: Service: GAWD-awful. Our waitress would constantly disappear. And when she did make an appearance she had the worst attitude. Not rude, but more like "*siiiiigh* what am I doing here???" kind of attitude. And if it weren't for my awesome company, she would have totally killed my vibe.  Food: Good! Idk...I like their food! I got the broccoli and chicken stuffed potato and it hit the spot. My friend had the sirloin steak, and as far as I can tell she liked it as well.  Drinks: Because I am smart, I know not to order a margarita on the rocks. My amiga on the other hand...not too smart. ;) She babysat her drink for about 30 mins before I called her out on it. Once I took a sip, I knew why. Her drink was WAY watered down and tasted old lemonade. (even considering the melted ice). She told the waitress and she exchanged the drink unpleasantly. I, on the other hand got a blended margarita, and their $5 Ultimate Mai Tai, which was pretty awesome. And for $5? Heck yes.  The best part of the whole thing was that my friend had a BOGO Free entree coupon! So for three drinks and two plates it was only $30. Legit. ;)

If I remember correctly, happy hour is from 3-7pm, and from 10pm to closing, and all day Sunday (the last two happy hours I know for sure). The staff here has improved since the last time that I went. My friend and I was seated pretty quickly and our food came out as expected, so that was awesome. However, our waitress did ask how we were doing way too many times, I couldn't finish half my stories :(
The service worst, the waitress name Tarah not polite not training well.

I don't know why I always come to this joint, heck I don't even know why I'm writing a review. The only decent thing on the menu worth paying for is the 2 for $20 deal they have. Other then that I would rather go somewhere else.  Place can get pretty packed on the weekends and the service is hit or miss. Since there is a lot of traffic the inside of this place is a bit dirty. The tables and menus are always sticky even after they wipe it down.  My favorite item on the menu would have to be the fried green beans. You can't just have one!

Eliana is an exceptional server. She one of the best at her job that I have come across. She is very professional,  courteous,  and very friendly with a cheerful attitude. Eliana made our experience at TGIF in Orange extremely pleasant.

Then here about 4pm for an early dinner. We sat down and waited 15 mins before our waiter came. When he did came he told us about the happy hour specials by taking my menu out of my hand to show me what was available. Then took our drink order which was just water. We again waited about 5-6 mins for our waters. Then I asked him a question about redeeming my stripes (reward program). He was rude and said if I had a the coupon. Well once he gave me a half ass answer. He left again with out asking if we were ready to order. Which we were! Again we waited for him to return a 3 he took our order. Which my friend order a bowl of Broccoli Cheddar soup. When his soup came to the table it was not right. It was Clam Chowder. By this time went to the hostess and ask to speak to a manager. The hostess ask me to give her a moment. Which I did and waited for awhile. Then I told her that I was still waiting and I wait at my table for the manager. The manager (Ian) and told him my concern and that I was very unhappy. He apologize and that he will take care of it. We finally get out correct food. NOT once did our waiter come by an ask if the food was ok. He just kept walking by and just refilled our water cups. Then he finally came and ask if I wanted a box for my food, now hurrying us out.  Once I finished he took my plate asked about dessert and I told him I wanted the Oreo Madness, and then he walk away without asking if my friend wanted anything and for me to ask for my dessert to go. I told one of the other servers and he came back to the table and slam my dessert on to the table and said have a nice day.  I asked to speak to Ian again and waited for 10 mins before he came. And I told him what his waited did and he was lucky I did not take the dessert and slam it into his face. And while I was yelling at Ian in front of everyone and told him that his staff our all asses. And proceeded to leave, but stop in the waiting area and warned every that if they happen to get a waiter (which I finally get the name of) named CASEY he is an Asshole and I am sorry and would just leave now, and go somewhere else for dinner.  Never going here ever again. Screw the Stripes program. I'll consider it a lost now.  Not the same place I once knew when I went here on a weekly basis, back in my Disney Cast Member days.

tthe food was OKAY.. Came here on a Saturday! .. so it really wasn't T.G.I.F in my case. :) As I was saying.. the food was OKAY But our waitress was totally awkward and actually made us feel uncomfortable. . Prices were decent so ill try it out again sometime.

My wife and I arived at 5:00 pm, on a Saturday. Experience was Very disappointing, especially after I looked across the street and saw a BJ's right there close by. Should have driven around and made a better choice. Here's the scoop: Hostess nowhere to be seen when we entered. At first it didn't seem they even HAD a hostess station. Lots of people sitting (15-20) in the waiting area. I look around to see 3/4 of the tables are empty. After a couple of minutes waiting, hostess arrives and I assume that we would be seated. WRONG! She asked for our name and wrote it down, said it'll be five or ten minutes. ???? She disappears. I looked around, counted 25 tables open (that I could see) and 7 tables with people seated. WTF? Everyone else in the waiting area were seemingly just as perturbed over the same thing.     We ordered potato skins appetizer, came out cold, bland, and tasted like it was frozen and microwaved for serving. My wife ordered a steak medium rare, it came barely medium and was cold. I ordered buffalo chicken sandwich, but hold the buffalo, make it dry with ranch on the side. In this case, size matters because it was appox 2" X 5" in size, total. The chicken breast was pounded thin, appox 1/4"-3/8" thick, 3/8-1/2" thick if you include the breading. Even as small as the sandwich was, the chicken didn't cover the bread. Tiny. If you ever looked at a Burger King original chicken sandwich   patty, this is about 1/2-2/3 that size, and not as thick in most places. The bread was ciabatta, and hard as a rock. Really. I could bang it on the table and you could hear it across the restaurant. Fries were cold and soggy. Order took 45 minutes to get to the table in a nearly empty restaraunt.   Everything served here either comes out of a box frozen, or held forever under a heat lamp that's pointed in the wrong direction. It's fast food quality, barely. Cheap mall food is way better. And better for the money. My wife had a 10 oz steak and baked potato, a cup of soup, I had the tiny, rock hard, dry chicken sandwich, two sodas and the potato skin appetizer and that came to almost $50.00!    Save youself the horrific dining experience and just go to BJ's or Dave and Busters, or ANYWHERE ELSE but here.

I usually just come here when I'm at the block and it's late.  While Yardhouse is usually my happy hour of choice in the late evenings, I always fool myself that maybe TGI could do the trick.. which it usually doesn't.  The drinks aren't very strong, the service is mediocre, and it's always quite loud -- not that I have anything against loud places at night but it's just.. unnecessarily loud.  I'd say I probably wouldn't come back but who am I kidding?  I'll be grumbling about the weak drink and average appetizers there soon enough.

Worst service I've ever had. The only time I saw our waiter was right after we were seated. He came by to take our drink order and then never came back. We were eventually served by the bus boy who then took our order. We waited 20 minutes for drinks and a full our to get our food. All our service was from the bus boy who only came by when I complained. They seemed to be busy but even when the check came, our waiter was no where in sight. I payed exact change and tracked down the bus boy to tip him directly.  They skimped on the alcohol, the food was terrible, and there was only 2 of us. I wont be coming back here ever again and I've already started telling my friends it's not a good place to eat.

Our server was AMAZING. Seriously, she was on top of everything, super friendly, and QUCIK! *I wish I remembered her name* The food on the other hand.....bleh. 4 of us came last night @ 10 when Happy Hour starts for 1/2 price apps. Our table ordered the Garlic-Parm boneless wings, Bufffalo boneless wings, Chicken Quesidilla,  Sesame Jack Strips, Fries, and the Potato Skins. Potato Skins? Seriously. 2070 Calories for the full order....Are you kidding me? I didn't order them, but tried them and they were bland, dry, and BORING. Didn't even eat one and the person who ordered them, sent them back. Yick. Everything else was just OK.  I guess next time I'll be back for a liquid meal and see how that goes.

Well what can I say it's T.G.I Fridays....food is o.k the item I really liked were the steak fries in garlic and parmesan, burger was good not great.  The restaurant was busy and service was again just o.k .  They prepared my friends order incorrectly; she ordered the steak and salmon and they brought her the steak and shrimp.  I can't say this will be a go to place for anything else but drinks.
Always get their two for $20, just tried their spinach dip for an appetizer and it was soooo goood!

Yeah I suppose I shouldn't be reviewing a place like TGI. Friday's....I guess that's what I get for going to a chain restaurant. The thing that bugs me is that I figured it would be alright since I've enjoyed my visits and the food at other TGIF's *sigh* but here it goes... The service was terrible. No waitress, I'm sorry I don't know what to order yet since I haven't been to your restaurant and just had a minute to glance at the menu. Oh and no it's not cool that just because we weren't ready to give you our order when you were, you took an extra long time to come back to us. And yes it's pretty rude that you just kept walking pass us and not bothering to look over at us. So finally we get to order our food. And it all was mediocre to say the least.  The three item appetizer combo was ordered and it was decent. Not much you can say about fried food, I'm just glad the buffalo sauce on the hot wings was not terrible...LOL I had the petite sirloin dinner and ordered it medium well. The meat was so tough and whatever was used to season the meat was very salty. The mashed potatos were the only edible thing on the plate. The side of vegetables was terrible!! First of all, the brocoli smelled really bad, it was probably really old or something. Couldn't eat the other veggies because they were way, way, way too salty.  I was not expecting some healthy meal from TGIF's but I was expecting it to be edible. This was the fist time that I've had such a terrible experience at one of the TGIF chains. It was definitely the sign I needed to show me that I need to stay away from places like these...thank you destiny!!

The service at Dennys is 100 times better than this place. This is by far the worst tgif on the planet avoid this place like the plague. The servers an mangers at this place are the worst. Far warning everyone STAY AWAY FROM HERE!!

Came during the week for happy hour and was not disappointed. I've been going to this Fridays for a long time and I've never had any problems. Parking sucks sometimes when it's busy but the atmosphere and location make this a great happy hour destination. Food isn't great but they have good deals like the endless apps and happy hour. I like the jack Daniels strips and potato skins the most.  The waiter we got was friendly and helpful with the menu and drinks he thought we would like. My friend and I sat in the bar area because of convenience. There's plenty of seating which is nice too. We got our drinks and food in a reasonable amount of time. It's easy to drink a lot with their deals/service so watch yourself or call an uber. Sometimes the crowd gets stupid too so just be aware of the people around you.  I'll def be back!
The service here is awful I've been here a few times and never have had a good experience here. Not recommended

Winston was my server a couple of days ago! He was funny, attentive and informative about the food. For appetizers, I got the 'Friday's three for' which includes hot wings, mozzarella sticks, and potatoes that are sliced in half with dipping sauces for each! Also, my boyfriend ordered the 'New York Cheddar bacon burger with a side of fries cooked at medium well! For my entree, I decided to get the ribeye steak cooked at medium well, a side of mash potatoes and Mac n cheese! It was all such a great experience because of the service and food. My boyfriend and I left with satisfied stomachs! Definitely coming back here again soon!

Is there a lack of experience in being a server? Second time I've had awful service in a restaurant whether it's busy or slow. It really took 17 minutes for you to give us our first drinks. 16 minutes for my cold appetizers to show up after I asked where they were. I noticed this server paying attention to his larger tables I have a group of six with me so yea the table of ten and 8 might give you a bit of a bigger bill but they aren't drinking we were trying. Slow service cold food pasta that was served to my brothers girlfriend was cold lucky she hates scenes or I would of done more than just bring it to your attention. I am not sure who your manager was that night but if I had a chance I would of brought it up to your boss. My tip yes it's going to reflect your service so don't expect anything a tip is for the service you gave me.

We came here on a Sat around 5:30 and sat at the bar.  Within a few minutes, we were greeted by two friendly servers.  In the bar area, $2 for draft beer (Bud Light, Coors and Coors light and Miller) and $3 for Samuel Adams lager 14 oz for $3.  They also have five hard liquor drinks for $5.  Pretty good deals in the bar area.  I ordered the turkey burger and substituted the fries for onion rings (wouldn't recommend because the onion rings came 7, were small and oily).  My husband ordered the chicken sandwich with fried onions on top and French fries and enjoyed it. The service was fast, friendly and efficient.  The restaurant was about 70% packed and yet they took very good care of us.  We would definitely recommend and come back. This restaurant is a little bit on the loud side, but there are plenty of T a and parking. N

I was there yesterday in a business meeting, ordered RibEye & Lobster, it was the lousiest meal I've ever had, flap meat tastes better than this ribeye, it was very tough & cold, so was the Lobster cold w/out any butter & garlic.  TGI F.... Should stick to wings & burgers maybe,

Seriously?  Been sitting here for a good 10-15mins waitint JUST FOR MY DAMN BILL. Like shit! Not only did i wait 15mins before i even got my order taken but now this. Food wasn't even that great. Why does this TGIF have 2 separate reviews??

Oct. 1, 2016 around 4 PM From the start my family and I knew it wasn't going to be a great early dinner. The greeter sucked. He wasn't welcoming at all. When we sat down, my daughter gagged when she opened her menu. It smelled like dirty old rag, and the menu was ripped and wet. Our waitress wasn't attentive. No greeting at all. She came and just asked what we wanted to drink. I think we only saw her 3 times. We had to ask another waitress to refill our water. On the bright side, the food was decent.

This location will always have business, as it's one of the few eateries open very late (til 2am), after the adjacent shops and movies close for the day.  They have promotions such as "Dine for $10" where you can select from a list of entrees and beverages for $10 for both - that is a great deal as the portions are the same and the entrees cost more than the deal itself, so it's as if the drink is free. I was able to enjoy the: * Thai Pork Tacos - very good.  Though they were tiny (you get three), the meat was tender, the veggies and sauce were proportionate.  I really enjoyed them and would order them again.  Kind of an appetizer serving, but it was good enough for dinner for one. * Shrimp Pasta - also very good.  HUGE serving - this was the entree that is new and part of the "Dine for $10" deal.  I actually shared this plate with my BF, who ordered it.  There is a decent amount of shrimp in this dish, not just 3 or 4 pieces.  A typical pasta dish with tomatoes and spinach, it was tasty and filling. Service wasn't bad - our server was generally attentive to our table of 5.  My fork, however, was still dirty - I'm not sure how an employee can wrap them in a napkin and place them on a table without noticing.  (This is where I think dishwashers aren't the greatest idea).  He forgot to adjust the price to reflect the $10 deal, but he followed through once we mentioned it.  NBD, just make sure you check out your bill once brought out.

Pros: - I have always enjoyed this location, spacious bar area and general dining area - TGIF has great daily happy hours from 3-7pm and 10pm-closing and all day Sunday! Also they have a new endless appetizer menu that you have to ask for (weird) it's $10 for one choice or $12 for any choice off that menu - You can have a great cocktail hour for less than $10! Total steal for people on a budget - Parking near The Block (I refuse to call it Outlets at Orange) is usually good but on weekends it really does suck early on Cons: - Our orders took a long time the last time I was here, not sure if it was because of where we were seated but they should at least let us know

This location is a toss up for service. Tonight I received great service. However I do get bad service a lot of times as well. Went to watch the Dodgers game and the bar was completely full. The hostess in the front said it would be a 15 minute wait. Luckily my husband went outside and got us perfect seats at the bar to watch the game. We got the endless appetizer. Pretty great deal!  $12 for endless appetizers!  :) make sure you order your next appetizer when they give it to you since it takes awhile. We pretty much only come here for appetizer and drinks. All the other food (pasta, steaks, burgers) are just okay.

My boyfriend and I go to this place only when eating with a friend who lives in the area, cuz it's open late . Other than that we never eat there because the portion size of the food keeps decreasing as the price increases, the food is bad and not worth the amount you pay.  We will never be returning after tonight. Never have a positive experience... Don't know why we kept giving it another try. Anyways, we will just go to the Bjs or Dave n Busters in the area every time we visit now. Go to Chilis , same type of restaurant , same   family and sports environment, same prices but way better food and portions. Service always good, the one in Anaheim, cypress Yorba Linda , there's one in Orange too.

This place is honestly a 1.5 but since Yelp doesn't do half stars, I'll be generous and make it a 2. I've been to this location a few times and I either leave disappointed or just feeling okay. The service here is either a hit or miss with the majority time being a miss. The food is good but the service makes the dining experience bad. The last time I came here, I went to reserve a table for 7 since my group was five minutes away. As soon as I entered the restaurant, the four hostesses in the front (I don't know why there were 4) instantly stared me down giving me dirty looks. As I approached them, the main hostess had her phone out texting. I asked if I could reserve table for 7 since my party was almost here. One of the girls to my left constantly scanned me up and down trying to give off a tough persona. They all stayed quite for about 10 seconds and until the girl with the phone said "okay" and then basically ignored me and started taking the guy's info who was standing behind me. Right as I took a seat, the guy behind me came up saying "they are calling you." I look up and one of the girls said "uh we need a name!" I stood up and said "Andrea." Half way through saying my name, she interrupted in a stuck up voice, "Thank you!" Probably one of the rudest restaurant experiences of my life! Luckily our waitress was friendly but my salad took literally 30 minutes and my all of my friends endless appitizers took almost 20+ minutes for each order. The Cobb Salad, Mozzarella Cheesesticks, and Potato Skins are the only highlights that I've experienced here. They all are prepared correctly and are satisfying. Although their meals are appetizing, no meal is worth it if it includes long waits and incredibly rude employees.

This was one of the best experiences I have ever had at a TGIF. I showed up later than the rest of my group and I was immediately greeted when I sat down. The server was incredible and he stayed on top of everything so well. I could not have been more pleased with the service, the food, and the overall atmosphere. Definitely would come back. Thank you so much, Leo, you were an awesome server and person.

It's always Friday at Friday's !!  Probably the best service I have given in a really long time!! Our server Leanne was phenomenal, great energy and a great personality. She kept up on making sure our drinks were full and put in our next order right away.  You would think that during the endless apps the quality of the food and service would be bad especially when it's big party's. Not the case this time !!! Leanne needs a raise or something !!!
I would give 0 stars if possible. Horrible bartender service, will not be returning again. The rude hostess cemented that fact for my family and I. Avoid this location at all costs.
Don't waste your time. Just go to BJs next door. They won't make you wait 10-15 minutes when tables are available. No wonder this place is 2.5 stars.
Always great service from Robert and Nate. They always provide excellent customer service and are very attentive. I like the fact that they remember you and your drink orders!

I came with a fairly large group around midnight after the D&B in the same plaza closed. My friends and I still wanted to drink so I suggested TGIF, since I love TGIF's for their happy hour drinks! I love going to TGIF's for their drinks because they are always so well made, I definitely recommend their mango and strawberry margarita and the electric lemonade! (only $6 during happy hour and it goes so well with their half off appetizer and $1.50 basket of fries!)  I believe this is the best TGIF that I have been too because the food being served here tastes ten times better than any other locations i've been too so far. It was a wednesday night and they were having a deal for their rack of ribs that comes with two sides. There were so many options to choose from for the sides, but i went with mashed potatoes and mac & cheese. The rib plate was huge enough for my boyfriend and I to share, and the mac and cheese was delicious! For the amount of food and the quality/taste of the fall off the bone ribs, It was such a steal for only $10.99!!! I would've given this place 5 stars, but the service was kind of slow and everything took a while to be served,  our drinks (even just plain water) took about 15 minutes and that's kind of ridiculous. Although i have yet to experience excellent service, I do suggest going on a sunday since it's happy hour all day! Definitely go and grab a few drinks and some appetizers to go with it!

HAPPY HOUR! Mon-Sat! 3 PM-7 PM 9 PM-2 AM $5 Long Island's (strong) $1.50 Fries Comfy stools. Staff seemed a little frenzied as the night went on but it's all good. CHEAP ALCOHOL. Also, when I called to ask the time of HH, they had said 10 PM but they still served us at 9:15 sooooo.... try?

Fridays is always a loud and lively restaurant. Their food is decent, but their Jack Daniels steak and shrimp are extraordinary. I also enjoy their broccoli cheese soup, mozzarella sticks, burgers and green bean fries.

Great location. Bad management. I counted 17 tables open but they made 3 party of 2 couples wait out in foyer for 15 min before they called their name slowly, felt weird. The service is not good. No you don't bring chips and salsa to a table the same time you bring the dinner cheese burgers. Especially when asked to "start with it" - so then they take the chips away and act rude to table, not stopping by once the rest of the meal. -- overall a bad experience. The place is in a great location and building rocks... Simply bad staff.

I came here on 2/15/16 with my wife and kids.  The food and drinks were especially good. But the reason I am really taking the time to write this review is because of the manager on duty "Beth". Beth made it a point to make sure my kids were taken care of by bring extra things for them to occupy their time as they were a little cranky. Her kindness and caring demeanor totally changed our kids demeanor therefor making my wife and our time more enjoyable. "Beth" didn't have to take the extra time out of her shift to do these things but she did, by doing this not only did she make our night better but the surrounding guests as you can imagine.  Because of Beth I would recommend this location to anyone and would take pleasure in returning anytime.

Whoa there!! When did their prices sky rocker out the buttcus!  Holy cow.. Think it was 50 bucks for two people.. with the portion big enough to feed a nine month embryo! Seriously! The smallest portions I've ever seen... and this isnt even fine dining!  Had the sizzling chicken with cheese.. it use to taste a lot better.. The little guy serving us was very charming! Shout out to the dude with glasses, ole cute self. haha .. other than that. this place is crappy.. Had the nacho chips.. after three chips.. it was sooo boring! -.- I'll be back when you guys drag me back!

Worst dinner I had had! I went to meet my friend for dinner we had a seat at the bar. It was 7pm when we sat down table. It was a little dirty the server said he would be back to clean it off....10 mins later he came with menus we asked again about he table he came back and finally cleaned it off and walked away... 10 mins later he got our drinks... And about 20mins later we had to wave down the server to order. I got a pasta and my friend got a dish with chicken and Mac and cheese and said no Mac but if she can get mashed potatoes he wrote it down and put it in. When we finally got our food the order was wrong...  It had Mac and cheese on it. So we told the food runner and he said he would fix it. I kid you not the server came back with the dish and asked 4 times what was wrong with it. I asked to speak to the manager and he finally came out and talked to us. I get it we all have days like that but when we clearly say something 4 times and still waited about a hour and 20 mins for everything. Not good Service at all. I won't come back to this location again.

Came here today because my boyfriend has a $23 certificate to T.G.I so we wanted something that satisfy my tummy but cheap (college students on a tight budget). We went on a Saturday night so there was quite a few people waiting before us but it only took about 10-15 minutes before they seated us.  We were seated and about 5 minutes later, our waitress ask us what we liked to drink and we both wanted water. My bf and I decided that we wanted the 2 for 20 deal and order dessert after: For our app: we got the mozzarella stick: it was good but the best was the marinara sauce ( I REALLY like the sauce for some reason) maybe because I was just really hungry! hahaha! BUT we had to wait about 30 minutes for our app.. it took a really long time for some reason and when we were done with app it took about another 20 minutes for our entree. We waited really long for our food! :( But this is what we order:  For my entree I got the parmesan crusted chicken (which was an extra 3 bucks) and for my sides I had tortelline with a spinach cream sauce  and a tomato and mozzarella salad. I decided chicken because  I didn't want steak or pasta and I must say it is my favorite dish from T.G.I so far. The chicken was really moist and the sides goes well with the chicken. The spinach cream sauce was very tasty as well it fits perfectly with the chicken. Highly recommend! My bf got the Jack Daniel Chicken with fried shrimps with loaded mash potatoes and cole slaw ( which was an extra 5 bucks). It wasn't worth the money. The sauce was good but the Chicken was plain and flavorless. My bf was eating off of my food rather then his! He hated the cole slaw because it wasn't to his liking. It was honestly personal taste he liked shredded cole slaw (like KFC).  Finally for dessert: we ordered the Whiskey cake (or something along that line) It was really good. It finished my night! I would recommend sharing this dessert because it is really sweet but it's one of those dessert where you would want to come back for more! I believe it is a toffee cake with topped pecans and vanilla ice cream on the side! The sauce was my favorite: there is this white sauce ( I don't know what it is) but it's my favorite! I took a little of the cake, sauces, and ice cream and it was the perfect bite! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!   But service was a bit slow, our waitress came about twice to check up on us but when we were about to leave and asked for a box and bill she came back with the bill but forgot about the box. She only refill my bf water but not mine! I wonder why??? Service needs some work!

So I go into Fridays at the block of Orange. I sit at the bar waiting for my friend and Sue SO0 is the bartender great bubbly personality great suggestions on the menu great suggestions all around and what a really nice gal. I was only going to be there for lunch and ended up staying for three hours you should come to Friday's on Wednesday mornings for Sue SOO will be taking great care of you

Two words: Happy Hour I always go for the spinach dip and a glass of wine then the rest...whatever people are up for. Lots of great choices. Probably the best thing about this place is that its right by the outlets.

This Friday's is in a great location. Right next to Orange City Walk so you have tons of cool stores to go to and shop in in the area. I came here on a Thursday around 6 pm. Bar area was extremely packed, probably because of their happy hour.  We chose to sat in a booth. The food was good, my friend and I did the 2 for $20 deal which worked out great. For our appetizer we had the Mozzarella sticks (which were really good!) and we both also got a cheeseburger. The burger was yummy, meat was cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor. Good meal at affordable price after tax and tip. However, the wait staff was incredibly slow. I'm not sure if our server was bad or if he just had a ton of tables. We had to wait forever for everything. Meanwhile, while our server was nowhere to be found, about 6 hosts were all standing around mingling. Perhaps they need to transition some of these guys to servers? I'll come back because the food was affordable and tasty, not for the service.

Four stars for the service, location, parking, and atmosphere which were all good.  However, 2 stars for the food that was mediocre at best. I had the lunch special of a salad and appetizer.  The portions were very small and I was left hungry.  The salad looked and tasted like the prepared salads that come in a bag at the grocery store.  My friends that dined here also felt the portions were scrawny for the lunch special.  I would recommend ordering a regular full meal at this restaurant. I've had the hamburger before and it was very filling although they give very little fries compared to other restaurants.  I don't think I will return since this is the 2nd TGIF restaurant location that served mediocre food.

TGI Fridays has an all-day happy hour on Sunday where just about every appetizer on their menu is 50% off, and not just at the bar. I came here over the summer and shared 5 appetizers (potato skins, buffalo wings, mozzarella sticks, sliders, and french fries) and ordered two mixed drinks, and we paid only about $30 including tax and tip. What a deal!  As far as the food itself goes, it's nothing great. But it certainly isn't bad, and with a happy hour deal like that it's hard to pass up. The service was fairly quick at this location as well on a Sunday afternoon. Also, if you join their reward club you get a free appetizer coupon and they send you other coupons all the time.

Sat at the bar at 8:20... Was finally greeted by a server at 8:30... Was asked if we were ready to order without giving us menus... Got menus and placed an drink order and our entrees... 20 minutes pass and no drink and no server... She finally comes back and says "we're looking for the recipe to make your drink" (drink is a featured drink on their drink menu)... Cancelled my drink order... Still no food... Finally after almost an hour of waiting our food comes out COLD! This whole time, a manager and two bartenders are practicing their flare at the bar... And I mean practicing... They're throwing bottles, glasses all over the place and all the while the manager yells out "is everyone ok?!" Lucky to get a one star rating...

Came here with 4 other dudes and we got the unlimited appetizer deal.  I also ordered the Cobb Salad, I really like it here.  The Cobb was not as yummy as the last time I got it-- much less avocado and bacon... BOOOOO.. We got the deal where you can change up your appetizers.  So, in the end we all got to try a little of everything offered on that deal.  I wish they expanded the deal (you pay $12 as opposed to $10 in order to change it up) so the appetizer selection includes the $10 selections also.  Ok, maybe that is asking for too much! haha A girl can dream!  I ate a lot of my salad so I didn't get too full off of the fried foods.  The dudes, however, vowed to never order the endless apps after a bball game late at night ever again!! HAHA  but maybe after a long hike in the AM would be fine!! :D  Service was pretty good.  He was attentive and took our orders as soon as food was delivered!  He kept checking up on us.  Oddly, we just had to ask for water refills once though.  That's ok, it was late night and he was great!  I'll be back!

The server was great. But when we were seated the hostess grabbed an extra random chair that was behind my seat and hit my boyfriend in the knee with it. She could have apologized but all she said was " oh did I get you?" Horrible didn't even apologize. The food was ok nothing special. The portions horrible small. Over priced for what you get. Defame toy not coming back.

They really need to work on their service.  If it weren't the coupons ($5 off $15) and the deals they are running (dinner for 2 for $20), i would never come here.  Maybe it's because we were only ordering the cheap stuff, but our waitress was a disgrace.  she actually disappeared for about 20 minutes.  i don't know where she went.  maybe it was a busy night and she had to fill in for someone else on the other side of the restaurant, or maybe she had to take care of some business in the bathroom or something, but seriously, come on, disappearing for 20 minutes at a sit down restaurant is not cool.   Food is good.  their jack daniel's flat iron steak was particularly delicious that day.  not gonna complain there, but they seriously gotta do something about their service.  both timeliness and attitudes.  i read some of these other yelp reviews and it seems like i'm not the only with this issue.

Typical chain restaurant food, at least they're consistent! I usually come here for the Jack Daniel's Sampler, their battered shrimp, half rack of ribs, and Jack Daniel's chicken. It's a little bit of everything and will easily fill you up. Don't expect anything too healthy from this place though. Tip: They have happy hour all day Sunday and appetizers are half off. If you go with a lot of people it's nice to order a bunch of things and then share. Long Island was the strongest drink on their happy hour menu though the margaritas are a little too sweet for my taste.
I got food poising here!!! Was sick all night couldn't sleep! In addition my friend who I was dining with said she saw potatoes stored in one of the women's bathroom stalls!! Avoid at all costs!!!

Awful, just awful. I feel bad because the servers at the bar are all very accommodating and friendly, but I came here to eat and the experience was terrible. I couldn't imagine a more tightfisted and cheap restaurant where they try to skimp on everything possible.  I ordered a California club because it sounded delicious and it had avocado (my favorite).  The sandwich was on crap white bread with packaged turkey meat.  To top it all off, there was literally one sliver of avocado squished into the bread.  Don't advertise avocado if that's all you're giving.  I commented on this to the bartender who helped out by going back and getting me half of an avocado to eat with my dish.  They forgot my side salad too.  It seemed like the servers at the bar had some issue with the chefs in the back because nothing seemed to correspond. Maybe would come back here for a drink, but never again to eat.  Oh I didn't even mention that the sandwich sucked.  It sucked.
Unprofessional and unwelcoming staff. No one smiles!! The food was good, but I enjoyed their older menu from 2 years ago.

I went here around 1 AM last night with some friends for a late night meal and had a decent experience.  I'm honestly a little surprised the ratings are so low because I thought the food was pretty good.  It may be a little over priced in my opinion for some of the platters but it wasn't unreasonable.  The environment is really dim and the seats are really close together and a bit cramped. The orders from my friends were tomato basil soup, chicken noodle soup, shrimp margarita, long island ice tea, electric lemonade (adios), chicken fingers, a bruschetta, a steak, and a strawberry shortcake for dessert. As far as I could tell, the food was solid all the way around.  The dessert was extra delicious especially with the vanilla ice cream and the whipped cream. The service was satisfactory and friendly.  Overall, I can't say too much about it because it was A-Ok in my book.  I wasn't wow-ed by anything.  I'd only go there again if someone invited me to a party but its definitely not a daily restaurant type place.

My friend and I came in hoping to have some wine with our meal and I was not able to get any because they wouldn't accept my form of ID which clearly had my picture, my age, and was a government issued ID.

Not too good not too bad. It's honestly a grab-bag of mediocrity.  For starters the location is great, easy to spot. But with a side of horrific parking that comes with the Orange Outlets. The atmosphere is a plus, very energetic. They even have really nice service. But the true mediocrity comes in the form of their food. It's nothing special. It's like college dorm/cafeteria food, or food court status. In short: great service, okay food.

6 of us went tonight (Saturday) and decided to sit on the patio. It took quite a while for anyone to come greet us but other than that we had a good experience.  We took full advantage of the $10 all you can eat appetizers and $5 specialty drinks. Great deal!!!! The appetizers were hot and good.  They brought us out three rounds without a single comment.  Potstickers and Boneless chicken wings were great.  I'm not sure how long they're running this special on appetizers but we'll definitely be back.

Out off all the TGIF's in the OC we come to this location. The service is great and Daniel (at the bar) is amazing!!! The drinks are amazing and his sense of humor.....  Fuuuunnnaaayyyy!!! Daniel if you're reading this I want you to know I don't usually take the time to write reviews but you've exceed this customers expectations and you deserve 5 stars+.
Great place to wine and dine! Happy hour on the weekdays is amazing from 3pm-7pm. Clause was my tables waiter. He was really really good & very personable! I highly recommend this place

Very loud atmosphere. Food is okay. Our waitress did welcome us, but never asked us if we wanted any drinks, which we did. Took her another 15 minutes to come back and take our order. She was very friendly and may just be a bit overwhelmed at all the full tables in her section. Still, it took over half an hour to get our dinner, which should be unheard of at a chain restaurant. The very berry mohito was refreshing and delicious. The sizzling chicken and spinach was okay. Won't be in a hurry to return here anytime soon.

Although there is almost always a long wait, I can't resist coming here for happy hour. Appetizers half off and drink specials. I also love their black bean burger, it's absolutely delicious! The staff is friendly and the service is decent. It's very hard to find parking though so plan to be early and give yourself some extra time. People smoke cigarettes outside of the restaurant so try to find a place to wait inside if you don;t tolerate cigarette smoke. They have a heated patio with its own bar and TV, a full bar with seating all around in the middle of the restaurant, as well as plenty of tables and booths. Good place to go with friends or a date even. Conveniently located at the Outlets of Orange, it gives you plenty to do before or after your meal!

THIS PLACE DISCRIMINATES AGAINST DISABLED PATRONS. I am partially blind and at night can hardly see. I asked if they could change the tv to a bigger tv so I could see the news from my seat. It was breaking news around my area, and she said she would ask the manager. The waitress then told me that she couldn't change the channels they were reserved for sports. To top it off I get my main course before my appetizer, so I cancelled my appetizer. Then my boyfriend and I were given the main course with out any utensils. Thank you for losing a loyal customers.

I've only been here for lunch. I generally sit at the bar, much faster service. It's been a long wait in the dining room. The lunch menu is decent. The food is just okay with the exception of the Korean Street Taco, they are very good.

If possible would rate this place a ZERO !  Service is mediocre and unprofessional .  Food is very flavorless would rather chew on cardboard. Never and I mean never order a steak from here it was so disgusting could literally taste it was microwaved .

Had a very good experience here during the late night happy hour. RUBEN and ROBERT are great bartenders. They did an AMAZING JOB with my bf and I orders. They made great drinks and provided great service. We were very satisfied with the way they served us.

No Dave, I can only fault her for lying to us repeatedly. Not the technicality that she couldn't serve her with an expired ID. Your completely right. The dirty silverware, slow service, and overall bad experience yes, but on that single point your right. Way to bring out the detail you can win on Dave.
Good food, good service! Great ambience, if you like the noise sometimes. They take orders over the phone. Recommend!

Patron XO Cocoa Freeze. Jessica.  Ultimate Mudslide.  Balsamic Grilled Caesar Salad, Salad, and Dragonfire Chicken with the 2 for $20 special. Food tasted good.  Mudslide was sweet and delicious.  Salad was filling.  Nice ambience.

This place gives food at its most best quality!! I went in for their happy hour specials and you expect to save money!! All the appetizers are half price off and you can get them unlimited. The waiters are very respectful and Lee Ann is one of the best and funniest waitress I have ever been served by. She made sure my table was satisfy and was very attentive of us. The only down side is that the wait for your food is a little long. However its all worth it at the end.
Fast service and good food for a good price. Really good jack Daniels style and mozzarella sticks.  Decorations and atmosphere is amazing

wow! this place used to be great!! we went on a Saturday ..asked about specials . the waitress took forever explaining them and then informed us they were only good mon thru Friday....duh..ok so the service was slow, no drink refills...jack daniels sampler was ok but omg the prices are so outrageous!! 21$ -34$ for most entrees...my chickenwas ok but the broccoli and potato were disgusting. my mom didn't even eat her burger...no flavor dry meat...mcds is better...such a bummer..I would never ever go back

This place is a hit or miss. Service is normally okay whenever I go here (a few times a month) and the food is always great! However, when I went last night I ordered the Jack Daniels burger and it came out with the tiniest, hardest, wrinkly bun!! I told the server and she was shocked and took it back to the kitchen. She came back a few minutes later and said that they forgot to order buns and this is how it is. Didn't even offer any other food items or ask I don't know wanted something else instead. The first few bites of the burger was good (because let's be honest, it was literally only the meat so far - the bun was that small) and as I got further into the burger it was so dry and the bun wasn't helping. It was pretty stale. I ended up not even finishing the plate and just asked for the check. If I wanted a dry burger I could've gone to McDonald's and got one for 1/4 of the price!!

This review is based on how every time we come here our food is cold. ( and by cold I mean like half frozen still)  Baked potato - cold Fries - cold  Mozzarella sticks- cold  Potato skins - cold  We use to love this place, but they need too step it up, not once, twice, three or even Four times, today was the 5th time we got cold food.  I guess we will just stick to happy hour served all day on Sundays. After all the only way we love our beer is cold. ( lol)

I came here after a morning of shopping at the outlets. I was starving. We were seated right away.  I ordered the American stacked burger. Holy cow! That thing was incredibly juicy and so good! I wished I had room to order another. The Asiago cheese on it...wow..amazing. I might ask for extra next time. I ended the meal with the Tennessee whiskey toffee cake. It was huge - perfect for 2 people to share. It was so rich and yummy. I typically do not care for Butterscotch but it completed the dish.  The server was pleasant and very attentive. I would definitely visit again.

This location is never really that impressive. Food is ok, service is ok. Since they are open late, it is a good place to go after movies at the Block and be able to get a drink or a bite somewhere nearby.

I really went into this experience with no expectations at all because that would have been just foolish. We came for happy hour and drinks were fine and cheap. I was pretty excited about sharing a couple 1/2 off appetizers but got instantly bummed as almost everything on the apps menu is fried.  I scanned the dinner menu and was shocked, but not really, to discover that they don't serve veggie burgers? Weird... So I had a salad and to no surprise, it was pretty gross... (How do you f**** up a salad? Really?) If I ever return it will be for the happy drinks but would way rather try some other spot at the Block first.

i recently ordered the spinach artichoke dip "to-go platter" for an office lunch event. i was in a hurry to get back before the event started & the food was ready for me on time when i got to the restaurant. very friendly staff and swift service. a lot of dip and chips, enough to satisfy at least 12 people. definitely will order from here for the next event ;)

omg. worst customer service i have EVER experienced. Our bill was supposed to be $35, and they charged us $80. Our waiter was slow even though there was only one other group he was waiting on because it was right in the middle of the day (3 o clock.) He never came to check if we needed refills, and took forever when we asked for them. I even talked to the manager and all he said was "next time tell a manager ahead of time so we can get you new waiter." That's it. NO compensation or anything. UNPROFESSIONAL staff. I've been to this tgif 4 times and every time the service is just terrible. Stick to the one in Costa Mesa.

Lanette was an extremely poor server. Not only did she take over 10 minutes to take our food order, she screwed it up. After her mess up she was short with us. I don't know if she's new or having a bad day but she obviously did not care about her job or guests.

2 stars instead of 1: the service tends to be good. I had a gift card, so I ordered take out: a pulled pork sandwich with no pickles and a grilled chicken cobb salad.  I get the food home, and, of course, the sandwich had pickles on it the whole time, with the entire sandwich tasting fully of pickle. Good attention to detail, chef. The guy we bought this for gets sick from pickles.  The veggies in the cob salad were surprisingly poor, and it was perhaps the worst bleu cheese I've ever had. Thank God It was Free.

Great Happy Hour! So I went out to this fine establishment with my lady and some friends for the happy hour on fridays. We made it our thing to meet up once a month and eat together. Four months into our tradition the manager told us the happy hour wasn't going down anymore and that they haven't been doing it for two months now. We asked to talk to the manager and he said they haven't done the happy hour for 3 months.... We tried to share the fact that we've been coming for four months and it must have been a more recent change and they wouldn't bug on that. "We have signs posted everywhere." He said while pointing at the bar light up sign that was maybe 15 inches big. Will not be going back to this one. Found another T.G.I. Friday's that actually knows their happy hr schedule.

Not much of a restaurant, more like bad frozen food. However, I do love the Jack Daniel sauce, everything else you can make at home for cheaper. The atmosphere is extremely noisy and the staffs are decent. Everything is FROZEN! So what much can you say.

I ate there with my sister on a Thursday and the service was absolutely terrible. I would give it 0 stars! The waitress was overwhelmed. They are really understaffed. Poor management. I saw the commercial for the 2 for 20 deal and I thought it would be great but it wasn't. My chicken was beyond dry and seemed microwaved, cold and tough. The shrimp tasted old and rubbery. My sister had dragon fire chicken and she said it was "edible" but not even worth the 15 bucks. I'm hoping its not always like this. Ive been to other Fridays and they were much better.

Bathrooms are horrible here. I was afraid of touching the door handles so, I kicked the door open. Management should really look into this. By my own sanitary standards, I wash my hands after I go to the bathroom... and I use the very paper towels I used to dry my hands to open the bathroom door... but when I have to resort to kicking the door open because I am so paranoid of catching some type of fungus from the door knob, there is a problem. I left... let me rephrase, I ran out of the place as soon as I pay my bill. For those who don't believe me, you should look at the bathroom doors...

It would appear to me that T.G.I. Friday's is making a strong bid to blow their diner competition completely out of the water. This place, hands down, serves awesome food at great prices. I mean, awesome food. If this chain were a professional wrestler, it would be heavyweight champion of the world.  Over the years I've come to expect not so much from places in this category of establishments. However, I must give it up to T.G.I. Friday's. This place is outstanding. I've been here three or four times in the past 8 months or so, and it's been excellent each time. Fast, professional, and courteous service. Bomb food. And great prices. I know I'm sounding like a paid endorser, but I'm not.  This place is seriously just that rad. I normally walk into places like this and expect to get ripped off. But no. It's just flat-out radness. Every time. Go here. Have a party here. You'll not be disappointed.

So here I am, chillin' at The Block, playing some video games at Dave & Busters.  All is going well.  Then D&B says they're closing.  It's 12:55am and we just take off.  While in the parking lot, we decide to head to TGIF and enjoy some late night dinner.   From experience, I perform the following: call the location and see if they are serving the full menu or just the bar menu - due to the time.  Lady says "full menu" and that they are still open.  So we go!  (It's like 700 feet around the parking lot.) Now, bear in mind we've got our minds set on some totally mediocre food (because God knows TGIF doesn't serve yum).  My friend walks in first, and immediately is told by some employee (server, host?) that they're closed.   The time is now 1:01am.  He walks out before I can walk in with sad puppy-dog eyes.  It made me sad.  Then I look at the door, and it says "Open til 2am everyday".  So, I walk back in and find no employees up front at all.  I track down the guy who told my friend the bad news, and we have a few words.   Me:  Did you just tell my friend you were closed? (200 people in the restaurant eating, bar packed) Him:  Yes (no eye contact - sweeping something up).  We called last call earlier for drinks and food. Me:  But your door says open until 2am daily, and the door was unlocked. Him:  We can close down whenever we want actually (says the non-manager guy sweeping the floors).  You and your friends can come in and relax but there's no more food and the bar is closed.  Me:  *#@(%ing whatever. Now, let's use some charts and graphs to demonstrate the drama.   1.   This TGIF is located in a PRIME spot on The Block property.  This is The Block.  It's not some mall in some city that nobody might have known about.  This is The Block - people from North Cali know about this place.   2.   How are you going to close shop at 1 am  when local businesses like D&B and AMC are still open?  The closest Denny's is a short trip, and Norms is like 11 miles away (a damn parsec).  Bad game plan by management, on a damn SATURDAY night - people from D&B were gravitating that way - with me leading the way. 3.   Multiple reviews here regarding crap customer service and miserable employees.  I get you wanna be in bed by 2am instead of 3:30am, but really?  You're getting paid to say hello at the door.  Make your mommy proud and friggin' do it right.   This place is blacklisted in my book on sheer merit alone.  Good job.

Encountered a crappy waiter who wasn't friendly at all and couldn't get the side orders right.  Could of saw that coming!  And I believe there is a difference between baked potato and mashed potatoes.  I really wanted my mash potatoes too but the waiter seemed like she was going to argue till the end because sometimes "customers aren't always right". The food is alright but there's nothing special about it.

Went there to have the 3 course, 2 people for $20.  Highly disappointed.  Ordered the bufallo wings. it was so salty! It's almost like they soaked it in salt for 3 days.  The entree was so-so.  The only good thing about the whole meal was the dessert. The service was okay until the check came. It took forever for the waiter to come back with the change.  Waited for so long that I decided I couldn't wait any longer.  Decided to take back the tip and to just give him the change as tip.

Frist and formost this post is for anyone who dines or plans to seek employment now everything that is said here in this post is the truth frist off if you plan on seeking employment there don't waste your time this place is one of saddest excuses on the planet to even be called a restaurant aside from the GM management there are useless and pathetic the team work is non existent and from what I experienced the brief time i was there you do slave labor for crumbs not even enough to be called money the staff I worked with was awesome group of individuals I was blessed to work with management on the other hand is like working with a den of vipers they will go into the computer system and cash out half of your check to cash so you are stuck with paying half there bill how sad and pathetic your life is to do that to someone working there I't is one sad sorry site and they will also talk evil hateful things without once confronting the person pathetic! !! Now back to the crumb incident if your a server everyone knows you work for tips management so sad it reflects on the shady clientele that frequents this establishment a server can take 14 tables in one given shift and not get a tip on at the least 5 of those tables and extremely low balled on the other 9 ask any server that works there this is not the place for you my friend seek employment else where also they have alot of people running out on there checks they should just shut it down move else where have a great day you have been warned its a miserable dwelling  those who go in are upset when come out read more reviews love peace and chicken grease

Why oh why do I always have sucky service at this place? Don't get me wrong, I love the food, but some mistakes cannot be made up for. I went there for my birthday with friends from school, and it was total crap that our server took almost 15 minutes to greet us. We arrived around 6:40 (happy hour ends at 7), so I know she didn't want us to order happy hour food and have her bill be smaller. And can I say, she was not that friendly, considering customer service is part of her job. Everything was alright. My fish and chips were nice and hot, but my friend complained that her pasta wasn't warm, and some of the alcoholic drinks weren't so great, and our server barely checked on us. But the icing on the crappy dinner? THE SERVER DIDN'T EVEN CHECK TO SEE IF I WAS AT THE TABLE WHEN THEY BROUGHT OUT MY BIRTHDAY DESSERT!!!! I went to the restroom, so she ended up leaving it at the table. LAME. I know for a large party, the bill has an auto-grat added to it, but that doesn't mean you can just coast along with crappy service. And if you're gonna give crappy service, at least bring out the birthday dessert when the birthday person is at the table, dammit.

Okay!  It's Football Sunday and I believe this is a time that a restaurant needs to give 110% to it's customers.  Two issues with this experience. Service & Food Quality. The runner that delivered our meal to our table asked "Is there anymore, that I can get for you?"  I stated, "a side of ranch, please."   NO, ranch was brought to our table through the whole course of our meal.  What is the point for restaurant staff to ask such a question if they aren't going to follow through?  Second issue was the quality of both sets of french fries that were within our sandwich order.  They were cold and soggy.  Being an ex-fryer cook, it isn't that hard to make great tasting fries.  TGI Friday's I'd have to give you a D- for your Football Sunday Performance & we'll think again about returning.  Looks like "BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse will be a better choice next time.

My unlucky night out at this tgif. Our waitress Tarah is terrible! She should not be running tables with no training. We did not enjoy our food not because it wasn't good but the service. I love tgif but somewhere else next time.

Totally a fan of TGIF....it's a local neighborhood restaurant/bar with a cool laid back scene. I love coming here for their happy hours which includes half off appetizers and wide drink selections from 3-7pm and 10pm to closing. Also, all day Sunday funday. Jack Daniel wings are to die for and if you are a fan of their sweet special bbq sauce try the Jack Daniel ribs or steak and shrimp dinner.

Last night, I dropped into this location with my family. Everything was great until the food came out. Quality of the food is very important and I was definitely disappointed. I ordered the fish and chip and they were nearly burnt. I asked our server if he thought it was burnt and his response was that he didn't know, so I had the food sent back. While waiting for my food to come and staring at my family eating, I munched on my sons french fries from his chicken tenders. A lady in a green shirt (maybe the manager) came up gave me the refired item, but didn't apologize for the iconvenience. All she said was fish and chips fries well done. I compared my sons fries to mine and saw a big difference in freshness. His fries look as limp and soggy as if it were sitting out too long. So I asked the server again, what is the difference between these 2 fries. He had the same reply stating that he doesn't know. It is obvious that the fries we got were not fries and I wanted my son to have fresh fries, so I gave him mine and waited for new ones. I hate to complain, but an apology would have been nice. Not even our server aplogized. Customer service 0 points. My family enjoyed their meal though, so 2 stars it is.

Self seated myself at the bar top. Crazy busy happy hour. I was immediately greeted by Ashely K. Even with all the tgif madness she was attentive and informative. I enjoyed the pot stickers, hit the spot. It was my first time at tgif in oc. I will be back again thanks to Ashely.  I appreciate the great customer service.

Never really been much of a fan of Friday's and this one did not blow my skirt up either. This review is based on their happy hour which is from 3-7 and then 10-close, kudos on the extended hours!  What I had: Ultimate Blue Raspberry Margarita - I got it blended, it wasn't too strong so the flavor was pretty on point. Can't say it got me anywhere close to a buzz not even after the beer I followed it up with. Potato Skins - these kind of tasted like they were frozen and just popped in the microwave. Boneless Buffalo Wings - not the best I have ever had, but not the worst. I will note that I did get one wing which had a lot of fat, completely ruined it. Sesame Jack Chicken Strips - I was pleasantly surprised with the flavor of these. I'm not much of a barbeque or teriyaki fan, but their sauce made the chicken strips worth while! Pot Stickers - decent little dumplings. My first time trying pot stickers so I really have no other experiences to compare them to. Wouldn't say they are my favorite, but they weren't half bad. I enjoyed the sauce they are served with. The food is extremely average at best and nothing more, but the prices are great! We had six appetizers, four beers on tap, one bottled beer and two margaritas for only $60!

We had a pretty awesome time at T.G.I. Friday's last night.  We went there on a Friday, so we made an apt choice.  The place was super crowded and there was a wait but it went by very quickly.  The waiters and hosts were very accommodating and polite, which I appreciated.   We were very pleasantly surprised to learn about their special dinner - 3 entrees for 2 for just $20 total.  We decided to go for that deal and got the chicken parmesan pasta and a pork dish for our main course and ordered the spinach cheese dip (they're very flexible with which appetizer you decide to substitute in, as long as it's of equal or lesser value as the shrimp cocktail), and for our dessert we ordered chocolate fudge a la mode.   We did get drinks - a margarita and a mojito - which did add up (the 2 drinks added up cost almost as much as our whole meal did!), but the drinks were great and we still got a really great deal.  The meal was great for the price that we paid and I'd definitely pay a visit again.

3.5 stars: This is place is best to go when it's happy hour! My rating is based on their buffalo wings. They make the best wings here. That's what keeps me coming back here. Oh and half priced margaritas during hh. :)

Great atmosphere! Very cool and laid back people during the weekend.  Their 2 for $20 is a ton of food. We rarely take home leftovers and we took home almost a full portion. Their drinks were good as well. I believe they have an all day Happy hour on Sundays. Definitely worthwhile and we will be back soon!

This will be the last time I eat at TGIF!! I know that Lucille's serves way better smoked BBQ & steak!! You can actually see & smell their smoke pit at Lucille's that's when you know it's authentic! Disappointed in the ribs & the way my steak was cooked. I wish I can get my refund back. My home cooking taste wayyyyyy better!! Definitely not a place to eat steak!!

Cruised by on a Fri night. Was told wait was going to be  30 min. We got a table in 15. 5 min after happy hour but Ellie made it happen for us. Scooby Snack and a Mango Margarita on the way. We got the 2 for 20 and raised it up so so I could get Jack Chicken. happy with my choice and Ellie service was on point. The only thing that sucked was that we sat in patio next a door with a ton of foot traffic. Service gets a 5 star but only putting up 4 because of that dang door.

HAPPY HOUR! Mon-Fri 10pm-close. They should call it TGIM-F. Cheap cocktails, Happytizers, and 2 for $20 Meals! I came here with my friends 2 nights in a row because they offer great deals and are open late. Perfect for after work!  Drinks: the long island iced tea is yummy yet sneaky. The electric lemonade is good too.  Appetizers: -dumplings... alright but not great. -potato skins... 3 out of 4 people liked them. -fried green beans... not satisfying, and not as crispy as I expected. Entrees: -Prime rib... with noodles. pretty good. -Steak... bang for your buck. get medium-well otherwise it's too burnt. unless of course you're into that. you can't go wrong with loaded mashed potatoes. Dessert:  -Oreo cookie ice cream sandwich... just right for when you're finished eating and starting to crave something sweet., very good -Red velvet with ice cream... very good as well, big piece of cake and a big scoop of ice cream!

I should have posted this a while ago..... Worst possible service ever @ TGI Friday's located at 3339 Entertainment Ave Orange CA 92868. We arrived approximately about 7 pm or so originally with a party of 9 to celebrate our nephews graduation. We were originally told that it would be a 45 min wait. During our wait some other friends from the same graduation arrived so we decided to all to sit together. So our wait extended from 45 minutes about an hour or so which was fine by us because we knew or party went from 9 to 18. About 8:45 a table becomes available  but it's located on the opposite side of the restaurant far away from where our graduating children were seated and the whole purpose of going to dinner was to celebrate together. Both my wide and sister-in-law asked to speak to a manager and they told her the waitress that sat our party said she would accommodate us on the same side as our children and instead of being considerate and providing excellent customer service she said we follow a rotating schedule and that's why you are being seated on this side of the restaurant. Hadn't been here in ages. Went here for lunch. They added an outside patio bar which is a great idea.  The food was good as always but the service was for the birds.

Really super crowded but we received fast service and some great food! Went here with a couple friends last night.....went fairly late so didn't think it would be packed.....but man oh man.....we were up to our elbows in people.....the plus side was that we got seated in less than 5 minutes!!! Awesome right? They had this great deal where you choose two items.....one appetizer.....and an entree or a dessert.....really good choices....so ended up getting the green bean fries and the dragonfire chicken......I was tempted to nab the dessert but yeah we were all so stuffed by the end of the night! One thing I noticed that changed with Friday's, was the ambiance.....normally it's a bit darker and gritty but this location seems to have alleviated that....more lighting.....and the entrance got a whole makeover....kinda miss the old look....but hey, as long as the food is great right?  And it was =)
I love this place! It's cheap and great food!!the service has always been friendly, breadsticks are great, and the drinks are strong ! Regular here :)
