Great happy hour menu, cheap and good drinks.  Recommend the chicken skewers with the mediterranean sauce as well as the cheeseburger sliders. Cheap fries that is quit delicious.  Would def come back.

All day happy hour on Sundays is great, but not worth the dirty beer glasses and dirty plates and overcooked food. The bartender seemed overworked and stressed, but was nice about the issues we experienced. Spend a little more and go someplace else.

So it's TGIF.. what do ya expect right? ;-) Been here many times but went last night with a friend who had one of those dinner for two for $20 coupons and i have to say for $20 it was a steal. However, if we'd paid more than that I might not think so...  It came with a shrimp cocktail -- of which I had a grand total of two cuz the shrimp just didn't taste fresh. It actually tasted kinda stringy and didn't seem cold enough to me. Enough said about that.  I ordered the petite filet w/mac and cheese. Well, my steak arrived well done when I ordered it medium rare. I know, I know it's TGIF's BUT I can't eat steak well done so I had to send it back -- which they did with NO problem and promptly brought me out a medium rare steak. Now, the mac and cheese.. well I have to say that they got that one right cuz it was sinfully delicious! I'm glad I had that to munch on while waiting for my second steak. ;-) Dessert was any choice off the dessert menu so we chose the brownie w/ice cream. It was okay.. the brownie was a little crumbly (not fresh) but when smothered with ice cream and hot fudge, who cares. ;-)  All in all.. DEFINITELY worth the price w/a coupon. ;-)

They have this two for $20.00 special which is perfect for couples. You get an appetizer, (Shrimp Cocktail-medium/small shrimp), your choice of four entrees, I got the Dragon Chicken, and my daughter got the Chicken fingers, and dessert.  We got the banana split.  It was great. The service was good, it was 3pm and the servers were there for each turn.  Usually in the evenings TGIF is crowded and rowdy.  Off-hours I must say it was a great dining experience. The Dragon chicken was very tasty. It came with steamed broccoli, rice pilaf, and the grilled chicken was smothered with Mandarin oranges, and a salsa which was very delicious.  I'll be back.

I came here a few days ago..Saturday night around 11pm. Upon walking in and asking for a table for 2, I became a bit annoyed at the hostess' incompetence. I don't know if it was her fault or not, but she picks up menus and utensils and takes a look around the restaurant...scanning for open tables. Then, she goes, "right this way," and walks up to a table up the stairs, towards the bar..then goes, "oh..never mind," and walks us back to the front. walks us to another spot, *no luck, no seats,* goes back to the front. SERIOUSLY?!? i don't want a tour of the restaurant. don't you have some kind of chart of some sort that tells you what tables are empty, etc? not even a single apology from her. i know it's trivial, but her job is to seat people and she can't even do it properly.  so we're finally seated, and our server, thank God, was this really nice guy. he was all smiles, and polite. we ordered the cedar smoked salmon pasta, garlic chicken primavera, and a large glass of blue moon. i was unhappy with my garlic chicken. it was 80% sundried tomatoes and other crap. the sauce on the pasta was not good and tasted lemon-y. the salmon pasta was really sauce-y, but i love that! so i really liked the salmon pasta.  whenever i'm at tgifridays, i always want to try something new, but maybe i should just stick with my spinach dip and jack daniels plates..
Use to come here often for my favorite appetizer (Loaded potato skins) but now they're always cooked to a hard crisp and its just literally crap now. Hope the manager sees this. R.I.P.Friday's.

Worst place ever,  if you value your health stay away from this place, we ordered two beers, one beer was served in a dirty glass, this glass was so dirty it had crust on the glass from how dirty it was, I ordered a baked potato,  I found A PIECE OF A GLOVE IN MY POTATO, MEANING SOMEONE CUT THEMSELVES AND STILL SERVED THE FOOD THEY TOUCHED, after complaining about the food, the manager explained to me that it was a piece of a glove but nobody had cut themselves, which I replied with how do I know that? OBVIOUSLY SOMEONE CUT THEMSELVES ENOUGH TO HAVE A PIECE OF THE GLOVE RIP OFF AND LAND INSIDE MY FOOD, AND YOU HAVE THE NEGLIGENCE TO STILL SERVE IT, I was offered coupons but refused to accept them, FUCK YOU TGI FRIDAY

Tonight's dining experience was extravagant. I've been to many Friday's restaurants, but none have been this great. The Jack Daniels Chicken Strips were fantastic and the Cheddar Bacon Burger was cooked perfectly. That all being said, our server Nathan was what pushed it over the edge. He was charming, funny, attentive, and let's just say that if I could have just lathered him up in chocolate sauce I would have had him for dessert #yummy. Will be back again soon. Always ask for extra sauce and Nathan will oblige .
Great time tonight at TGIF, haven't been here in years and have to say the food was phenomenal. Great service, excellent food and manage Theresa was on point.

The customer service and our waiter were great, no complains there!!  1st complaint: they have a kiosk on the table to look at menus and there are games there too. My husband and I played a couple games as we were waiting for our food to come, when our bill came we were charged $2. There was no sign saying we had to pay for the games, if we would have known we wouldn't have touched the ziosk. If you're going to have in on the tables at least let us be aware. He gladly took off the charge for us..  2nd: my husband ordered a burger with fries, when his plate came he literally only got 4 fries (no joke). My husband kindly asked him "that's it" and the waiter brought him another 3 fries..  My Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta was Delish!!  Overall, my expensive was ok!!

So many haters. Let me balance the reviews a bit.  I came by with some pharmacists after a meeting and we were all about starving. Probably because we were an hour too early for happy hour we were seated quickly. We were really sad about the happy hour, but nobody was crying. Besides the food we got was bomb!  To try:  + Jack Daniel's sampler  + Loaded skillet chip nachos + Crispy green bean fries (++) + Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta (+++++  spicy!!)  There were some drunk chicks in the restroom trying to figure out how to use the paper towel dispenser. "Oh we finally figured it out!" "Too bad my hands are already dry." It was entertaining, and they fixed it right before I needed a paper towel.  I would come by again :)

This location is just OK. I came in and ordered food to go, service was a bit slow for being that they had just opened and it was still empty. I ordered the sirloin and salmon. The steak was just ok, salmon was good. I would choose a different place in the area over this one.
Love coming here with friends and ordering the strawberry margaritas. The staff is friendly and a lot of young people come here for happy hour.

I had the Jack Daniel's® Mixed Grill and chose the Steak and Shrimp which was delicious with a side of sweet potatoes and mixed veggies.  I didn't like that the veggies were mostly of broccoli, not a main vegetable I choose to eat with my meals. The service was good and prompt though and TGI Friday's always has a friendly environment.  A plus plus for carrying Alamos Argentina Malbec, one of the smoothest red wines I've had to date! Mmmm! Thank You TGI's! :)

These 5 stars go to Daniel at the bar. I came from BJs access the parking lot because the wait for a glass of wine was crazy long. Put the timer on my iPhone for 15 mins at bjs when Daniel brought my glass in under a minute. I will definitely be back!!!

Came here hoping for a better visit than last time, I cannot believe they were able to make it worse! We have to wait for a table for 30 minutes when there are over 10 tables open.  They say it is because they only a few servers but they have 3 bartenders and 2 host.  They are not starting off well.

How do you have a lobby full of patrons who are being told wait time is 15 minutes YET place is less than half full? We sat at bar instead... RESTROOM ALWAYS NEEDS ATTENTION HERE but Employees are too good to keep up cleanliness...

Been here for about 30 minutes waiting. Service is poor I ordered breadsticks twice,  they brought it almost I was  finish  my dinner.  Very loud atmosphere, clean  place and restrooms too. I don't recommend this restaurant!
Service was terrible... We waited over 30 mins for a basket of fries... If you are not willing to wait I recommend you eat somewhere else.

This place is good to eat at. My friends and I ate here before and I've got to say it has a nice looking atmosphere, good foods, and drinks. I just wish the second floor is alittle bigger. But other than that everything else is great!! :)

Came here with a friend. Got their cheapest deal (2 for $20). Our waitress didn't really smile, she seemed tired and not very friendly. 2 fpr $20: Spinach something Flatbread Appetizer -friend said it wasn't that great, i thought it was okay -seemed like just "frozen pizza" to him Balsamic Grilled Chicken Salad -was ok, nothing amazing -chicken was a bit dry Bruschetta Chicken Pasta -tasted like crap! Was bitter to the taste! Basically, cheap dinner, cheap food. There was a used glass cup filled with someone's leftover Margarita sitting right next to me the entire time, nobody bothered to clean it up. (we were seated in a two-seater table on the right side of the restaurant). Table felt sticky to the touch. Bathroom is doable. Regardless of THIS particular experience with TGI Friday's at this location, I did enjoy my visit at the one in downtown Long Beach. There, I got the bottomless loaded potato appetizer, it was good. Watch the calories, though.  3 stars because downtown LB location served it right and I forgot to leave a review for that one.

First and for most our waiter was AMAZING! Nathan thank you!!! However, my fiancé and I were a bit disheartened that the dinner for two entrees and one appetizer did not have a vegetarian option for an entree. So we were unable to get it. I did however have the fried green beans and they were sooo good.

My husband and I are visiting  Disneyland for the weekend. Drove up to the outlet mall and decided to try out TGI Fridays for dinner. The place was pretty packed. Grabbed a seat at an open table by the bar. Sat there for about 10 minutes before being greeted. The waiter was truly nice by truly nervous... I ordered a shrimp salad but was brought out a chicken salad. I didn't complain I just ate it. Wasn't in the mood to wait any longer for my food. My husband got the ribs, and shrimp with Mac and cheese for the side as well as fries. Mac and cheese was a tad cold but still good. Food is good here but not great. It's a lot like a Chilis or Applebee's.

Kevin was our bartender and was awesome. My plate stayed filled and my beer glass stayed full. He had personality and awesome customer service skills. They have happy hour all day on Sundays. Gotta check this place out.

I came to watch the NFL draft.  I came a hour before it started with a friend so we can make sure we got seats at the bar.  5 minutes before it starts and despite ordering food and several rounds of drinks, other patrons have a seat and ask to change the TV to a hockey game.  The bartender complies, so we get upset and let both the patrons and bartender know we were watching the draft.  Bartender took their side and we end up having to move out of the bar to a table just to watch it on a lone far away screen at a terrible angle because the restaurant was already packed.  Talk about service...

FAIL. my mom wasn't in the going out mood for mother's day so i wanted to surprise her and bring dinner.  a week or so before mother's day she was talking about jack daniel's bbq sauce. so me being the genius that i am, (my girlfriend actually reminded me) said i will surprise them with some TGIFriday's.  So in hopes of not having to deal with the crowds, i called in the order.  We found want we wanted using the menu online, on the nation website.  but apparently, they don't have everything on the menu. so i had to order on the fly.  the guy on the phone wasn't the most helpful nor could we understand each other.  I asked to have the order ready at 6pm, but he said we would put it in at 6pm. so i just went with it.  the food was supposed to take 15 minutes, so i timed our trek from south oc to the block accordingly.  we got there exactly at 6:15 and paid for our food.  the server mentioned he only put the order in a minute or two ago. say what? so i had to wait what seemed like an eternity. but it was like 20-30 minutes. good thing my plans were to be at my folks house around 7, because we did not get there until 7. the food was good. the service was not. would i got back? dine-in is a maybe. take-out is a definite no. unless they let me fax in/ email my order.

My mom and I went here for dinner. I have been here many times before, but this was just not the best of experiences. My mom ordered a mixed drink and she said it tasted like juice. So basically it was made very weak. Then for my main entree I ordered the steak with potatoes and steamed veggies. Before the meal came the waitress asked me if I would like A1 sauce. I accepted. Then when she walked away I told my mom, "A good steak does not need A1 if it is made and seasoned well, but just in case it disappoints, I want to have the sauce on hand." Needless to say I covered that sucker with A1... so you know how I felt about the steak. The potatoes on the other hand were whipped and filled with buttery goodness. The veggies were just steamed veggies. Nothing to get excited about. This would have gotten one star but the potatoes saved it!

Friday's.  I don't know what it is, but this place has fallen out of favor with me. Anyway, I came here for a friend's bday shindig.  They're pretty strict on seating restrictions and enforce times on large parties, so we got bumped from our original table to another, with less seating, which sucked. The food isn't overwhelming, but, again, you're not going for fine dining here. That said, everything is fairly par for the course.  But I would say that similar restaurants, like B.J.s, are strictly better.  One thing i was miffed about is that the waitress took my plate, which I wasn't close to being done with, while I wasn't paying attention. The staff is generally friendly, though. But given a choice, I'd pick a different place.  But since it's for one of my best friends, I'll let it slide... The atmosphere is a bit cramped and too loud for my tastes. Friday's, not as good as BJs

worst TGI experience i had i guess they really dont give you the A plus treatment during happy hour food was horrible of course happy hour food and service was slow AF food came out cold at least the beers came out super cold give them that i guess my TGI to go to is the one at south coast

Eh. Everything is average. I had a teryiaki burger one time. It was just ok though. I will say that their fries are actually pretty good. But besides that, food is average, service is average, and environment a bit crowded.
great place to go for some late night snacks and a few drinks. love that its open until 2am everyday and that they have happy hour twice a day. everyone needs to try the flatbread appetizer.

SERVICE: -Alan was our server (I still remember his name from over a year ago). -he was an absolute JERK -made my wife feel horrible, then ignored us for a 1/2 hour, b/c he couldn't face us. -had to ask another server to give us the bill (tipped her $5 for a 15 second conversation, tipped him $1) (bill was ~30) FOOD: So-so taste. If you don't eat out a lot, it's just typical american food the 2 for 20 deal is just alright (selection is a little weak) -ikea makes better ribs for cheap (yes, the furniture store) ENVIRONMENT: the whole restaurant is loud, kind of like a bar, but should be expected since everyone is letting loose. OVERALL: Due to service, haven't gone back in over a year.  We BOYCOTT  this restaurant.

I came here 2 weeks ago after a friend's basketball game and luckily we came right when happy hour just started so all of their appetizers were 50% off which was pretty badass. I ordered a half-sized Caesar Salad and it came with a breadstick which was very  yummy. Then we all ordered bunch of different appetizers because like I said, it was half off. So we ordered: Parmesan-Crusted Sicilian Quesadillas, Buffalo Wings, Friday's® Tostado Nachos, Sesame Jack Chicken Strips, Loaded Potato Skins. That day I didn't order their Flat Iron Steak. I usually always order that because it's really good. And their Jack Daniel's sauce is the best!

My hubby and I always go out for dinner on Friday nights after work with our 18 month old. This night, I really did not want to go anywhere because I was really sick with a cold. All I wanted to do is go home, eat homemade chicken soup my dear friend had made for me and go to sleep. My hubby had not eaten all day and wanted to go out after work. We went to TGI Fridays and this placed sucked! Our entire 3 course meal that was brought to us was cold. I didn't want to complain to my husband that my Jack Daniels Chicken Breast Dinner was cold when it arrived to our table cause all he would have done was complain to the waitress and we would have to have been their longer. Our soda pops did not even have gas in them. Will I be going back to this restaurant? Maybe, but definetely not to the location I went to: The Block in Orange.
This place is no bueno. They people that work here are miserable most of the time. TGIF sucks.
Nasty food! It's like fast food but on a plate (okay, well it's just a little better than fast food) Service is terrible, horrendous, and it's always crowded here.

Sucks! They either raised their prices or they charged me extra just because I wanted to order food to go since I didn't want to sit and eat in such a noisy and annoying establishment. Yeah, I get it, go there to drink and act rowdy with friends, but I just wanted to get a meal to go. Ordered over the phone (and why they try to take orders over the phone at the front greeting station where it's loudest, I don't know). I paid way too much for a small open face sandwich w/no side: $17.95. TGI Fridays WILL go out of business if they have raised their prices. Just give them about a year. They didn't raise the quality, or the quantity. Sorry TGI, but your food is only a small step ahead of Denny's, if at all. If you weren't drowning your patrons in alcohol then feeding them, you wouldn't be in business. Any crappy food tastes good when your drunk and/or wasted. Thanks for making me waste a $20.

I love the happy hour on appetizers here! haha. it's after 10pm and i think it's everyday. so the price would be around $5 for one order! cheeeeeap! i would usually order the spinach dip and buffalo wings. the jack daniel platter which is the ribs is super good too! mmmmm. so come here if you wanna kick back at the bar and have some good food (:

Came here on a Saturday night, and the place was PACKED. As to be expected, but the table we got was shitty, and I got a general feeling of uncleanliness about the place. It seemed like there was a light coating over grease on everything (I guess that's to be expected at a chain eatery). The drinks are big and cheap. My party ordered the special promotional menu (appetizer, entree, and dessert) for a ridiculously low price. Well, I guess that menu was popular, since we were told that they were out of almost every appetizer and dessert on the menu. Presentation on the food was terrible, limp cabbage leafs abound. I guess they really didn't feel the need to be too spectacular since we're not spending much, but still... Our entrees were good enough, the portion sizes were big enough to feed a whole family of 4, honestly. Come here expecting a lot of very cheap, greasy food. Expect nothing, and you will be pleased. PSA: The Jack Daniel's menu is bloody terrible. Stay away from it at all cost.

The Jack Daniel Strips are my FAVORITE!!!! The only problem is somtimes the people serving the amounts on the plates get stingy and try serving up 'Crumbs' instead of actual 'Chicken'. Thats NOT OK with me. I complain and then they realize that someone has caught on to them and they apologize and give a little more. I know we're in a reccession people, but come on!  And at $8 for a plate of these things, its wise to go during happy hour! The Jack Daniels Sauce is the BEST stuff!!!!

A guy I call BOG took me on a date here.  I tried this pecan chicken salad and it sucked.  I guess with Friday's, you gotta stick with bar food like chicken wings and onion rings.  The service was good.  My date talked to the waitress more than he talked to me.  Ok not really but it felt like it.  The place wasn't very crowded but it was a weeknight.  It seems like the block isn't ever very crowded though.

TGIF saddened me today.  This was my first time to the TGIF at the block and it wasn't a great experience.  We went in the middle of the day and it wasn't busy at all.  From the time we ordered our food to the time we actually got it felt like 30 minutes.  We never saw our server in between that time either and then once we got our food it took another 10 minutes for him 10 comeback and ask how we were and if we needed refills.  I like going to TGIF because they have some of the best prices on alcohol drinks whether it be during happy hour or not.  The only positive part of that TGIF was the server helping out one of my friends who was trying to get her turkey burger wrapped in lettuce instead of the bun.  Which he surprised us when he brought it out.
3 appetizers and a couple of brews for under $25 during happy hour. the reason we all love Fridays.

the first time i went, our waiter was slow and retarded-like he didnt speak english or something. but the food was pretty good so i decided to give it another shot. went here this past weekend with my family, our waitress dissappeared for half an hour. we asked several waiters where our waitress was, including the manager, and they all said "oh we'll get her." she finally appeared again and guess what-no apology from her OR the manager.  This place sucks ass. if you're looking for an enjoyable relaxing meal, do NOT come here. Service is TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE.

So I went for the first time with my girlfriend. I have never been to a T.G.I. Friday before, so I didn't exactly know what to expect. As we checked in to reserve a table, we took a look at the menu while waiting. We had a few questions and the guys at the front didn't really answer any questions. And when I asked, "When are your happy hours?" The two welcomers replied bluntly "It's not today." I felt slightly attacked. As we were being escorted to be seated by one of the two welcomers I've encountered already, he tried to take my gf's menu out of her hands while she was still looking at it. For a first visit, I was disliking my experience. Luckily, our waitress was a lot more welcoming and honestly made me feel better about how this restaurant employs their people. Overall, their food was pretty good. We got the dinner for two for $20 deal. It filled us up and I feel it's one of the best deals if you're on a budget. I didn't think their sliders were the best. We didn't get the shrimp cocktail which we substituted for sliders because my gf is allergic. The pork chop wasn't amazing, but it was satisfying. And for dessert, we got the Oreo thing. I love Oreos, so my taste buds enjoyed it. In the end, I would consider going back. If you're looking for appetizer, entree, and dessert for two at $20, this is good choice.

Ok, so after the four of us waited an hour outside to be seated, we then waited an extra 35 minutes for our food..... This whole time, i'm getting so hungry that at one point I considered eating my own feet..... Whilst waiting for the food, I noticed that everyone sat around us had their eyes glued to the tv's. It just so happened that we'd chosen to eat out on the night of a UFC fight.....which apparantly everyone in Orange had gone to TGI Friday's to watch.... So, the food comes and looks nice but ummmm, very minimal. I am not a big eater so there's ALWAYS food left on my plate but this time, I had finished and was looking under the table for scraps!! I mean come on, one small piece of chicken and three pieces of pasta pillows? Not cool!! The cleverly positioned sauce (spread all over the plate) didn't fool me into thinking there was more on the plate than there actually was, either! The ribs and steaks were apparantly good, but the tacos (which were not advertised as overly spicy) were in fact too spicy to eat and had to be shared among the more hardcore eaters at the table, resulting in one of us having nothing more than french fries and iced tea to consume. As if that's not bad enough, the whole place would erupt in screeches, shouts and profanity every 30 seconds because of the UFC thingy. I might have got a better deal by chewing on all the testosterone in the room.....it was ridiculous. None of us could hear ourselves talk and the staff just walked around like nothing was out of the ordinary. You may find this surprising, but some of us don't find the sight of two (almost) naked men rolling around on top of eachother, very interesting. Neither did I appreciate the people sat above me (we sat in the booth on the lower level so we had people directly at the side of us on the upper level) being able to look down and watch me eat, or inadvertently spit on my food each time they lunged forward at the tv's with animated punches, loud roars and bad language. Coupled with some of the women sat around pretending they knew what the fight was about and screaming whenever a punch was thrown, I was about ready to start throwing some punches myself!! The bill came to $90. I will NEVER go back there. Total waste of money, terrible atmosphere, sub-standard food.  If you're thinking of taking your crush here to eat, you might not get to second base....
The food is ok, a little greasy but ok. I hate how they took all the nik naks off the walls. But at least they kept the boat

Loud as crap in here. Everyone was getting hammered while watching Jeopardy. I thought that was an odd mix, but I was kinda into it. The tea wasn't the best, but the fries were alright. The best part is that they are open late.
Let's see what should I focus on! 1. servers are awful (rude) 2. this place needs more SECURITY 3. not a safe place (to many hoodlums)

Good happy hr prices, descent food not much else to say here. i guess you get what you pay for. staff doesnt seem very bright what was clearly my order was taken to the table in front of me i had to tell my waiter what happened by the time they realized it it was pretty clear to me theyre not very smart, dirty tables all around us, probably not coming back here again

Food is average but you can't beat Happy Hour here. Most appetizers are half off. I came here the other night with 3 friends and the four of us were full from sharing four appetizers. We got the potato skins, Jack Daniels buffalo wings, shrimp cocktail and nachos. The bill? About $24 after tax and tip.

Interesting how there are 0 5-star reviews here...just funny. Anyway, came here to party on St Patty's Day (weird right?). But no, the place was packed, they had a DJ on the patio and the dance floor was the whole patio! At TGIF?! Good times, wish I would have come here earlier instead of Lucky Strike...

Nice environment with decent prices. My wife and I wanted some draft beer and a decent appetizer, so we said let's go el torito but by the time we arrived half the world was there. We detoured to TGIF, well worth it. Good beer good food and good prices.

I used to love this place like 8 years ago. It seem the food quality and taste is going down the drain. Just the other day I had their new pulled pork sandwhich and it was disgusting. NO GOOD!! I like there happy hour and that is why I gave it one star. If I could give the food no stars I would. Blah!!

This location is cool but ever since they changed THE BLOCK of ORANGE to some other name this area isnt the same. It used to be a good spot to hang out meet new people but completely changed. Service was ok, but the meal size doesnt match the price of the food. I guess this spot is good for happy hour but to eat here i wouldnt do it again.

seems like when the economy tanked...so did the quality and quantity of the food at fridays. and of course...the prices went up i went on sunday night...place was packed at 930pm. we had to wait, my party of 4, for 25 minutes to be seated. sesame jack chicken strips, the best appetizer on the menu....now comes in like 7 pieces of popcorn chicken sized pieces. and for some reason the taste is slightly different than in the good ole days the ice tea was the same...i give them credit for not ruining that the jack daniels flat iron steak seems to have shrunk even smaller in size, my side which was supposed to be french fries might as well have been called FRENCH FRY(no plural since there were so few). and the taste isnt as good as it use to be. it almost feels like they changed the beef it took about 20 minutes after we finished eating for anyone to come to our table and ask if we wanted anything else...or a check oh yeah and somehow they added gratuity to our bill when we were a party of 4. the waiter disappeared for 15 minutes to correct this inaccuracy.  anyways...im disappointed. next time ill just go eat at el torito or alcatraz. this place was a rip off.
Good times on Thursday nights with the coworkers...we love our bartender GRANT, he's uber sexy. haha! Drunken nights here are the best. Just wish the crowd was a bit more mixed.

OVERALL RATING = 4 / 10 Overall FOOD = 6 What I had:    California Club  = 5    Jack Daniel's Chicken Sandwich = 7    Sweet Potato Fries = 6 Drinks:    Samuel Adams = 6     ATMOSPHERE = 5 SERVICE = 6 ---COMMENTS--- Went w/wife + friends. I think their Jack Daniel's entrees are pretty decent cause the sauce is pretty tasty. But overall, the place just doesn't strike much interest. For the same prices, there are so many other places that would make the experience much more worth while (and I believe they just raised their prices). Their HH is not bad, but same thing applies: I could list out many other places where I'd rather go for HH. A friend put it best by saying, "I would only go there as a last resort." I agreed. Eh... not looking forward to it, unless a friend really wants to eat there.  You may enjoy.
Two for 20...turns into 45 lol..just pick from the.reg menu...me and the wifey ate good, but she didnt enjoy the firecracker shrimp.  Kinda crispy..actually too crispy

After a long day we decided to get our grub on at TGI Fridays. We got here around 11pm on a Thursday and it was packed! Luckily we got a table right away cus my bf and his friend were starvin! I was ok bc I had 1/2 lb of Boiling Crab and 6 oysters just 2-3 hours before....yeah, I know, "and you still went?" right?  Yep! That's me! My eyes aren't as big as my stomach. hahhahaha.... I opted for the Champion Mac n' Cheese cus I lOVEEEE cheese! It was oh sooooo good!!! I tasted a couple different cheeses but I can only name 3. Gorgonzola, Parmesan, and white cheedar...correct me if i'm wrong... My BF and his friend ordered the Jack Daniels NY steak and shrimp dinner....I was so disappointed in it. IMO, the meat was tooo lean and the shrimp was unusually soft. Not in a good way though. Seems kinda like it would went bad if you let it sit out for another minute so they fried it up. IONO....just my opinion. I wouldn't order that if it was my last meal on earth is all I'm sayin. Shoulda tried the Champion Steak.
The food was good, i forgot what i ordered but it was shrimp. lol  the only thing thats bad was the price. it was tooo expensive in my opinion or maybe i'm just cheap.

I give it a 3 star because I love the dragon fire chicken dish. Everything else is average, too salty. The waiting time is too long and the food takes forever to be ready. I once received a dish with hair on the side of the broccoli. Literally hair as in shaving your mustache hair on the plate with broccoli covering it. What the manager did was a vague apology and not charging us for the dish. Thank goodness I only go there maybe once a year.

We used to come here all the time when we lived in Orange. They used to be very good. Good food and decent service but the last few times, the foods were pretty bad and the last time we ate there was like a year ago until last weekend. After watching a movie at the block, we decided to eat there since it has been a long time. I ordered "Honey something Salmon' while hubby ordered Chicken Ceasar Salad and Green Beans with wasabi sauce for starter.  Green beans still good except tht the portion is now half than what it used to be. Then came the main course. My salmon looked like a slab of fish that has been sitting at the counter for days and reheated at least 5 times! When I asked the waiter about it, he insisted that the fish is 'fresh' and cook only when ordered. Like I was born yesterday and never had or cooked salmon before? Not wanting to make scene (or got my food spit or whatever on) I decided to just ask for a new one and not argue with him. The replacement came looking better but still sorry-looking.  Hubby's chicken salad was according to him, 'good' although the chicken looked rubbery to me and I didn't even try it when offered. :P All I can say is that we are going to either Red Lobster or Outback the next time we are in tht side of the town.

Always good times at TGIFriday's.. Grant is the man! Drinks are always great, food is awesome.. Jack Daniels Chicken is the business. I will say this, if you do NOT like fights try and avoid going when Dodgers and Angels just finished having a game.. there will be blood haaaa
Very disappointed in the food quality.  Appetizers were very cold and old.  When the entrées came, they were cold as well.  Our server was great, but the food could have been better.

This TGI Friday's is a great place for food and drink. The only drawback is that it is SO popular that you have to wait most nights for a table. However, the staff really move to clean tables and seat waiting customers.  The food is always outstanding. Fish, steaks, lobster, are all tasty and prepared just right. Great appetizers too. Sometimes we just have several appetizers. Great beer selection as well. We look forward to our next visit to TGI Friday's at The Outlets at Orange.

2.5 stars. This experience was a big disappointment.. Usually its 4 stars... I went here with a party of 7 people. We did a call ahead and they were not busy and we still had to wait 10 minutes to get seated! WTF?! People who walked in, actually got seated before we did... We used the coupon buy one get one free entree with 2 drinks. Our waitress was nice enough to let us use three coupons for our group.  I ordered my $4.50 Blue Moon beer which was always good. gotta order your Blue Moon. I ordered the Jack Daniels Ribs with sweet potato fries and Mashed Potatoes. The ribs came out dry. I remember every time when I go here the ribs are usually good but last night was okay. It was dry but the sweet potato fries and mashed potato was good. Others ordered the Jack Daniels Flat Iron - they said it was okay...  Someone ordered a burger but i forgot to ask him how it was My boyfriend ordered the Jack Daniels Sirloin and shrimp and the steak was not that great. The steak was dry. He ordered his steak medium rare and the outside of the steak was a bit burnt and the corner piece was SUPER burnt. I guess this place is a hit and miss...

Absolute worst service I've ever received. My boyfriend and I came in at 8:30 on Wednesday and got seated within 10 mins. Not too bad for happy hour time. But it took 15 minutes to figure out who was going to take our order for drinks. We asked servers that passed by and they said "she" would be right with us. We asked another server and she was kind enough to take our order due to our server not coming to us soon enough. She took our order and brought us our drinks. Took another 15 to get the original server to great us at the table and take our food order. Food came pretty fast, although we did only order a starter to share. The server did check in to see if we needed anything. We had finished our food and asked for our check and waited a total of 17 minutes. I made eye contact with our server and waved my hand and she walked to the opposite side of the restaurant. CLEARLY she didn't want to serve us. We simply got up out of our seats and left. Yup we dined and ditched. I feel terrible for this business and the staff they are hiring. Won't return.
This location is horrible. Never had a good visit and a waitress that can't remember a cranberry and vodka isn't a good waitress and she spilt the first drink!

Been coming here for years... food's always been pretty consistent. I mean if you're going to a Friday's, let's be honest, you can't expect too too much. With that said, I've rarely had any issues coming here. Happy hour's amazing. Strawberry margarita on the rocks is always a hit with me. The chicken wings, pretzel with cheese dip and green bean fries with ranch are a must! For entree's their sizzling sirloin and shrimp is a dependable go-to with me, so is the pasta with cajun cream. And their strawberry shortcake with a la mode! :D Yes, please!

PROS: -  I've had a lot of dishes here including dragonfire chicken, shrimp cocktail, dumplings, Jack Daniels chicken. The food is generally good and in decent portions. - The ambiance is fun and lively. There is a big bar where people gather to drink and watch sports on TV. - They have happy hour. CONS: - There is always a line waiting to be seated.

If I can give a "zero" star for the experience my Fiance and I got during our last visit here I WOULD!  It was the first night coming back from D.C after being gone for the week and I was craving for their firecracker chicken plate and of course some margaritas so the "hubby" suggested going to the TGIF location at "The Block" so we can catch a movie after. BAD IDEA!  We sat ourselves at the bar area right in front of the bartender who seemed like he wanted to go home. Took over 15 mins to acknowledge our presences there and finally ask -"What can I get you?" Since he took so loong to ask us, we ordered everything all at once, drinks and food. Come to our surprise, he only wrote down our drinks...my ultimate margarita was filled with all ice and very little liquor and cocktail mix..and the hubby had a Shock-Top. The margarita was gross..tasted like a rotten strawberry infused sink water. Had my Fiance tasted it and he agreed,  told the bartender we wanted to change my drink and he straight out snatched the glass off of my Hubby's hands and poured it down the sink then walked off without asking what we wanted to change our drinks to. Comes back with the same margarita only tasted more watered down! So I told my Fiance, forget it, I'll just stick with it. When it came to asking for our food and why it took so long, he acted like we only ordered drinks, no food was taken down....-_- HELLOOOO WEREN'T YOU LISTENING TO US??? WEREN'T YOU THE ONE WHO TOOK THE MENU BACK AFTER HEARING OUR ORDER?...We paid the pity $8 on our drink tab and left, no tip, which is very rare for us. Next time, I'll just cook my own firecracker chicken at home then go out to the movies. Save us the trouble and embarrassment for rude customer service at this TGIF Restuarant.

Last time I went here with my husband the manager wouldn't acknowledge my UK Driver's License as a form of valid ID, ruined my mood completely as I enjoy having a drink with my meal. We got a mediocre trainee waitress who seemed like she wasn't in the mood to serve us, brought my husband drink refills by placing them down with force instead of carefully and politely.  I would prefer to be asked if I wanted to be served by a trainee or not. Food is fine, just a shame about the service and manager.

This was my first time here, and honestly, the food was nothing special. I had to wait quite a while for the food to come out, and it was all delivered at once. The lobster was flavorful and succulent, and the ribs were pleasant. However, the garlic parmesan wings were sufficiently bland. I probably should have ordered the buffalo sauce; maybe they focused on the flavor value of that more than of the milder wings. The price was good considering the size portion. I still won't be coming back anytime soon.

Very friendly and fast service. Will be back again. They serve Happy Hour prices all day in Sundays. Its best to order the regular sized appitizer and get it half off instead of ordering the appitizer from the 474 menue. I had the Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp entree. It was very tasty I just wish it came with half a size larger scoops of mashpotatos.
So just to update: they changed the way they cook potato skins! Highly disappointing now, they use just cheddar and they are more like potato wedges. I wish they would bring back old potato skins.

I used to love coming to this place for their potato skins, but that was when I was little and didn't know any better. Now, every time I step into this place, I always leave with disappointed. The host takes forever to appear and to take us to our table. The 2 for $20 menu has changed and is now very limited. Most of the entrees are finger food and what children would enjoy and they have cut back on a lot of their appetizers as well. The service is subpar and it took a lot of effort to get someone's attention to come to our table.  I only came here for the 2 for $20 deal, but now with this menu and the horrible service, I don't think I'll be bringing my palate and wallet here.

Their happy hour is the best at TGI Fridays. The green beans, the wings, the pot stickers, mozzarella sticks and all are good! They all are half off. The margaritas are good as well. The pastas are really good as well. Before they had the the combo deals. Whenever they have that its a must try!
I'm a fan of TGIF.  This location is by far the WORST from Atlantic to Pacific. Remember when Friday's had the best trained bartenders in the industry? They don't........
Fridays is always an good place to eat. The prices are right and the food is good. We celebrated a birthday party here for my son and everyone enjoyed it.

Stopped by at Happy Hour so this review is just for that.  Can't beat 1/2 price apps and a place at the corner of the bar.  Crazy noisy and busy.  Folks all around drinking discounted sweet libations and munching sub par fried food.  OK, maybe that's not completely fair, after all it's not, well, anything but TGIF. I had good service from the harried bartender, who knew that everyone was trying to fill up prior to 7.  She never seemed more than patient, even with a patron who wanted a full description of many of the menu items.   I had a well tequila and flat-bread and a slider.  Slider was OK, nice and oniony. Flat-bread was very meh.  I will definitely try something else next time, but there will be a next time.
Food is alright, but they have good happy hours and deals. I like the fact that they're opened until 2am during week days aa well.  Good late night alternative instead of Denny's but with alcohol!
Gotta love the happy hour specials here as you can't go wrong with the low prices. The bar area can get crowded and might have to wait to find seating but it's normal.

attentive and friendly. got the jack  10oz sirloin, baked potato and ginger slaw. Omg the slaw was fucking amazing i loved it and the potatoe was good needed salt but what spud doesnt. finally the steak ah i figured it out. cooking it rare was the best steak ever i normally get med rare or medium i think i know why now so many get rare. finally tennisey wiskey cake for desert. please bitches best desert ever

Happy hour here is the bomb.   Love every bit of half priced yummyness on Sundays.   On all the other days, forget it.   Don't even think about getting service in the bar area any other night.  You're just gonna get ignored.

I consider practically any Friday's good for what it is:  An acceptable place to grab something quick and easy, enjoy a couple drinks, and watch the game.  It's never going to be a five-star establishment, but you could do much, much worse.  However, I am writing this review to address a more profound issue. Reading these reviews, I've noticed that a lot of them like to go out of their way to give the names and physical descriptions of the employees serving them, after a negative experience.  While there is clearly nothing wrong with offering constructive criticism, I find it reprehensible to try to humiliate someone on this site just because they may have had a bad day on the job, or perhaps have not yet mastered it.  There is simply no need for it.  Criticism can be given without resorting to dragging someone's name through the mud.  It's low-class, and reeks of self-importance on the part of the reviewer. Yes, I'm pointing a finger at a certain few people here.  You all should be ashamed of yourselves.

6.22.08: Whats going on with me lately? Eating at places that I don't normally eat at. I was just hungry. I wanted to try something different. So I ordered the chicken and ribs combo. Chicken dry, ribs alright, and so I wanted a order of chicken wings.. That was not good either. The only thing I like the was the french fried zuchinni. That was really good. So fill my tummy with fried stuff and maybe I would have been completely satisfied.  Food is food! I wouldn't come back here unless its for drinking.

potato skins & jack daniels sauce. period. im staying away from bar food and such so I havent been to tgif in years. however yday the mother and i went to check out the new nord rack at the block and we headed to tgif for a bite. my mother LOVES the mashed potatos and so it was a good treat. food is mehhh but they have good deals and i really appreciate how sweet the servers are. they have amazing service here..constantly asking if everything was ok and accomodating my food allergies.  ps that bench out front has been broken for the past few years or so...REALLY? fix it or get rid of it people!

After walking around around the block we got hungry and decided to go eat. we walked all the way to TGI Fridays. When we got there they took our name and told us it was going to take 20 to 30 minutes, we sat there for over an hour, we saw so many people going in and getting seated, people that came after we got there,  even though they were bigger parties, so I asked to person and she said we are getting your table ready, 15 minutes later we get our table and its way the corner, had really bad lighting and our table was blocking the emergency exit. We were really hungry at this point so we went ahead and ordered. appetizers pretzels were really salty and our food took way too long to get there. Our drinks didnt get refilled unless we ask for. Personally my food was horrible I order a hamburger and it looked like it was just thrown together the patty was broken into pieces  before I even started eating and had no taste, the French fries were really bad taste it old and salty we didn't get napkins we have to ask for them and the service it was just horrible I don't think I'm ever going to go there again... I understand if i got treated like i did it i was complaining but i was nice and didnt say anything at all.. Server did come by and asked how was my food and i said it wasnt that good.. He just smiled and took it. Horrible service.. Very inaccurate waiting time and dont do first come first served.. I go the tgi by my house all the time and does not feel like the same chain of restaurants at all.. Sorry but you suck!!

3 people and 20 minutes = 1 wheat hamburger bun. I've come here a few times lately for lunch with co-workers and I always wonder if there is anything remotely healthy on this menu. I let my friend order for me and he gets me the Asian Chicken something or other. I stare at him and say, "What's that supposed to mean?" He's a huge German albino so it was funny. At any rate, I've tried various items on the Friday's menus throughout the years and so far, it's all been mediocre. It's not bad, but it's not all that great either. The food is on par with what you would expect from a step above Denny's. *shrug* It'll do in a pinch. I won't list off all the things I've tried because that would take forever, but generally speaking, Friday's across the board are good enough for what you're looking for. Just don't expect anything stellar. This particular location is cramped...though I'm not too sure if that's the theme/goal of every Friday's. I can't remember what the other ones looked like. The service is DREADFUL and very slow. Again, I can't remember if this is applicable to all locations. Drinks don't get refilled. Slow service. Clueless servers who can't figure out if they have wheat bread. No attention given after order is brought to the table.  Overall, 3/5 because it's a C. No more. No less.  And I don't drink anymore and have never drank at a Friday's so I can't really review the bar aside from it being elevated in the middle of the regular seating which is, in my opinion, horrible because no matter where you are, you're exposed to the drunken masses. I for one would imagine that a choice is given in seating so as to present the option of bar or non-bar atmosphere, but if the alcohol is smack in the middle of everything, then what's the point of having regular tables? I don't get it. Maybe it's because it's in the Block. *shrug* Regardless of my whining, I'll most likely come here again multiple times because it's so close to my work.

So sad the quality of the steak we received even a dog would find hard to chew. We ordered a new one that arrived 30 mins later which by that time we were over it. The kind manager Theresa offered us nothing but a doggie bag, to take the wonderful cold steak home. A totally terrible experience and as for customers service the manager Theresa needs proper training and compassion. I will not return to this location ever unless I feel like shitty food, the only nice thing was our waiter.. Who was kind enough to send that manager over to help.??? Wow TGIF really know how to hire....

If I could rate it no stars I would.....my food was mediocre. That wasn't the worst part....my sister ordered a sandwich we didn't know it included hair!!! After they apologized and changed her order two bites in another hair in her second plate!!! We left hungry and disgusted. Only plus side the waitress was nice and seemed honestly sorry. Wont go back for food ever!!!!! (drinks eeeeh)
I normally love the food but tonight the jack shrimp was over cooked ...but all and all still good food

Sitting in our booth, my boyfriend and I agree that this has been by far the worst experience we have had while dating. We were seated by a pleasant host...She offered us water.  10 minuets roll by, plenty of staff pass our table in the mean time & not one acknowledge us. I have to ask another server if we have a server. Shortly after a lady comes by and asks us if we are ready to order. No apology for her taking so long at all. She takes our order and about 15 minutes later our starters arrive cold, tasteless and missing sauce in the ramekins.    We sent back the chicken strips and had the same plate brought back to us 5 minuets later only to be warmed up. LOL they tasted oh so fresh. I could go on with our visit but I'm done wasting my time. Just thought people should know that this establishment is a waste of money. I've been here plenty of times between 11-8, very nice, but the late night crew is not as great.  So disappointed with this TGIF:/

Came here with my family on a friday night. Wasn't too busy for the time we went. Our waitress was a little rude and didn't help us clean up when we told her about our spill. She was either awkwardly shy or jusy very unsociable. Made us feel uncomfortable when we wanted to ask for stuff. So we just didn't. Food was good. Just service was terrible

This review is based on their Happy Hour. As someone who savors a deal, TGI Friday's has an awesome happy hour that's worth checking out. With menu items starting at $1.50 for a cheeseburger slider or a plate of fries to $3.50 20 oz domestic beers and half off appetizers, it's easy to have a great meal for cheap here. While the food is great, this establishment is only getting 4 stars due to service. I've been here multiple times for happy hour and have the same setbacks each time. First off, this specific Fridays gets crowded during happy hour which is great for them, but depending on where you sit you can have ok to horrible service. Sitting at the bar is ideal for efficient service, but if you sit on the tables surrounding the bar, expect to wait at least a half an hour for someone to hand you a menu.  Today I went again with the boyfriend and we waited almost 20 minutes to be given a menu, followed by another 15 minutes for them to take our order, 20 minutes to be given the wrong food, and over an hour to be given the check after having to literally tap an Asian employee on the shoulder to get his attention. If you're coming for 3-7pm happy hour, plan on getting here at 3 pm and not leaving until after 5 due to service.  My only other bone to pick is they don't cut off patrons who have had too much to drink. I can't speak for all bartenders as I have never noticed other guests being rowdy, but tonight there was a group of three guys who left their seats and decided to stand right in front of our table (literally touching our table) and being loud, spilling their beer every now and then, and making sexist comments. Fridays."

This place is just a hot mess. Overpriced food and drinks. I came here for dinner and ordered the 2 for $20 deal. It's been a while since I have been to a Fridays and it will be a while before I go back. The service was pretty good but the food and drinks were disappointing. No Bueno!

Went there during lunch, it was pretty empty, the food was as expected, and service was pretty fast which is generally what I look for in a lunch spot.
I love the food and service.  My favorite is their Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp. It's always cooked to perfection.

This TGIF's is like the any other one. Food is a hit or miss but service at this one is always slow or its fast but they never come back and check on you. the happy hour is great but i always leave bad tips because the service is horrid and i am a server.

It's true. Bartenders there are nice as hell.

Yes, I was a flair-bedecked TGI Friday's nightmare.  I "sizzled" my descriptions of appetizers and fruit smoothies like a walking thesaurus on crack.  I gushed about the mudslides, I raved about the french onion soup.. I never ever let your pony-tail be helium-free on your birthday.   Like all good teenagers though, I grew out of Fridays and moved onto Cheesecake Factory and other reputable chains.  Somehow though, I just can't seem to shake the cravings for TGI Friday's food.  What is it about restaurants that get under your skin?  Bennigan's, Friday's and the plethora of other chains I worked for somehow have a certain brand of seasoning that seeps into your pours and makes you question life without it.   To this day, I can't drive by Friday's without craving a blackened chicken sandwich with seasoned fries.  I can still smell it on my pillow case and yet that doesn't deter me from wanting more.   Luckily, my Chain-Snob hubbie refuses to enter this establishment so I'm usually safe.  But I can't help wonder how they do it.   P.S.  I still have my suspenders and red and white striped shirt.  I can't help it.  I'll always be a waitress at heart.  P.P.S- I have to give them MAD PROPS for taking on their "Small Portions/Small Price campaign.  Take that you obesity ridden Claim Jumper!!!!

3 1/2 stars. The Cinnabon Cheesecake pushed it up a lot. Maybe I'm naive and simple-minded, but I genuinely tried TGI Friday's simply because of the 3 course menu commercials. I'm a sucker for deals and choosing things myself. So after some persuasion, I convinced my boyfriend that TGI Friday's would be delicious. But it was really a hit-or-miss for me. The value of the 3 courses was great as it was$13/each for two appetizers, two entrees and two desserts.  The good: -Cinnabon Cheesecake. I should've convinced my boyfriend to order this one too so I could somehow con him out of his share. Can't go wrong with cheesecake and the cinnamon-y-ness is great.  The okay: -Oreo chocolate cake. It was a little dry. Like I said, we should've gotten 2 cheesecakes. -Crispy fried green beans. Too much in one order considering it's technically an appetizer for one, but it was pretty okay. It was overwhelming after a while. The bad: -Fried mac & cheese. I'm sorry but this doesn't work for me. It was a little dry and the cheese was more stiff rubbery than creamy. We each ate 1/2 piece and left the rest. Too bad because they give you a lot of this too. -Sizzling Chicken and Cheese. Too much cheese. I like cheese but way too much. The mashed potatoes were good but also covered with cheese. -Bruschetta pasta. Meh. It just didn't taste right. I can't point out the obvious badness, but it's just all over not tasty. Service was rather poor and non-existent. I've had phenomenol service at a Friday's before, but it wasn't this one. The food took a loooong time to arrive, or maybe I was just hungry? I never saw our waitress. Maybe it's because the tip would be higher at a table of 4 or more with all steaks/ribs/shrimp unlike our table of 2 with 2 special menu orders? Ifyou're a big eater, swing by before the special menu is over. It's really a good value. Just don't expect A LOT in terms of service or quality.

Pluses: This is a TGI Fridays. If you're familiar with their food and drinks, that's a plus in and of itself. If you're going to be liquoring it up, get something with the words "Ultimate" on it. The size is supposed to get you tipsy, and they normally don't skimp on the alcohol. I used to get the Ultimate Mudslide, but alas, they don't serve it anymore. You can never go wrong with the burgers. Just make sure you make a fuss that they're cooked the way you like them. The Jack Daniels menu is always decent. Minuses: ---sigh Where do I begin? Instead of going into a treatise about the slow decline of the Great American Restaurant chains, allow me to present my pieces of evidence to illustrate the decline: * the slow service, it was hard to find for us to find people even though it was 1PM and there wasn't a lunch crowd on a Monday. * the lackluster food. The thing that me and Maureen C. actually liked was the appetizer, in this case, the flatbread. Everything else was forgettable. Verdict: Go into the Block or whatever they call this place now, and eat in there. You will save money, and you will be more satisfied. If you're willing to take a gamble and be disappointed, this is the place for you. We took that gamble, and lost. We're just glad that the food wasn't bad. Sad to say, it wasn't good either.
